She plans to buy wholesale fabrics with it, because she has a contract with a high school to make uniforms.  With the loan, she will continue in her goal of growing and enlarging the capital of her work, so that she can continue generating a better wellbeing for her family, made up by her 14 year old son.

loans.use: buy wholesale fabrics

loans.name: Irshad Group

texts.en:
Irshad is a 42-years-old married woman, living in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is into a business of refreshment selling in the area near by his house and he has been into this business from 4 years now before he use work as a waiter than he started his own cart of selling refreshment so to earn profits to run his family
Her husband's stall has a better earning and several customers who are regular customers and sometime also takes orders from  people for take away. This business yields a good income for her husband, but his family's needs are increasing day by day and he needs more money to afford household expenses. Now, he wants to buy more raw materials for the making of the items for his business. This is why his wife Irshad,  applied BRAC Pakistan and wishes to obtain a loan, so that her husband could buy raw materials for his business.
She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for her husband's business as well as for his family.
Irshad thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan for this  support cycle.

loans.use: To buy gool gapa raw material for her husband.

loans.name: Willian Isai Lopez

texts.en: I have had my barbershop for three years.  Most of the young people in the neighborhood come to me for their haircuts.  Now that my business is established, I am going to improve its appearance to give my clients an even better experience.   This will bring in a new type of client to my shop and improve it's reputation even more.

loans.use: Remodel shop

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.en:
My name is Reyna C. and I make and sell special tortillas for tacos. I have had my business for 4 years and I have a good clientel because I only work on commission to sell tacos in different cafterias. My business generates enough income to support my family and my goal is to expand my inventory in order to have higher sales. With the additional earnings I will be able to remodel my store and to hire someone to help me make my tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Reyna C. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas especiales para tacos, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que yo trabajo solo por pedidos que me hacen diarios para vender tacos en diferentes cafeterias, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios y asi tener una mayor venta de mi producto y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio y contratar una persona para que me ayude con la produccion de mis tortillas.

loans.use: To purchase cornflour, calcium, salt, firewood, matches, coal and bags.

loans.name: Jumah

texts.en: Jumah is 30 years old, and almost as many years experience in carpet weaving. He has one loam and has 6 students. He is requesting a loan of $600 so he can purchase another loam and materials which will enable him to produce more carpets and increase his income. His goal is to bring positive changes to his life and support his family economically. He also enjoys teaching his students to weave fine carpets so they can have a skill.

loans.use: To purchse yarn, color and other necessary materials

loans.name: Mavsuna

texts.en:
Mavsuna has sold women's clothes in Panjshanbe for over 4 years. She sells in a shop located in the center of the market. She is married and has 2 children who are in school. Mavsuna has a university degree as an engineer. Unfortunately, due to economic conditions of the country, she could not find a job with her major. So she took up the sale of women's garments.

Mavsuna became a client of Micro Invest in 2006. That gave her an opportunity to start her own business while simultaneously being a salesperson in the shop. Her idea was welcomed and supported by the shop owner who is in fact her employer. Her products are traditional Tajik dresses that are sewn in local sewing workshops. Her husband has helped Mavsuna to negotiate a contract with several sewing-workshops and knitting-workshops who prepare Tajik dresses for the market.

Mavsuna wants to expand her garment assortment with modern clothing that is in high demand by Tajik women nowadays. To expand her business in this sphere, Mavsuna will need extra capital, so she is requesting a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: Import of garments from Turkey

loans.name: Venicio

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. Venicio has a store where he sells basic goods as well as seafood at wholesale prices. He started his business 7 years ago with little merchandise, thanks to a loan given to him by a financier. His wife and his sister-in-law help him in his business and now, his business has grown and he has multiple sales.

Use of the Loan

He wants to use the loan to buy more merchandise for his store since the number of customers has increased nowadays.

Personal details

He is 40 years old and has three children. He lives in a cement home and he has good family stability. His goal is to grow his business and one day, to be able to better attend to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

El Señor Venicio tiene una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad y también vende mariscos al por mayor, su negocio lo empezó desde hace 7 años con poca mercadería y con un capital gracias a un crédito otorgado por una financiera, en el negocio le ayudan su esposa y su cuñada, en la actualidad su negocio ha crecido y tiene varios pedidos.

Uso del Préstamo

El quiere invertir su crédito en comprar mas mercadería para su tienda ya que en los últimos días sus clientes aumentan.

Información Personal

El tiene 40 años y tres hijos, su vivienda es de cemento y su estabilidad familiar es buena, su meta es crecer con su tienda y un día poder atender mejor a sus clientes.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Remigio Julio

texts.pt:
Remigio is not married but lives with his girlfriend with whom he has 3 small children. He joined the credit program in 2005 when he sold clothes. As his business grew he also started to sell kitchenware. He works with his girlfriend and all his children are in school. In the future Remigio plans on building a home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Remigio e solteiro mas vive com uma mulher com quem tem 3 filhos ainda pequenos.Entrou para o programa de credito em 2005. Na altura vendia apenas roupa. Mas porque o negocio foi cresceendo, iniciou tambem a venda de loica.Ele trabalha juntamente com a sua mulher.Os filhos ainda nao vao a escola.Mas segundo ele logo que tiverem idade para tal, ele nao tera problemas em pagar a escola dos seus filhos.Com os rendimentos pensa no futuro construir uma casa propria porque a que tem agora e alugada.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia is 50 years old, and is married with four children. She is the owner of a business where she sells a wide variety of beverages and products for daily consumption, an enterprise she has owned for more than 15 years.

Of the items she sells we can list sugar, noodles, dairy products, canned products, etc. She notes that, for a few months she was sick and on bed rest, an episode that caused her to business suffer and did not allow her to restock her inventory.

For this reason she is today asking for a loan, given that she would like to reactivate her business with the purchase of basic necessities such as oil, sodas, candy/confections, noodles, flour, fruits and vegetables, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lucia tiene 50 años está casada y tiene 4 hijos, ella es propietaria de un negocio donde vende todo tipo de bebidas y productos de consumo diario, posee el negocio hace más de 15 años.

Entre otras cosas que vende podemos citar azúcar, fideos, productos lácteos, productos enlatados, etc. Comenta que hace unos meses estuvo enferma y con reposo, por lo que el negocio quedo descuidado y sin posibilidades de reponer las mercadearías vendidas.

Es por eso que hoy solicita un crédito, ya que desea reactivar el negocio con la compra de mercaderías al por mayor tales como aceite, gaseosas, golosinas, fideos, harina, frutas, verduras, etc.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as oil, sodas, candies, noodles, flour, fruits and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Militza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Militza del Carmen is a member of the communal bank Los Jazmines (the jasmines). She is originally from Chachapoyas. She spends a lot of time in the city of Moyabamba and works selling products such as yucca, bananas, tomato, lemon, corn, and seasonal products. She also sells animals such as chickens, ducks, pigs, and turkeys in a stand she has in the central market of this city. In addition, she walks around the market and nearby streets offering her animals for sale. She decided to start this business because she likes this activity, being in contact with people. She also likes being in control of her own time, because in the past, she had been a cleaning lady and couldn't think of a better idea than to start her own business to be able to generate her own income, increase her self-esteem, grow as a person and as a woman, and contribute to the expenses required to support her children.

This loan for S/. 1,500.00, which she will pay back in 6 months, will buy animals such as chickens, turkeys, pigs, and in this way she will take advantage of the Christmas season. She will also buy products such as coffee, which is coming into season, and products she sells daily, such as sacks of yucca, corn, lemons, etc. With these products her business will be well stocked and her customers will be able to find the products they are looking for, very fresh.

Militza is 39 years old and has three children, one still a small child. She is happy because she can count with the support of her husband and she now has a person to help her with taking care of her young son, because this business requires a lot of hard work. Thanks to her hard work, the financial situation of her family has improved, and her self-esteem has increased as well. Her goal is to have a business selling grains.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Militza del Carmen es socia del banco comunal Los jazmines, es natural de Chachapoyas, vive mucho tiempo en la ciudad de Moyabamba y se dedica a la venta de productos de pan llevar como yuca, plátanos, tomate, limones, maíz, y productos que están en su temporada, también vende animales como gallinas, patos, cerdos, pavos en un puesto que tiene en el mercado central de esta ciudad, además recorre el mercado y alrededores con la venta de sus animales. Decidió iniciar un negocio porque le gusta esta actividad y quería estar en contacto con la gente y ser ella quien controle su tiempo porque anteriormente trabajaba como empleada doméstica y no tuvo mejor idea que emprender su propio negocio para así generar sus propios ingresos, alimentar su autoestima, crecer como persona y mujer y apoyar en los gastos que requiere sacar adelante a sus hijos.

El préstamo de S/. 1 500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará animales como gallinas, pavos, cerdos y de esa manera aprovechar las fiestas navideñas, también comprará productos como café que ya se viene la cosecha y productos que vende a diario como yuca en sacos, maíz, limones, etc. Con esos productor podrá tener un negocio bien surtido y sus clientes encontrarán los productos que buscan y bien frescos.

Militza tiene 39 años y tres hijos, uno aún pequeño. Está contenta porque cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y ahora ya tiene una persona quien le apoya en el cuidado de su pequeño hijo porque es muy sacrificado lo que hace, comparte su trabajo con las tareas domésticas. Gracias a su trabajo la situación económica de su familia mejoró, igualmente mejoró su autoestima. Su meta es tener su negocio de venta de granos.

loans.use:
Buying small animals (chickens, turkeys, pigs). Buying coffee and other products (yuca, corn, lemons, etc.)
(Compra de animales menores (gallenas, pavos, cerdos). Compra de café y otro productos (yuca, maíz, limones, etc))

loans.name: Seudimia

texts.en:
Seudimia C. S. has a business selling fish in the city of Bellavista, San Martin.  She sells her fish in the main market of Bellavista at a stall she rents.  Seudimia wakes up early everyday to sell talapia, boa, and gamitama.  She has been selling fish for 7 years so she has many faithful customers and knows exactly what they like.

Seudimia is a widow and has 3 children.  Two of her children are grown but she is still working hard to save money and send her youngest to a university.  She wants all of her children to have more opportunities to advance in life than she did. 

A member of the community bank Nuesta Senora de Guadelupe, Seudimia is requesting a $350 loan that she will repay over six months.  With the loan she will be able to increase the variety and quality of fish she sells.

loans.use: To inventory her inventory of fish

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Pol, 47, and her husband have been married for twelve years. They have one adopted son who lives with them. Pol and her husband have been in the business of weaving silk and raising pigs for twenty years. Weaving is a skill they learned from their mothers in 1988. Their son is also a silk weaver. Pol and her family live across Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 
Pol is requesting a loan in amount $1000 from MAXIMA for the fifth time. She will use this money for expenses related to raising pigs and buying silk material for weaving.

loans.use: For expenses relatead to raising pigs and buying silk material for weaving

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo lives on Buenos Aires Avenue, in the San Martin area, city of La Paz. He lives with his wife and children. He owns a taxi with which drives every day in order to generate his income. The loan he's requesting is to purchase tires and to help maintain the good working order of his taxi so he can continue to generate income and support his family. Ricardo has a good credit history and has fully paid his previous loan through Kiva. He's qualified for this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Ricardo vive en anticretico en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposa e hijos. El tiene un taxi con el cual trabaja todos los días generando así sus ingresos para subsistir. El crédito que solicita es para comprar llantas y mantener su herramienta de trabajo en buenas condiciones y continuar generando ingresos para la familia. Ricardo es cliente que ya tuvo un préstamo anterior a través de Kiva, el cual ha sido pagado en su totalidad. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To purchase tires for his taxi. (Compra de llantas para su taxi)

loans.name: Ruth's Esuvat Group

texts.en:
Ruth is 26 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her children are 10 and 5 years old. Ruth sells clothes, or batik. She began her business in 2003, and has worked everyday from 8 AM to 4 PM. She earns a monthly average of $140 from her sales.

Ruth would like a loan to purchase more clothes and expand her business. Her subgroup members would also benefit from this loan, and they sell charcoal and soap.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (batik) for her business.

loans.name: Karin

texts.es:
Karin lives in the Calleria District of the Ucayali Department, and belongs to the Damas del Oriente Comunal Bank. Karin is 31 years old and has three children. Her husband works in security but his income isn’t enough to cover the family’s expenses, so Karin used her first loan from Manuela Ramos to begin selling perfumes and clothing. Now Karin wakes up at 7am to make breakfast for her family, then delivers beauty products for her business until 5pm. With a loan of 700 soles Karin will buy large quantities of perfumes and other beauty products. She’ll repay the loan in 4 months. Karin works tirelessly in order to achieve the objectives that she has set for herself regarding the wellbeing of her family. Karin’s greatest wish is to give her children everything that they need as she watches them grow up.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Karin pertenece al Banco Comunal Damas del Oriente, ubicado en el Psj Cleto Martínez No 100 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es Seguridad, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no le alcanza para su economía familiar, es así que Karin con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de perfumería y venta de ropas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de productos de bellezas, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego se dedica al reparto de sus productos a sus clientes hasta las 5 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará mayor cantidad de perfumes y otros productos de belleza. Karin esta trabajando de manera incansable para lograr los objetivos trazados por ella misma para el bienestar de su familia, su mayor anhelo es ver crecer a sus hijos dándoles lo que necesitan.

loans.use: Karin will use the loan to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Bilquis

texts.en:
Bilquis baji, a wife of A. M., lives in a three-room brick house in Kasur, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children, two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a driver and drives his own vehicle, which is called a "Coaster."

Bilquis baji sells milk, so she needs a buffalo to expand her milk business and improve her financial condition. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Nasriddin

texts.ru:
Nasriddin H. lives in Vakhsh district. He's 50 years old, married, and has eight children. He has been farming for 10 years. He plants carrots on his land and then transports his harvest to Dushanbe city, where he sells it wholesale. His harvest has now ripened, but he doesn't have the means for collecting and transporting it. He would like to take out a loan for six months to enable him to collect and transport his goods properly.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Хасанов Насриддин житель района Вахш . Возраст 50 лет. Женат , имеет 8 детей. Занимается земледелием уже десять лет. Сеет морковь на своем участке земли. Получаемый урожай продает оптом , привозя его в город Душанбе. Сейчас поспел урожай , а на его сбор и транспортировку не хватает средств.Поэтому он решил получить кредит сроком на 6 месяцев.Это поможет ему своевремено реализовать товар без ущерба.

loans.use: Transporting carrots

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She became a food seller in 1998. Every day she works from 8 AM to 6 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

Maryam now hopes for a loan to buy more food items like rice, maize flour and bananas for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Mrs. Navy S., 43, and her husband, Mr. Pho Pheng, 46, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1988 and have four children: one son and three daughters. One daughter is a silk weaver, and the other two daughters study at the local school.

Mrs. Navy has been a silk weaver since 1988, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband raises cows and does construction work. Navy is in the process of setting up a new loom for her daughter to weave silk, but she lacks the money.

Therefore, Navy is requesting a loan of $200 to set up a new loom for her daughter to start a weaving business.

loans.use: To set up a new loom for her daughter to use for weaving.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif I. is 38 years old and sells cattle for a living. He buys cows at the local market, raises them for one month, and then sells them at a profit. This business has been the main source of income for his family for the past 12 years. He has large family consisting of three children, and his parents, who live with them in one house.  Arif is planning to increase the size of his business by buying more cattle to raise and sell. To do this, he is requesting a loan of 1200 USD. As this is his first loan, Arif thanks everyone for their trust and support.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.en:
A. Iskandar is 53 years old. He is married with six children. Iskandar is a market vendor. He is selling clothing for men and women in the local market of Dushanbe city called Panjsher. Over four years of working at the market, Iskandar already has enough experience to do his work successfully and has clients who always come to him. Iskandar has a large and friendly family who always try to help each other. Thus his son is also engaged in this business. Iskandar wishes his children to get a good education, allowing them to have a better chance to succeed in the future - this is what makes his sacrifice worthwhile.

As his children are growing up their expenses are rising accordingly, so in order to increase his business Iskandar is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni (US$750). He will use the loan to purchase merchandise so he can offer a wider selection to his customers and increase his income. With the rotation of supplies in his business, he plans to repay the loan within six months.

The well-being of Iskandar’s family and his business are in your hands. Iskandar and his family are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing the new goods for selling.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana tiene 33 años, es soltera y vive en casa de su madre. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, por un buen futuro, trabaja incansablemente en la venta de zapatos, ropa para niños, etc. ha venido realizando este trabajo desde hace ya 10 años, haciendo crecer poco a poco su negocio. Lo difícil de la venta es el tener que viajar a las ciudades de Tacna o Lima a traer la mercadería, pero es una molestia mínima a comparación de las gratificaciones que le da su trabajo. Roxana se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado viajará a traer ropa y zapatos, a la ciudad de Tacna, así vender más en estas fiestas navideñas.
texts.en:
Roxana is 33 years old, single, and lives in her mother's home. She is a very hard-working woman who, in order to create a better future, works tirelessly selling shoes, children's clothing, etc. She has worked in sales for the past 10 years, growing her business little by little. The difficult part of her job is having to travel to larger cities like Tacna or Lima in order to bring merchandise; however, it is a small annoyance compared to the rewards of running her own business. This is Roxana's first loan from Prisma Microfinance; she will use the money to travel to Tacna to bring more clothes and shoes to sell during the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Travel to Tacna to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Eyman

texts.en:
Eyman is a 21 year old woman who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon. She has owned a shoe store for couple of years. Eyman sells shoes and bags. She has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase shoes for her store. This is the first time that Eyman has requested a loan.
Eyman hopes that the loan will help her improve her business which will  improve her income. Eyman is special in her work because she is well organized. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and children of her village. When she first started, she faced some difficulties; the lack of experience and she also didn’t have enough knowledge of how to deal with clients. She decided on doing this business thanks to her father's support by giving her the store and she likes working in  commerce.

loans.use: Eyman needs the loan to purchase shoes for her store.

loans.name: Mealea

texts.en:
Mrs. Mealea M. is a villager in Chhoer Teal Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Say Vuthy, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow both rice and vegetables. They face a problem because the soil on their field is infertile and is damaging their crops. Thus, Mrs. Mealea M. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more fertilizer to support the field and to make her crops more productive. 

She is 36 years old and the mother of three children. Two children are enrolled in the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer to support her field and to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Berta Georgina

texts.es:
la señora Berta Georgina N. tiene 55 años de edad, es soltera, tiene tres hijos  
a los cuales les ha dado el estudio a traves de su trabajo, el cual lo tiene en la escuela
agricola y tambien tiene el negocio de venta de ropa , zapatos y electrodomesticos. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 04 años y esta ubicado en el barrio el calvario de esta ciudad de nacaome. a traves de su labor realiza mercadeo en distintos barrios de esta ciudad y ha obtenido una buena clientela. los productos que ella vende son enviados de norte america ya que tiene familiares alla que le realizan las compras y se los envian a traves de barco a nuestro pais, esto es para que la sra. N. los los pueda vender y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Berta Georgina N. is 55 years old, single, and has three children. She was able to give her children an education with the income she earned working at the Agricultural College and running her own business selling clothes, shoes and household appliances. She has run this business for four years, and it is located in a neighbourhood known as El Calvario in Nacaome City. Her clients, however, come from various neighbourhoods in the city and over the years she has built up a faithful client base. The products she sells are imported from North America, where she has relatives who make purchases for her and send them by sea. This way, Mrs N. gets her products more slowly, but she is able to make a better profit when she sells them.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase clothes, shoes and household appliances

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita A. is a pig grower. She is 56 years old and has 6 children. She started her pig business last 2004 using her small savings of Php 1,000. She gained reasonable profit from her business. She uses her income to send all her children to college and pay everything that the school registrar asked from  tuition fees, books, projects, and exam permits to miscellaneous and laboratory fees. Aside from pigs, she also grows vegetables in her backyard to augment their income.

She is asking a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy piglets and feed for the pigs. Her loan will definitely help her expand her business. The more pigs she raises, all the more profit she gets.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of the WorldVision Philippines that helps people start and have their own business. They provide all their clients credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage to make their business to grow.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Siddiqan Sharif Masih Group

texts.en:
My name is Siddiqan and I’ve been a citizen of a mid-size city, Raiwind, Pakistan for the last 39 years. I am an uneducated lady because my parents couldn’t afford my education expenses. I am married to S. M. and he has run a grocery shop in the community for the last 10 years. I have two kids: one son and one daughter, both enrolled in school. I have a decorative embroidery business. I prepare embroidered dresses ordered by my neighbors and earn an income. With the income, I pay off the school fees for my kids. I am applying for a loan to buy groceries for my husband’s grocery shop. 

I am the group leader for four other women from my locality. Rani baji, Shahnaz baji and Ailas baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Another Rani baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchary que significa Despierta en quechua.
Paulina es casada, tiene 52 años y 9 hijos, Paulina venD. artesanía variada, su local esta ubicado en una calle céntrica, local que es alquilado. Además tiene un bar en la casa D. su hijo en la ciudad D. Huanta para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda D. un personal.
Paulina necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. chompas D. alpaca.
Los sueños D. Paulina son ahorrar para los títulos D. sus hijos y surtir con mas productos su tienda.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Rikchary Community Bank which means Wake Up in quechua.

Paulina is 52 years old, married and has 9 children. Paulina sells various crafts. Her shop is located on a central street. The shop is rented. She also has a bar at her son’s house in the city of Huanta where she counts on staff for help.

Paulina needs a loan of 1200 PEN, money she will invest to buy alpaca wool sweaters.

Paulina’s dreams are to save for her children’s degrees and fill her store with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase alpaca wool sweaters.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
“Success often comes to those who dare and act, seldom goes to the cowards who are ever afraid of the consequences” is the guiding principle of Rosalinda L. in facing the difficulties of life. She is a responsible housewife, married to Federico L., Jr. They live happily in Barangay Vista Alegre of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. They are blessed with five children. Their first two children have graduated from college while the younger three are presently studying in college. Rosalinda patiently maintains her hog-raising business in order to support her husband in providing their children’s education. 

Rosalinda’s husband operates a tricycle transport business in their village. The couple works hand in hand in order to give their children a better life by supporting their ambitions to finish their studies. By maintaining their hog-raising business and daily tricycle operation, her family is able to struggle through the current economic crisis. At present, Rosalinda is hoping to borrow additional working capital of PHP 8,000 ($175 US) to buy hog feed supplies and to pay for maintenance of her husband’s tricycle.

loans.use: To buy hog feed and pay for tricycle maintenance.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.en:
Serafina and Braulio T. are a couple who live in a rural place located in Barangay Monguia, Dupax Del Norte of Nueva Vizcaya. They were blessed with five children. Some of her children were still studying, while others could no longer continue their education due to a lack of livelihood resources. She believes with her patience and sacrifices, she can improve her business and send her children to college.

Her husband tills their rice field and plants vegetables along with other root crops. Serafina vends snacks to help her husband earn for a daily income. She also sometimes sells vegetables in order to increase her business income. She is hoping to borrow a loan from lenders amounting to PHP10,000 in order to have additional working capital to improve her business. She is so thankful that she earns an average of PHP800 weekly. This is already a big help, lessening the burden of providing for her family daily needs.

loans.use: Business Capital

location.town: Monguia, Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Guadalupe Esperanza

texts.es: La señora Guadalupe Esperanza J., tiene la edad de 37 años, reside en el bario Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos que estudian, su esposo es jubilado, ella se desempeña como enfermera profesional desde hace trece años. Ha sido un proceso de largas jornada ya que cuando empezó inicio de afanadora en el hospital, pero siguió estudiando su secundaria y luego su carrera que con mucho cansancio y sacrificio para comprar los libro. Pero que ha sido en su vida positivo ya que ha podido lograr tener mejor trabajo como ingresos. Este es su séptimo ciclo en Afodenic lo cual ha invertido en hacer mejoras a su vivienda, con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer una pared, y poder tener seguridad para su familia. Da las gracias  ala institución por los logros que ha tenido en hacer mejoras a su casa a plazo considerables. Sus planes es poder seguir estudiando y apoyar a sus hijos a que sean personas de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Esperanza J. is 37. She lives in the Memorial Sandino district of Managua. She has two children. Her husband is retired, and she has been working as a professional nurse for thirteen years.

It has taken a lot of hard work, since she started as a cleaner in the hospital. However, she continued with her secondary education and then nursing school, although it was very tiring and she had to make lots of sacrifices in order to buy the books. But she was successful and now has a better job with better pay.

This is her seventh loan from Afodenic, to invest in home improvements; with this loan, she will buy construction materials to build a wall to provide security for her family. She is grateful to the institution for enabling her to improve her home while paying in instalments. She plans to continue studying and to provide support to her children so that they can become upright members of society.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a concrete wall

loans.name: Twanzane Masika Janate Group

texts.en:
M. Janate is 38 years old and married with nine children, and they are all in school. She deals in a beans and cassava flour business and she has been in her business for over twenty years.

Janate is using the loan to purchase beans and cassava flour to improve on her stock and to give satisfaction to her customers. She is a very hardworking businesswoman and very courageous as well. Her dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: To purchase beans and cassava flour to improve her stock

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em T. is a local fish-paste vendor. She is looking for a loan as capital to order a larger amount of fresh fish to make fish-paste to sell at the market. Em T. is a married mother blessed with two kids; both of them are still young and in school. As another family income source, her husband works in construction. Em T. is hopeful that her loan will allow her to increase her revenue to sustain her family’s living expenses more sufficiently.

loans.use: To order a larger amount of fresh fish

loans.name: Stephen Barithio

texts.en:
Stephen M. has been repairing electronics in Naivasha town for the last five years. He is married to Rachael Wanjiku and they have a 2-year-old child. Stephen was introduced to KADET by a friend of his, and this is his first loan with the organization. With this loan, he plans to buy tools for his trade and also to buy electronic spare parts. Stephen hopes to one day move into his own shop, since at the moment he is using rented space. He also hopes to become a supplier for both electronics and electronic spare parts.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities, in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marcos  Cárdenas de 56 años de edad, es un hombre luchador en la vida, trabaja en servicios de seguridad, anteriormente era asistente de cartera en las instituciones estatales del gobierno, reside en el barrio Jorge Dimitrou, su esposa trabaja en la cocina para apoyar a su familia ya que tienen tres hijos y los tres estudian, con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para construir un cuarto y poder tener mejor comodidad. Sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su casa y sobre todo dar los estudios a los clientes. Agradece Afodenic por la oportunidad del préstamo el cual gozara junto con su familia de las mejoras.

loans.use: Comaprar materiales de construccion para construir un cuarto

loans.name: Jowan

texts.en:
Jowan E. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to stock more charcoal to sell.  Jowan is 29 years old and is Married with a husband that is a business man. She has 4 children and her children go to school. 

 With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rental purposes

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Khlang

texts.en: Klang H. is  54 and married to Yan, 49, who, with him,  farms on a plot of land derived from his parents. The family has six children; three are married and the other three are single, two attending school. They are popular for they always show respect to their neighbors and help them. H. is asking for a loan of $700 to buy one plowing truck for farming and service. They are hoping that their children who are still in school will finish their bachelor degrees.

loans.use: To buy one plowing truck for farming and service.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas S. is a long-time business woman and low-income person. She has been working on the farm since she was single. On her own small farm land, she plants different kinds of crops which she proposes to harvest and sell to a buyer when the crops are mature. Her husband helps work with her in growing their crop. Meas S. has six single children, two of whom are staff workers for industry. She planted her crop two months ago but her crop is not growing well due to lack of fertilizer. Therefore, Meas S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer to fatten her crop yield. Note: Mrs. Meas S.'s husband appears in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Guadalupe De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe De Jesús A. está muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudar a crecer más si negocio.  
El cliente solicita nueva mente un préstamo para la compra de una rostizadora de pollo ya que en el lugar que tiene ubicado su negocio, nada más hay la venta de pollo asado. Desean adquirir la rostizadora con capacidad de 45 pollos, el cual estará afuera de su negocio, para que la gente que pase a su negocio vea y los pollos rostizados y listos para comer, acampañados de sus tortillas de maíz y su salsita mmmmmmm que rico.  
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias de la nueve inversión en el negocio ya que saben que es algo que su va a funcionar.
texts.en:
Sra. Guadalupe De Jesús A. is very grateful for the assistance of her previous loan, which helped her increase her business.

She is requesting a new loan to buy a chicken broiler for her business because no other places in her area sell roasted chickens. Guadalupe hopes to acquire a broiler that can hold 45 chickens. She plans to put the broiler outside of her business so that people passing by can see the rotisserie chickens and be enticed to come inside and eat. The chickens will be served with corn tortillas and her delicious salsa.

Guadalupe plans to repay the loan using the earnings that result from this new business investment. She is confident that this idea is going to work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a chicken broiler

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, el señor Manuel G. se ha destacado por ser muy trabajador y preocuparse por las condiciones de su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus tres niños.

El señor Manuel trabaja como guarda de seguridad y vigilancia y a pesar que este trabajo es muy cansado, él siempre busca la manera de sobre esforzarse y llevar el sustento al hogar. El crédito que ha solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construcción porque requiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda como lo son el techo y el piso y para ello necesita invertir directamente en la compra de dichos materiales para brindarle a su familia muy buenas condiciones de vida y garantizar que sus hijos tengan un techo digno y herencia donde habitar.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Manuel G. has stood out for his hard work and his concern for the well-being of his family, consisting of his wife and three children. Manuel works as a security guard and although this job is very tiring, he's always looking to work hard and provide for his household. The loan he has requested is to purchase construction materials he needs to improved the conditions of his home, like the roof and the floor, and to do that he needs to directly invest those materials. This will help him provide his family with good living conditions and guarantees that his children have a proper roof to live under and inherit.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es: Zoila Esperanza P. D. G., D. 62 años, vive junto a su esposo el señor Miguel Mauricio G., él es empleado y tiene a cargo el sostenimiento del hogar. Zoila es una señora muy dinámica y emprendedora y ha querido ayudar a su esposo instalando una tienda en su lugar D. residencia. Le va muy bien, pero sus clientes están demandando productos que aún no posee, por lo que se encuentra solicitando un crédito para suplir la necesidad D. los clientes, soñando D. esa manera con hacer crecer su pequeño negocio.-
texts.en:
Sixty-two year old Zoila Esperanza P. D. G. lives with her husband Miguel Mauricio G.. He is employed and in charge of supporting the household. Zoila is a very dynamic and enterprising woman and has helped out her husband by installing a store within their place of residence. It is going very well, but, their customers are demanding products that the store still does not carry. She is requesting a loan in order to fulfill her customers’ needs. In this way, she hopes to grow her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to augment the merchandise for sale

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen M. is currently in the business of selling ice cream in the market and is requesting a loan to stock sugar and milk to make ice cream to sell. Hellen is 30 years old and married to a policeman. She has six children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase a fridge.

About BRAC: BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock sugar and milk to make ice cream to sell

loans.name: Abdelftah

texts.en: Abdelftah is 30 years old. He is married and has one child. Abdelftah is a very diligent and hard-working man. He owns a Taxi office where he provides taxi services inside the city of Gaza, in Palestine. The income he earns helps to support his family. Abdelftah needs more capital to buy a new taxi for the office. He says thank you!

loans.use: To buy a new taxi

loans.name: La Fe 1,2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Aurelia is the coordinator of her group La Fe (The Faith), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana where the economy centers around the sugarcane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their six children.

Aurelia is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans, which she cites having taken for the low interest rates. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling polo shirts, pants and creams by purchasing these items in the main market and then bringing them back to her remote community to sell for a profit. She will use the profits to continue providing for the needs of her large family as well as to continue investing in her business. Her dream is to one day own her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more polo shirts, pants, underwear and creams

loans.name: Maria Esthela

texts.es: La señora Maria es una mujer esforzada al trabajo, tiene 30 años de edad, procreo dos hijos, estudiantes, su esposo trabaja como cadete de taxi, recorriendo la capital de Managua. Su negocio es la venta de productos lácteos como: queso, cuajada y crema, con varios años en las ventas ah logrado tener sus clientes. Ella inicio estas ventas con dinero que su esposo dio, el cual ha ido aumentando la compra de queso ya que se vende por lo que es mas barato que el pollo y la carne a los sectores mas pobre del barrio. Gracias a estos financiamientos ha logrado hacer las mejoras a su casa, con el crédito anterior pudo hacer la mejora de un cuarto y con este financiamiento invertirá en la compra de mas quintales de queso, crema, cuajadas que son muy rica por que son elaborada en el departamento de chontales los cuales los finqueros traen a vender el queso a la capital. Contenta por que aumentara sus ventas que espera poder a corto plazo comenzar vendiendo mas productos de consumo para el cliente a si como pintar su casa, comprar las puerta del cuarto para mejor privacidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria works very hard. She is 30 years old and has 2 children, both students. Her husband works as a taxi driver, covering the capital of Managua. Maria sells dairy products such as cheese, cheese curd and cream. Over the years she has built a customer base. She started her business with money from her husband, buying more cheese in the poorest areas of the neighborhood because the cheese is less expensive than poultry and meat. Thanks to this financing she has been able to improve her house. With her last loan she was able to improve a room in the house, and with this loan she will purchase large quantities of cheese, cream and curd from the department of Chontales. The dairy products from that department are especially delicious, and the farmers bring their products to sell in the capital. Maria is happy because she will increase her sales and begin selling more food products in the near future. In this way she can afford to paint her house and buy a door for the new room to provide her family with more privacy.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of cheese, cream and curd to improve income through more sales.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou C. is from the village of Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Marilou is separated from her spouse and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marilou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Verónica tiene la edad de 40 años, nacida en la comarca Santo Domingo, procreo tres hijos, desde pequeña trabajaba en la agricultura, pues sus padres eran de pocos recursos económicos lo cual dependían de la siembra. Cuando se caso su esposo trabaja tierras alquiladas hasta ahora no han logrado comprar tierras propias, pero alquilan cuatro manzana en donde producen tomate, chiltoma, rábanos lo que dependen de la producción, las dificultades es que abecés por la sequía pierden parte la producción oh por falta de abonos lo cual a veces han invertido todo el capital en la semilla y se le hace difícil. Es por eso nace la necesidad de este financiamiento para comprar lo necesario en abonos, fertilizantes y semilla ya que cultivaran tomate y chiltoma lo que espera es poder producir buenos frutos que se vendan a buen precio al mercado para poder sastifacer las necesidades de su familia como pagar el financiamiento en tiempo y forma. Su anhelo es poder a corto plazo poder comprar las tierras para un futuro mejor de su familia.
texts.en:
Verónica, 40, is originally from Santo Domingo. She has three children. She has been a farmer since she was a little girl because her parents were poorl and they depended on their crops. When she got married, her husband farmed leased farmlands. To date they have been unable to purchase their own land. However, they lease four manzanas (a traditional unit of land area in Central America) on which they grow tomatoes, peppers and radishes. Sometimes, due to drought or lack of fertilizers, they lose part of the crops in which they have invested all their seed; this makes it very difficult. For this reason, the need arises to seek financing to buy the necessary manure, fertilizers and seed because they are about to plant tomato and peppers. They hope to produce good product that will sell at the best market prices so that they can meet household expenses and repay the loan on time. Her short-term goal is to be able to buy her own farmlands so that her family can have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed, manure and fertilizers for tomato and pepper crops.

loans.name: Felix Alberto

texts.es:
Félix es un hombre discreto y muy laborioso, tiene 45 años y está casado con Rosa de 39 años, con quien tiene siete hijos. Ellos viven en su cómoda vivienda de madera ubicada en la plaza de su localidad a 22 kilómetros de la ciudad.La agricultura es la actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 20 años, cultiva café, plátanos y maíz en sus terrenos propios. Cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa, quien se dirige a las chacras junto a él en la época de cosecha para atender a los operarios que contratan, pues usualmente se encarga de cuidar a sus hijos en casa.
De toda su labor a Félix le gusta cosechar los granos de café, despulparlos, hacerlos secar, escogerlos y luego comercializarlos a los comerciantes mayoristas, quienes conocen la calidad de su fruto por el cual pagan montos considerables acorde al mercado. Como plantar café es muy rentable y le permite adquirir más terrenos, para más adelante planea alternar su chacras con varias variedades de café, asimismo quiere comprar una casa cerca de su ciudad para poder instalar una bodega.Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y refiere estar muy contento de trabajar con su banco comunal, porque sus integrantes son muy organizados, solidarios y responsables.El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en contratar operarios que limpiarán sus terrenos para que luego puedan cosechar fácilmente.
texts.en:
Félix, 45, is a discreet and very hard-working man. He’s married to Rosa, 39, with whom he has 7 children. They live in their comfortable, wood dwelling, which is located in their community’s square 22 kilometers from the city. He has been a farmer for 20 years; he grows coffee, bananas and corn on his own fields. His wife helps him with his work, going with him to the fields during harvest time to tend to the workers they hire because, usually, she stays home to care for the children. What Félix enjoys most about his work is harvesting coffee: hulling the beans, drying and sorting them for subsequent sale to wholesalers, who are aware of the quality of his fruit and for which they pay considerable prices according to the market. Because coffee planting is very profitable, it makes it possible for him to acquire more lands so that he can alternate his crops with different coffee varieties; he also wants to buy a house near his city so that he can set up a warehouse. This is his first loan with MFP and he states that he is happy to work in a communal bank because its members are very organized, unified and responsible. He will use the requested funds to hire field hands to clear his fields for future planting.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To hire fieldworkers.

loans.name: Malae

texts.en:
Malae Ah K. is 49 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture, raising pigs for sale.  Malae has 5 years of experience in this business.  Malae needs a loan of WST $2000 to expand shelter for the borrower's livestock.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 700 talas or US $292 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Malae joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Malae's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to expand shelter for the borrower's livestock

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia D., of legal age, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. She is happily married to Alfredo D., a tricycle 9three-wheeled transport) driver. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been in the direct selling business for quite some time now. She mainly sells personal care products like lotions, perfumes and such.

Herminia has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow three times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying advance orders of products in her cosmetics direct selling line.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education and able to buy a new tricycle unit.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying spare parts for tricycle and additional stocks for her direct selling business

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna G., from the town of Surallah, is 26 years old, married, and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Erna plants and harvests rice for sale. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Erna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 6000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure, she plans to use any additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business and supplement family income.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social-performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Fields Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Kupere Ole

texts.en:
Kupere Ole K. is 65 years old. He is married to Koitoi K. and he is a father of two school-going children. 

Kupere has been farming his own piece of land for the last six years.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to spend on his twenty acre wheat farm. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent more land for farming to increase his wheat production.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can be planting more wheat for commercial purposes and also build some rental houses. He hopes to become a large scale farmer and buy his own tractor for ploughing.

Despite his age Kupere believes he is hard working and he will achieve his goals.

loans.use: Wheat farming

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama S. cooks banku (locally called etew) and serves it with okro sauce and pepper sauce with fish at Abura. Mariama has received a junior high education. She is a widow and has six dependants.  She is responsible for the general welfare of her dependants. Her loan will be used to buy more corn to prepare banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to complete a kitchen she has started building.

loans.use: To buy more corn to prepare banku for sale.

loans.name: 07 Thieu Phuc Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Nhan T. T.(56) is a 63-year-old woman living in the town of Thieu Hoa - Thanh Hoa.  Nhan is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 07 Thieu Phuc.


Nhan is married and has 3 adult children.  To making a living, Nhan operates a family member's business venture in the retail sector, running a general store.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  Nhan has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2002, Nhan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nhan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 4.000.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be the 9th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Nhan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Ngô T. Loan (55) is a 42-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  L. T. Binh (57) is a 42-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  L. T. Duong (58) is a 56-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Nhan T. T.(56) là 63 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thieu Hoa - Thanh Hoa.  Nhan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 07 Thieu Hoa.


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Nhan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nhan kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2002, Nhan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Nhan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.000.000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 9th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Ngô T. Loan (55) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  L. T. Binh (57) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  L. T. Duong (58) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en: Mrs. S. is an elderly woman whose husband is shown in the photo. She is a rice farmer. In addition to her farming job, she also sells fried banana to the neighbors for a daily profit. Her husband works on the field with her and is also a district policeman. This couple has six single children and a seventh who is now married and lives independently. Mrs. S. requested a loan to plant a rice crop during the coming farming season.

loans.use: To plant a rice crop during the coming farming season

loans.name: Anwer's Group

texts.en:
Anwer lives in Lahore, Pakistan, where her husband has had a grocery shop in the market for the last five years. With a good reputation among his customers, his business is going well, and since being confronted with the challenge of competition from other grocery shops he has become more efficient. Anwer has decided to help him financially by requesting a loan from Asasah so that he can stock more groceries in his shop and become more competitive.

Anwer herself is a housewife who is very co-operative by nature. She sells artificial jewelry to help support her family with her husband. Anwer is very hopeful that with the loan, her husband will be able to increase his profits which he will use to enhance his family’s living standard and help ensure a bright future for their children.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is a 70-year-old father who lives with his wife and son,  in Montes de Oca, located in the Central Valley of Costa Rica. Rodrigo runs a nursery where he sells various plants and small trees which bear fruit. His customers purchase decorative plants as well as fruit-producing plants such as banana and squash. He plans to use this loan to increase his productive output, in other words, the number of plants in his salable inventory.

Rodrigo will use this loan to invest in the construction of two new greenhouses. Specifically, this loan will help to finance the creation of irrigation systems, the purchase of tubing, seeds, nutrients and other inputs necessary to the production of plants. 

Rodrigo is a busy entrepreneur; as a result, he must organize his day efficiently. In the mornings and the afternoons he dedicates a few hours to his nursery. Nursery tasks include planning, planting, watering and preparing pots, among others.  

At his age, Rodrigo still dreams. He hopes to increase his income in order to be able to manage costs (schooling costs of his grandson, rent on the land occupied by the nursery) with more ease. Rodrigo´s main obstacle is a lack of access to working capital. He hopes that this loan will enable him to offer a greater variety of plants, of superior condition and in better quality pots.

loans.use: To finance the construction of two greenhouses and other inputs necessary to plant production

loans.name: Segundo Jasmany

texts.es:
Segundo Jasmany H. C., tiene 27 años.  Es soltero vive con los padres,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene hijos.

Segundo es un socio de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”, que está ubicada en el Recinto de los Amarillos a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Segundo  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz y cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz y cacao Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un terreno propio para construir una casa. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas y enfermedades como la langosta en el cogollo.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Segundo Jasmany H. C. is 27 years old. He is single and he lives with is parents. He lives in the city of Ventanas, of the province of Los Rios. He has no children. Segundo is a member of the rural village of San Jose de los Amarillos. It is located in the Recinto de los Amarillos region, 90 minutes from the city of Ventanas. There are 23 members in her group and the majority of them are agriculturists. This is the second loan they request through the San Jose Cooperative (Kiva Field Partner). Segundo is an agriculturist, sowing corn and cocoa. The makes his purchases and sales every month in the city of Ventanas. He requests a loan to invest in the purchase of corn and cocoa seeds. He sees this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. His dreams are to have a plot of land where to build his own home. The challenges he faces are blights and langosta infestations in his fields. He enjoys playing sports.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of corn and cocoa seeds.

loans.name: Mun

texts.en:
Mun S., 24, is married, and lives with her husband and child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, known as the most populated city in the country. S. is a housewife while her husband is a tailor, earning an income of USD 15 per day. S.'s husband appears in the photograph using scissors to design clothes.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase supplements to run a food shop. By doing so, she will be able to generate more income for her family. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

In the future, S. would like to use her profit to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy supplements to run a food shop

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana D. is from the town of Banga. She is 59 years old and widowed. To make a living, Juliana plants and harvests rice for sale. Juliana has been engaged in her business for more than 35 years.

Juliana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliana has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer, seeds and other inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds and other inputs

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a 47-year-old pepper producer who lives in the region of Upala in the Northern region of Costa Rica, minutes from the Nicaraguan border. Victor is a dedicated father and producer. He plans to focus his efforts on the planting and harvesting of Cayenne peppers in an effort to improve living conditions. He works in cooperation with his family to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities.  In addition to his agricultural activity, Victor feels it is important to be an active member of his community. As a result, he dedicates a significant portion of his time to community meetings, groups and events. The rural zone where Victor and his family live is sparsely populated with infrequent bus service and a general lack of infrastructure. Victor is working hard towards the sustenance of his family, striving to reap the maximum benefits from his land and his labor. 

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which Victor and his family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbors help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All individual members of the Upala community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of Cayenne and Habanero peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All laborial and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by Victor, with the help of his family members in the region of Upala. The production cycle (from planting to harvest) for these types of peppers is roughly one year. Victor planted his peppers 4 months ago and will expect to harvest in the next 8 months. Typically, he dedicates the hours from 6:00 AM to 4:00 PM everyday to his agricultural activities. 

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial (PROPICA) is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Upala, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

The main obstacle Victor and other producers in the Upala community face is a lack of access to working capital funds. The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA, represents a unique opportunity to Victor, his family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, Victor wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented. He wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in his home and neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase of agricultural ingredients and chemicals.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes S. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occ. She is 62 years old. Lourdes is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lourdes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Lourdes from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: José Farid

texts.es: José Farid F. A. de 35 años de edad, es un padre de familia muy responsable y trabajador el cual reside en el departamento de Usulután, junto a sus dos hijos y junto a su madre. José posee una venta de ropa para mujer, y delantales, los cuales se utilizan para cuidar la ropa a la hora de cocinar, el negocio esta ubicado en el mercado de Usulután, en donde hace 15 años se dedica a esta actividad, la cual le permite sostener su hogar. José solicita un préstamo para invertir en su venta comprando mayor cantidad y diversos estilos de ropa femenina, tanto para surtir su negocio como también para que su madre comercialice en su casa de habitación. José desea en gran manera mejorar sus ventas y de esta forma vivir mejor.
texts.en: José Farid F. A. is 35 years old.  He is a very responsible and hard-working father who lives in Usulután department together with his two children and his mother.  José has a business selling women's clothing and aprons which are used to protect clothes when cooking.  His business is located in the market in Usulután.  He has been in his business for 15 years and it has enabled him to support his household.  José is requesting a loan to invest in his sales business, buying a larger quantity and range of women's clothes both to stock his business and for his mother to sell from home.  José would like to improve his sales and thereby be able to live better.

loans.use: To buy clothes and aprons to sell

loans.name: Dilabzahon's Group

texts.en:
Dilabzahon T. is a resident of Aravan. She is the treasurer of this group. Dilabzahon is 36 and married.  Her husband works as a driver in the Regional Electro Station. Together they bring up a daughter and a son. Both children are at school. In order to make money to cover family expenses, Dilabzahon sells dairy products. She started this activity 15 years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms. In this way, she earns 2,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a cow for breeding.  In the future, she wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.
