Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio con esfuerzo propio anteriormente vendía cosméticos, era uno de los trabajos que mas le gusto ya que lograba conversar con sus clientes y conocía las necesidades de cada uno de ellos, pero por su salud no pudo continuar con este negocio ya que tenia la enfermedad de la artritis en sus piernas y esto le impedía recorrer las calles a ofrecer sus productos por lo que decide establecer su pulpería en su vivienda y manteniendo ese entusiasmo para sus clientes. Es así que decide realizar este financiamiento con el fin de invertir en su negocio para capital de trabajo para granos básicos, golosinas y gaseosas. El deseo de Rosa es que su negocio aumente para beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia B. Hernández is 45 years old and married with 2 children. She runs a general store, which she has done for the past 7 years. Previously Rosa sold cosmetics, which she greatly enjoyed as she was able to talk with her customers and understand their needs. However, due to her health, Rosa could not continue, as arthritis in her legs prohibited her from traveling around to offer her products. So she decided to open up a general store in her home while maintaining the same enthusiasm for her clients. Rosa is requesting a loan to invest in her business and purchase basic grains, sweets, and soda. Rosa's desire is to grow her business and benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa J. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 45 years old, married, and has two adult children. Teresa owns and operates a fishing business, primarily harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Teresa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Teresa is requesting a new loan of 5,500 PHP which will be used to build a new fishing boat. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To build a new fishing boat

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Хасан мужчина 49 лет. Разведённый -живёт с матерью. Он занимается куплей и продажей мебели. Хасан также мастер по изготовлению мебели, у него много учеников. Этим делом он занимается уже 20 лет. Покупает старые мебели и реставрирует и продает за хорошие деньги. У него в цеху целый комплект оборудованный по изготовлению мебели и данный кредит берёт на покупку современных технологий.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Hasan is a 49 year old man. He is divorced and lives with his mother. He buys and sells furniture. Hasan is also a furniture maker and has many students. He has been in this business for more than twenty years. He buys old furniture and then repairs it and sells for good money. He has a completely equipped shop for making of furniture and he is taking this loan to buy modern technology.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture

loans.name: Moturayo

texts.en: Moturayo is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She sells groceries and drinks. She has been in this business for 25 years. Moturayo lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is hoping for a loan of N150,000 to purchase groceries and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and groceries to sell

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara W. is single and has one child. She has received schooling through senior high school. Barbara sells cooked rice in Yamoransa, which she has done since 2004. Barbara uses her income to pay for feeding her family and also for utility bills.

Barbara will use the loan to purchase to buy bags of rice, tomatoes, and other ingredients to cook and sell at the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Barbara plans to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, tomatoes and other ingredients to cook and sell

loans.name: Tojikul

texts.en:
During last year’s growing season, Tojikul was diligent in his fertilizer and pesticide-selling venture, and was thereby able to acquire adequate income. This was used both to improve his home and to save for the children’s education expenses.

However, since he used much of the season to sell fertilizer and pesticides, his own land is now empty and derelict. This is a suitable time in the season for planting, so Tojikul has taken the initiative to resume working on his land while continuing to sell fertilizer.

To meet his goals, he has requested funds to purchase farm supplies, such as seeds and mineral fertilizer. Tojikul is optimistic that his venture will be successful. All his efforts are expended to better the family’s welfare.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies, such as seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 47 years old, married, and is blessed with three children. She is engaged in managing a vegetable production business in the village of Bolinao Aurora, Isabela, with her husband. They help each other in tilling their vegetable farm, planting their different vegetables and maintaining them all throughout the year until their vegetable plants are no longer productive. Then it’s their time to again till their farm to produce another batch of vegetables.

Marieta also sells their harvested products to buyers. She sometimes goes in the market but most of the time she retails in their village.

According to Marieta, their income from the business is very helpful in supporting the education of their children and in providing their basic necessities at home. But, since they want the business become more productive, Marieta is requesting PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders to use as additional business capital.

Marieta has been in love with running the business for already ten years and she wants to spend the rest of her life improving their family source of income for the benefit of her children.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Nan

texts.en: Nan S., 33, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband and two young children. To earn a living, she has been selling rice noodle in the community to earn a living and is able to make about US$1.60 every day. Her husband operates a grocery store from home, earning approximately US$2 each day. Due to the buying demand is increasing, Mrs. Nan is asking for a loan of US$400 her husband needs to expand grocery’s inventory.

loans.use: To expand grocery’s inventory.

loans.name: Evancy

texts.en:
Evancy B. is from the village of Alegria. She is 31 years old. Evancy is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Evancy owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Evancy has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Evancy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evancy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Evancy is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Evancy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Sam-Ol

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-ol S., 30 and her husband, Mr. Sam-ol Kroch, 38, have been married since 1994 and have one young son. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sam-ol has been a silk weaver since she was 13 years old, a skill she learned from her aunt. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then takes them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a security guard for 19 years.

Sam-ol is asking for a loan of $100 to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business

loans.name: Alcidia

texts.es: Alcidia F. es una mujer dinámica que tiene mucho anhelo de superación, vive en el distrito de calleria, región de Ucayali, tiene 43 años, es madre de tres hijos, de los cuales dos son mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, y también tiene una vulcanizadora en donde su esposo trabaja como mecánico. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Divinas” desde hace un año. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que lo invirtió en la compra de gaseosas. Ahora Alcidia necesita un crédito de 800 soles, que será utilizado para invertir en bebidas refrescantes. La meta de Alcidia es implementar su negocio de bebidas refrescantes y apoyar a us esposo en el mantenimiento de su vulcanizadora .
texts.en:
Alcidia F., 43, is a dynamic woman with a great desire to better herself. She lives in the Calleria district, Ucayali region. She has three children, two of whom are adults. She sells soft-drinks and also has a tire shop where her husband works as a mechanic. She has been a member of the "Las Divinas" (The Divine Ones) communal bank for the last year. Her initial, 300 sol, loan was used to buy soft-drinks. Now, Alcidia needs 800 soles to buy refreshing beverages. Alcidia's goal is to stock her beverage sales business and help her husband with the upkeep of his tire shop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy refreshing beverages.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and dried fish and is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell. Charity is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 7 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ese

texts.en: Ese is married with four children. She is 34 years old. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Desde muy joven a la edad de 12 años, el señor victor T. se ha dedicado a la actividad de tenería o trabajo en el procesamiento del cuero el que sirve para diferentes funciones como elaboración de zapatos, fajas, bolsos, carteras, protectores de muebles, entre otros.
Actualmente él tiene su propio negocio de tenería donde a diario procesa el cuero y luego lo ofrece a posibles compradores que adquieren el producto para fines a su trabajo.
El crédito lo utilizará para la compra del cuero y para los materiales de trabajo para llevar a cabo su respectivo procesamiento y así darle un eficiente acabado de alta calidad y listo para ofrecerlo a sus compradores.
texts.en:
Since he was very young, at the age of twelve, Mr. Victor has been tanning leather or has worked with processing leather. The leather is used in many different ways such as in making shoes, belts, purses, wallets, covers for furniture, or other uses. Presently he has his own tanning business where he daily processes leather and then offers it to buyers who use his product to their finished work. He will use the loan to buy leather and materials used in the tanning process. In this way he can complete his work in a timely manner, offer a high quality product and have it ready to offer to his buyers.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will buy leather.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Este señor es obrero, labora para la Alcaldía del Municipio de Chichigalpa de donde es originario, es soltero, tiene 42 de edad, tiene cinco hijos que mantener, de los cuales cuatro son menores de edad, ha este señor se le han otorgado créditos desde el año 2006, estos han sido en su mayoría  para mejoramiento de su vivienda y este último lo invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares, uniformes y zapatos, con los enviara a sus hijos a la escuela, a demás de otros gastos que realizará.
texts.en:
This man is a laborer who works in the mayor´s office in the town of Chichigalpa, where he is from originally. He is single, 42 years old and has five children to support, four of whom are minors. He has been receiving loans since 2006. Most of the loans have been for making improvements to his house and this most recent one will be used to buy school supplies, uniforms and shoes, with which he will send his children to school, in addition to other expenses he has.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy notebooks, pencils, backpacks, uniforms, shoes and pay off other expenses

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe D. is from Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Fe is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $158 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Fe is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which again will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, 48, is a rice farmer in Banga, South Cotabato. She also owns a sari-sari (general) store as additional income for her family. She is a mother of three children, her eldest is 23 years-old. She started her business last year in 2009. She's now requesting a loan from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. for 8,000 Php. This will enable her to buy farm supplies and groceries for her store.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Emmanuel M. le está haciendo falta las protecciones en las ventanas y puertas. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder pagarle a la persona que elaborar las protecciones, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario. Ya que tiene poco tiempo que termino sus estudios como medico y esta realizando su servicio social en una clínica y el sueldo que recibe es muy bajo. 
Pero a el le preocupa la seguridad de su familia cuando no se encuentra en si casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que recibe ya que los gastos familiares se encargara su esposa la señora Sandra Luz Quezada quien trabaja en una maquiladora en el departamento de producción.
La persona que aparece en la foto es Doña Sandra Luz esposa del señor Emmanuel, ya que el se encontraba en su trabajo, el día de la visita.
texts.en:
The dwelling of Señor Emmanuel M. is lacking protection on the windows and doors. He is applying for the loan to be able to pay the person who makes these protections, since at the moment he does not have the necessary money. Since he has only a little time until he completes his medical studies, he is performing his social service in a clinic, and the salary he receives is very low. But he worries about the security of his family when he is not at home.

He plans to pay off the loan with the income that he receives, since his wife, Señora Sandra Luz Quezada, who works in a factory in the production department, takes care of the family expenses.

The person in the photo is Doña Sandra Luz, the wife of señor Emmanuel, since he was at work on the day of the visit.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install protection on doors and windows

loans.name: Pesi

texts.en:
Pesi A. is 35 and married with 6 children (ages 3 - 19).  She owns a business venture, catching & selling farm-raised fish .  Pesi has 2 years of experience in this business.  Pesi needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional fish to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Pesi joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Pesi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Pesi A. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn S. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Merlyn is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconut lumber in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa G. is a 44 year old year-old woman living in the town of Libertad, Escalante, Negros Occidental.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a sari sari store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and other basic commodities in the local community.  Elsa has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In December 13, 2005, Elsa joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16000 PHP from NWTF. Elsa is now requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 10th loan taken out by the borrower from NWTF.  Elsa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Tunka Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento TUNKA que significa (diez) en Aymara es un banco D. Emprendimiento formado en la zona D. Villa Concepcion, ubicado al sur D. la ciudad D. La Paz. Es una asociacion D. la cual son integrantes 11 personas las cuales han demostrado mucha responsabilidad en sus anteriores creditos, sin tener dias D. atrazo ni fallas en sus cuotas.

Son representadas por la Señora Placida quien actualmente ocupa el cargo D. presidenta D. la asociacion, ella es una persona muy responsable que se dedica a la costura D. enaguas y polleras en su propio domicilio donD. con mucho esfuerzo pudo montar su taller. actualmente solo vive con el esposo quien se dedica a realizar trabajos varios por toda la ciudad. la señora placida invertira el prestamo para la compra D. una nueva maquina D. costura y D. esta manera aumnetra los ingresos D. su negocio, ella esta muy agradecida con la institucion por ofrecerles este apoyo.
texts.en:
The name of the TUNKA communal bank means "ten" in the Aymara language. It was founded in the area of Villa Concepcion, located south of the city of La Paz. It is an association with 11 members, who have demonstrated great responsibility with their previous loans, without late days or missing payments. They are represented by Placida, who currently holds the position of president of the association. She is a very responsible person who works as a dressmaker, making traditional skirts and slips in her own home, where she was able to establish a workshop through much hard work. She currently lives only with her husband, who does various jobs throughout the city. Placida will invest the loan in buying a new sewing machine, so that she can increase her income from her business. She is very grateful to the institution for offering her this support.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a sewing machine

loans.name: Juan Bautista Group

texts.es: El grupo  “Juan Bautista” esta representado por el señor Daniel Ángel y conformado por 13 miembros, 3 varones y 10 mujeres, todos son muy alegres y unidos, este grupo va cursando un ciclo mas con la institución demostrando responsabilidad y honestidad en sus pagos. El señor Daniel Ángel es padre de familia de tres niños, es casada y su esposa se dedica a la venta de fruta, el se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado el se esfuerza mucho para poder tener darles un techo propio a sus hijos, en este momento el se encuentra viviendo en anticrítico; Daniel Ángel solicita el crédito para capital de trabajo para poder comprar mas ganado y venderlo a un mayor precio. Entre las actividades que realizan el resto de las socias están la venta de abarrote, venta de pan, venta de frutas, promotoras de cosméticos, venta de coca, los varones  actividad del trasporte, A.ñil y distintas actividades que realizan para poder progresar y  darles a sus hijos un mejor futuro. La  competencia  de sus negocios es alta por eso las socias trabajan duro y requiere un esfuerzo y un sacrificio para poder llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar, además tienen que competir con negocios grandes, fuertes ya establecidos en áreas mas comerciales como ser restaurantes, panaderas,  pero eso no es motivo para que ellos se desanimen, sino mas a lo contrario la competencia  les obliga a trabajar para crecer económicamente. El crédito será utilizado para incrementar su mercadería, la compra de insumos y herramientas para mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos para darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Daniel Ángel represents the Juan Bautista group. It is comprised of 13 members, 3 men and 10 women. They are all very happy and united. This group is in one more cycle with the institution. They are demonstrating responsibility and honesty with their payments. Daniel Ángel is married and has three children. His wife sells fruit. He buys and sells livestock. He works very hard in order to be able give his children their own roof over their heads. At this time he is living in “anticrédito” (a special type of rental arrangement in Bolivia). Daniel Ángel is requesting a loan for working capital to be able to buy more livestock, which he will sell for a greater price. The activities that the rest of the women in the group do are selling groceries, selling bread, selling fruit, selling cosmetics, and selling coca. The men work in transportation, as bricklayers, and other different activities. They do these to be able to progress and give their children a better future. Competition in their businesses is high. But, the members work hard, and it requires effort and sacrifice to be able to bring home the daily bread. Also, they need to compete with large business, which are strong and already established in more commercial areas. They compete with businesses like restaurants and bakeries. But, this is not a reason for them to be discouraged. It is just the opposite. The competition makes them work to grow economically. The loan will be used to increase merchandise and to buy supplies and tools. These are to improve their sales and increase their incomes in order to give their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Nayra Violeta

texts.es: Nayra Violeta F. D. M. D. 34 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja para una empresa privada, y junto a sus dos hijos menores D. edad, D. los cuales el mayor estudiar y el menor, se encuentra a cargo D. ella todo el tiempo, por lo que la acompaña a su lugar D. trabajo todos los días, ella resiD. junto a su familia en el municipio D. Ilopango en el departamento D. San Salvador. Nayra posee una venta D. productos comestibles como almuerzos, golosinas, bebidas y otros más, negocio el cual esta ubicado en las instalaciones D. La  Fuerza Armada D. El Salvador, lugar en el que trabaja desD. hace 10 años atrás, en donD. poco ha poco ha tratado D. ir surtiendo, D. manera que pueda vender mucho más, a pesar D. que existe gran competencia dentro del mismo lugar, Nayra por ser una mujer muy atenta, aseada y humilD., posee muchos clientes los cuales se encuentran totalmente satisfechos con todas estas cualidades y así mismo por sus precios razonables con los alimentos. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima necesaria para elaborar desayunos, y almuerzos, así mismo para surtir su negocio con diferentes tipos D. golosinas y productos bebibles, así D. esta forma Nayra desea salir adelante y contar con todo lo necesario para su negocio y la estabilidad D. este.
texts.en:
Nayra Violeta F. D. M. is 34 years old. She lives with her husband, who works for a private business, and her two minor children. The oldest is in school and the youngest is always under her care. He accompanies her at work every day. She lives with her family in the town of Llopango in the department of San Salvador. Nayra sells food products such as lunch, snacks, drinks and more. Her business is located in the facilities of The Armed Forces of El Salvador. She has worked there for 10 years and she has tried to diversify little by little in order to sell more, despite having a lot of competitionin the same place. Because Nayra is an attentive, clean and humble woman, she has a lot of customers who are totally satisfied with these qualities and her food's reasonable prices. She is asking for a loan with which she can buy all of the raw material she needs to make breakfasts and lunches. She will also diversify her business with different types of snacks and beverage products. In this way, Nayra wants to get ahead and have everything she needs for her business and its stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase different food products.

loans.name: Savorng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Savorng P. is 34 years old is the village bank president, having been selected by its fifteen members who are located in Pou Doh village, Takeo province. Some members in the photo are blocked by others. Each member of this village loan will use it to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Savorng P. is a farmer who owns a plot of land she uses to cultivate rice for a living, while her husband, Mr. Phon Sen, is a laborer who is able to earn a small salary to support his family living. This couple has three children: two are students in the local school while the youngest one is 3 years old.

In order to support her husband’s work, Mrs. Savorng P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband’s transportation needs.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her husband's transportation needs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married man with two children. He is an experienced construction worker. He is especially talented at completing woodwork projects. He works on a freelance basis upon request of customers or through some entrepreneurs that we work with. He is the main provider for his family; that's why he works very hard to meet their needs. He is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more wood to be prepared for his newest project. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in microfinance. At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro- and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: Purchase more wood

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame A. operates a provisions shop at Takoradi. Maame has been through junior high school. She is married to a drinking sport operator and has four children. Maame has been selling provisions for some time. She helps her husband in taking care of her household. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of charcoal and provisions for sale. She plans of establishing another shop at a different locality should the business grow well.

loans.use: buy more bags of charcoal and provisions for sale

loans.name: Turi Centro (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Turi Centro esta formado por un grupo de 11 mujeres luchadoras que trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante  a sus familias. Viven por diferentes partes de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta es una ciudad hermosa por sus iglesias, su centro histórico, los cuatro ríos que bañan la ciudad, su variada gastronomía y especialmente por su gente.

La Señora María Lastenia I. vive en por el sector de Turi, tiene 49 años , es casada, y tiene 6 hijos de 32,30, 28, 25, 22, 19 años de edad, cuatro de sus hijos son casados y viven de manera independiente, su hija de 25 años de edad trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su hijo de 19 años estudia en el colegio, su esposo se dedica a pintar casas, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad, la lograron construir con el sacrificio conyugal.
María se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a la cría de animales domésticos como: pollos y cuyes. Lleva trabajando con los créditos de la banca comunal 3 años, el nuevo crédito que LA FUNDACION ESPOIR  le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos. Su  sueño es tener una máquina de coser.

La Señora Blanca Esperanza A. vive en el sector de  Don Bosco, se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, pero le gustaría emprender el negocio de venta de cosméticos YANBAL. Es su primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y fue su hermana la que la incentivó para formar parte de este grupo de mujeres luchadoras, el crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR  le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de productos  YANBAL,
Doña Blanca tiene 40 años, vive en unión libre y  tiene 2 hijos de 22 y 20 años de edad, sus hijos son económicamente independientes y viven en el extranjero, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, la casa en la que habita no es de su propiedad por lo que vive arrendando. Su sueño es viajar a New York.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Turi Centro" is formed by a group of 11 tenacious women who work very hard to provide for their families. They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca. This is a beautiful city that is known for its churches, its historic center, the four rivers that surround the city, its varied cuisine, and especially for its people. María Lastenia I. lives in the Turi neighborhood. She is 49 years old, married, and has 6 children aged 32, 30, 25, 22 and 19 years of age. Four of her children are married and live independently. Her 25 year-old daughter works and helps her economically and her 19 year-old son studies in school. Her husband paints houses. They live in their own home, which the couple managed to build with a lot of sacrifice. Maria is in charge of the household chores and also raises domestic animals such as chickens and guinea pigs. She has taken loans from the communal bank for 3 years. With the new loan from the FUNDACION ESPOIR, she will invest in the purchase of chickens. Her dream is to have a sewing machine. Blanca Esperanza A. lives in the Don Bosco neighborhood. She carries out the household chores, but also would like to start a business selling Yanbal brand cosmetics. This is the first loan she is taking from the communal bank; it was her sister who motivated her to become part of this group of women who are determined to succeed. She will use the loan from the FUNDACION ESPOIR to buy Yanbal products. Blanca is 40 years old, and lives with a partner. She has 2 children aged 22 and 20 years; her children are economically independent and live outside the country. Her husband is a farmer. The house that they live in is not their property; they are renting. Her dream is to travel to New York.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chickens and Yanbal brand cosmetics

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en: Bonifacio S. is from the village of Tamil. He is 38 years old and is a widower with two school-aged children. Bonifacio owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Bonifacio joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be his first from PMPC. Bonifacio plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

location.town: Liloy-Tamil, Jose Dalman Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Matahum

texts.en:
Matahum C., from the village of Langub Calamba Misamis Occidental, is 46 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Matahum owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, powder, soap, sugar, salt, and biscuits in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Matahum joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, her fourth, to purchase additional products to sell. Matahum plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Paula, de 65 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su hija mayor y sus 2 nietos, juntos luchan cada día para salir adelante. Cada día es de trabajo constante,  para esta empeñosa mujer, y a pesar de su avanzada edad continua con sus labores de siempre, con el único fin de terminar de construir su casa de material noble. Se levanta muy temprano para atender y brindar alimento a sus animales de corral, que cría con esmero. Su vida transcurre apacible, pues logra buenas ganancias del alquiler de 2 cuartos que tiene en su casa; y hace 5 años empezó con este negocio ante la ausencia de su esposo ya que no quería ser una carga para sus hijos. En la actualidad tiene muchos planes, y entre ellos se encuentra el de terminar de construir su casa, pues tiene planeado alquilar 2 habitaciones; de esta manera espera generarse regulares ganancias. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas con puntualidad, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar con el alquiler de su vivienda, y así espera concretar sus planes. Paula tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales (cuartos semi-fabricados, clavos, y calaminas) para acondicionar las habitaciones que tienen para alquilarlos, de esa manera espera mejorar sus rentas y así terminar de construir toda su casa.
texts.en:
Paula is 65 years old and lives in her own home with her adult daughter and two grandchildren.  They work together daily to get ahead.  This enterprising woman works constantly every day.  Despite her advanced age, she continues with her usual labors, with the goal of finishing the building of her home with good quality materials.

She rises very early to tend to and feed the corral animals that she raises with care.  Her life passes gently and she makes a good income from renting out two rooms in her home.  She started doing this five years ago because of her husband’s absence and because she did not want to be a burden on her children.  She now has many plans and among them are to finish building her house because she plans to lease out two more rooms and she hopes to generate a regular income.

This will be her first loan through MFP and she is committed to being punctual with her payments because she doesn’t want to be in bad light with those who provided the money that will allow her to continue to rent out her home and solidify her plans.

Paula plans to invest the money from this loan in building materials (prefabricated rooms, nails, and roofing material) to prepare the rooms she has to rent out.  In this way she hopes to improve her income and finish building her entire house.

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita J. is 62-year-old married woman and supports her family by operating one business venture: a firewood retailing business.  She lives in Purok Caimito, Brgy. Tacup, San Remegio, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.

By working hard in her firewood retailing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,000. Clarita is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can continue to fund the operations of her firewood sales.   This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Clarita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of selling firewood and coconuts

loans.name: Gulnaz's Group

texts.en:
Gulnaz lives in the third largest city of Pakistan called Faisalabad, which is known for its textile industry. She lives there with her family in the Anwer colony in a two-room brick house where she moved seven years ago. 

Gulnaz is 37 years old, and married to I. who is a hair dresser by profession. He runs a barber shop in the market. He is very good at his work and deals with many customers. Her brother-in-law also lives with her family, and is an employee in a private firm on a monthly wage. 

Gulnaz has given birth to four children; three sons and a daughter. She cannot afford to educate any of her children. She herself is a housewife, who stays at home and does household chores.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. He will use the loan to purchase different items such as a mirror, chairs and scissors for his shop to better serve his customers. The additional chairs will help him provide better seating arrangements to his customers.  
She is hopeful that her husband will be able to get positive results from his business by investing the loan money, and then she will be able to send her younger children to school. 

She is a new borrower of Asasah--this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Gulnaz.

loans.use: To buy chairs, a mirror and scissors for barber shop.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou A. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 36 years old. Marilou is single and has 4 children. Her eldest child is 20 years old and the youngest is 13. Her 4 children all go to school. Marilou said that it has been a challenge for her and her husband to sustain their children's education because tuition fees increase every year.

Marilou helps provide her family's needs through farming. She plants rice crops and sells her harvest to the market. She works hard to increase her harvest with every crop to earn more income. Marilou wishes to have a stable income that could sustain her family.

Marilou is requesting for a loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and other the farm supplies that she needs. She is hopeful that this loan will help improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 29 years old. She is married and has two children who are between six and ten years old. Her husband works as a vet. Agnes sells clothes and she has spent seven years in this business. She needs this loan to buy more clothes to sell and she believes that the profit from the business will be used to buy livestock and reinvest. She dreams to get 70% of the total sales in the future as profit.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth D. sells different kinds of soft drinks at Takoradi market. She is married and has three children. Her husband is an electrician. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more soft drinks to restock her fridge for resale. She hopes to reinvest her additional income back into her business.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Andronica

texts.en:
Andronica T. is from the village of Bayabas, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 51 years old. Andronica is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Andronica owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Andronica has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Andronica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Andronica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Andronica is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Andronica from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Unidas Por El Amor Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Unidas por el amor está integrado por 11 socias y dos socios, los cuales realizan diferentes actividades económicas. La sra. Maria Salome S. Z., es la coordinadora del banco comunal, tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, y reside en la comunidad del Rusio en el municipio de Juticalpa, Olancho. Inicio su negocio con el primer credito que obtuvo en FAMA en el a;o 2002, es una mujer luchadora y tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación que atiende ella y su esposo. Maria atraviesa un problema de salud llamado paralisis facial y muy a menudo tiene que comprar medicamentos.

El préstamo que solicita lo necesita para comprar azúcar, arroz, refrescos, manteca, carnes, pollo, embutidos, pan, etc. Con el apoyo del préstamo tendrá más y mejor surtido su negocio y sus clientes podrán encontrar todo lo que necesitan para preparar sus alimentos y asi ella podra cubrir los gastos de la casa y su salud. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio hasta inagurar un mercadito, tambien sue;a con hacerle mejoras a su casa porque esta bien deteriorada

Maria Salome ha sido cliente de FAMA por nueve a;os y espera pagar las cuotas de este nuevo prestamo de forma puntual y responsable como hasta en la actualidad.
texts.en:
The 'Unidas por el Amor' (United by Love) community bank is made up of 11 women and 2 men who each carry out different business activities.  Maria Salome S. Z. is the coordinator of the community bank.  She is 53 years old, married, has four children and lives in Rusio neighborhood, in the town of Juticalpa, Olancho.  Maria set up her business with the first loan that she received from FAMA in 2002.  She is a hard-working woman who owns a small grocery store in her home that both she and her husband serve in.  Maria Salome suffers from a health problem called 'facial paralysis' and she has to buy medicine very often.  

Maria needs this loan to buy sugar, rice, soft drinks, butter, meat, chicken, sausages, bread, etc.  Through the support of this loan, she will be able to have a better stocked business and her customers will be able to find everything they need to prepare their meals.  This will, in turn, allow Maria to cover her household and health expenses.  Maria's goal is to grow her business until she owns a mini-market.  She also dreams of making improvements to her home because it is in a bad state of repair.

Maria Salome has been a client of FAMA for nine years and she hopes to make all the repayments on her new loan punctually and responsibly as she has  with her previous loans.

loans.use: To buy general groceries

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur H. was born in Azerbaijan in 1985. When Artur was one year old his father died, and Artur’s mother decided to move from Azerbaijan to Armenia with her two children. They bought a house in Aygehovit village, in the Ijevan area. Artur and his sister graduated from the high school in the same village. 

Artur and his mother do animal breeding and land cultivation. They breed cows and produce cheese on their farm. Artur sells milk and cheese in Ijevan city’s market and so provides for his family.

Artur needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a large lot of fodder for his cows.

loans.use: To buy a large lot of fodder for his cows

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: El señor Rubén es Administrador de empresas, trabaja como Consultor en una empresa, el crédito lo quiere para comprar una Laptop (Computadora portátil) para realizar su trabajo con mayor eficiencia. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención de su familia.Vive  en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz, está casado y tiene dos hijos. Es la Primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Sr. Rubén is a business manager who works for a company as a consultant. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a laptop computer so that he can perform his work more efficiently. His job is the main source of income for supporting his family. He lives in the home of his parents, which is located in the District of Miraflores in the city of La Paz. Rubén is married and has two children.

This is his first loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase a laptop computer to use in his job as a consultant

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita O. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Lolita is widowed and has seven adult children. 

To make a living, Lolita weaves nipa palms into thatched mats that can be used for various purposes such as roofing. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 23 years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month.

In 2011, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Lolita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the first loan taken out by Lolita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Ivone

texts.es: La  señora Ivone tiene una movilidad y su esposo es chofer, el crédito lo requiere para  comprar un taxi para de esta manera aumentar los ingresos mensuales; esta actividad de transporte de pasajeros es la fuente de ingresos que tiene. Ivone vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz. Está casada y tiene un hijo.
texts.en: Ivone has a taxi and her husband is the driver. She requires a loan to purchase a taxi and to increase their monthly income. This public transportation business is their only source of income. Ivone lives in a house of her own located in the region of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz. She is married and she has one child.

loans.use: to purchase a taxi in order to improve the household income

loans.name: Jose Marcos

texts.es:
Jose tiene 42 años de edad y es casado y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente viven en casa propia en una zona rural en el Caserío Virgen La Purísima ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque, en el norte de Perú. Cuenta con servicios de  luz, pero no de agua potable. Su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado de 20  familias.

Se gana la vida desde hace 20 años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. El suele criar ganado porcino, ovino y pavos y patos y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Jose también cuenta con ingresos adicionales de sus trabajos de jornales en chacras en su distrito. José desea aumentar su negocio con la compra de aves menores para engorde y alimento balanceado. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles. Jose es un cliente antiguo de Edpyme Alternativa y tiene un buen record de pagos. Es muy trabajador y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir generando buenos ingresos para continuar a sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, 42, is married and has two children.  He lives in his own house in a rural area in the village of  Virgen La Purísima, located 15 minutes from Lambayeque, in the north of Peru.  His home has electricity but no potable water.  His village is small with only about 20 families.

For the past 20 years he has earned a living raising and selling small animals that he keeps in fenced areas in the back of his house.  He raises pigs, sheep, turkeys and ducks and when they have grown to a good size, he sells them to merchants who come to the area where he lives.  He learned how to raise the animals from his parents and he is very knowledgeable about the work.  Jose also earns additional money as a day laborer in farms in his district.  Jose  would like to increase his business by buying small birds to fatten up and also to buy nutritionally balanced food.  That is why he is requesting a loan of 500 new sols from Edpyme Alternativa.  He is a long-time client and has a good payment history.  Jose is hardworking and responsible and his biggest goal is to continue generating income so his family can get ahead.

loans.use: To buy more animals and nutritionally balanced food

loans.name: Jazmin Jessenia

texts.es:
Jazmín de 21 años, es una joven emprendedora que inicio su negocio con una pequeña grabadora y una inversión de $60 , ella quería tener  su propio negocio que cogió esa actividad de vende CD de música. Está casada su esposo trabaja vendiendo mercadería y tiene un hijo de 4 añitos que está en escuela.

Ella trabaja sola desde las 10H00 am hasta las 6H00 pm, su dificultad en el trabajo es que tiene que movilizarse y llevar cajas pesadas. Con el préstamo desea incrementar su mercadería para mejorar sus ingresos. En un futuro desea tener otro negocio y empezar en las ventas de ropa.
texts.en:
Jazmín, 21 years old, is an entrepreneurial young woman who started her business with a small recorder and an investment of $60.  She wanted to have her own business, and she started selling music CDs.  She is married; her husband works selling merchandise, and they have a 4-year-old child who is in school.

She works alone from 10am until 6pm.  The difficult thing about her job is that she has to move around and carry heavy boxes.  With the loan, she wants to increase her merchandise in order to improve her earnings.  In the future, she wants to have another business and start selling clothing.

loans.use: to purchase CDs and movies.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina tiene 41 años. Tiene su negocio que es la venta de productos lácteos y golosinas. Labora todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, pues ella llega todos los días a vender en las afueras de un colegio y pasan muchos clientes y es así que vende en grandes cantidades. Este financiamiento es para la compra de cuaja, cremas, queso, leche agria entre otros. Su mayor desafío es que para esta época es que estos productos se escasean y sus precios aumentan, por lo que las ventas no son muy buenas pero ella siempre les brinda un buen servicio.
texts.en: Maria Cristina is 41 years old.  Her business is selling dairy products and candies.  She works every day, from 7.00am to 6.00pm.  She sells her products outside a school.  Many customers pass by and so she sells a lot.  Maria will use this loan to buy curd, cream, cheese, soured milk, etc.  Her biggest challenge is that, at this time of year, these products are in short supply and their prices rise.  For this reason, her sales are not very good but she always provides her customers with a good service.

loans.use: to buy curd, cream, cheese, soured milk, etc.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, a 36-year-old Ugandan man, needs a loan to buy a bicycle and motorcycle spare parts for resale in his shop that he has operated for three years. 

He is a father of four and hails from the Kyenjojo district. His wife sells fresh foods in the same area. He lives in a semi-permanent house with six people that he takes care of; he dreams of acquiring land on which to build a  house and of educating his child. 

He acquired his initial capital from maize faming from which he accumulated his savings to start off the shop and faces a problem of price increases in spare parts.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle and motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
Lucinda es madre de familia de 47 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia,  la cual cuenta con el servicio solo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope, que se encuentra a una hora de distancia aproximadamente del departamento de Lambayeque.  El distrito es una zona turística, agrícola y ganadera.

Lucinda se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales de corral, desde hace 5 años aproximadamente, su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que llegaron a su desarrollo ideal los vende en el mercado de Lambayeque y Chiclayo.  Otra actividad que realiza es la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su domicilio, con los ingresos que logre obtner por la venta de los mismos podra solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

A solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para continuar comprando animales, arreglar su corral y para la compra de productos para implementar su negocio, las ganancias que logre recaudar será para pagar su préstamo y poder sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Lucinda is a 47-year old mother who lives with her husband and children in her own home, which only has electrical service.  It is located in the Mórrope district, located approximately one hour’s distance from the department of Lambayeque.  The district is a zone that is known for its tourism, agriculture and livestock.

Lucinda has dedicated herself to raising and selling farm animals for about 5 years.  Her corral is located behind her house.  She gives her animals balanced feed and natural grasses and, once they are the ideal size, she sells them at the market in Lambayeque and Chiclayo.  Another activity she carries out is selling basic products from her house.  With the income she manages to obtain from her sales, she will be able to meet the family’s obligations.

She has requested a loan of 1,000 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternative to continue buying animals, fix her corral, and to buy products to supply her business.  The earnings she makes will be to repay her loan and to help her family get ahead.

loans.use: buy more farm animals, repair her corral, and supply her general store with products.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena vive con su compañero D. vida su hija y su nieto. Ella posee un negocio D. costura con el que mantiene su hogar, se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues María tiene excelente calidad D. trabajo y cada semana sale a entregar pedidos D. diferentes clientes. Para María el éxito en su negocio es sorprendentemente sencillo, hace más D. lo que esperan con calidez y con dedicación, sus ganas D. superarse la impulsaron a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar telas, cierres, agujas, hilos entre otros; es así como ella mantendrá su negocio siempre activo. María confía que todo su trabajo le permitirá darle a su familia una vida plena llevando seguridad económica a su hogar.
texts.en: María Elena lives with her life partner and their daughter and grandson. She has a sewing business with which she supports her home. She has gained a lot of customers because Amria has excellent quality of work and every week she goes out to deliver orders to different customers. For María, her business' success is surprisingly simple: she does more than they expect with warmth and dedication. Her drive to get ahead led her to ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy fabrics, zippers, needles and thread, among other things. This is how she will always keep her business active. María confides that all of her work will allow her to give her family a full life with financial security in the home.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, zippers, needles and thread.

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Un is a 45-year-old married woman who currently resides in Dongkor commune of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She and her husband work in the farm field as local rice farmers. She started this occupation many years ago.

Mrs. Un is blessed with nine kids; four are married and the other five are single. Two of them are working in a garment factory. This family’s living conditions are not so good because the house that they have lived in for a long time needs to be repaired but they have not enough cash to mend it yet. 

Because of this problem, Mrs. Un requested a loan in order to fix her old house so she and her family can live in a comfortable house.

loans.use: to fix her old house.

loans.name: Lipari Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LIPARI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Isidora. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos cría de animales, cría de vacas lecheras, transportista 

La señora Isidora,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de la promoción y mis vecinos. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de cría de vacas lecheras que  inicio desde que se caso por sugerencia de su suegra y en la actualidad trabaja con su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de alimento para las vacas (forraje) que adquirirá de la comunidad de Callapa. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los bajos intereses.
texts.en:
The “Lipari” communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Center.  It has 11 members led by a governing board headed by Isidora.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses like: raising livestock, raising dairy cows and transportation.

Isidora indicates that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer; she was invited by a promoter and by her neighbors.  Currently, she raises dairy cows.  She started when she got married following a suggestion from her mother-in-law; she currently works alongside her husband.

The loan she will take out now is to purchase feed for the cows (forage) that she’ll buy in the community of Callapa.  This way of earning a living makes it possible for her to generate resources to support the family as much as possible for she’s married and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the low interest rates.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Ilumunada

texts.en:
Married and a loving mother to her children, Iluminada, 54, is a determined individual working hard to increase her income by means of her sari sari store (variety store) which she has operated for 29 years now. She has also been preparing cooked viands in their barrio for five years now. Each month, Iluminada earns an average of P2,000 in retailing and P4,000 in food selling.

Iluminda is requesting a loan of P7,000 to buy groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks and biscuits to sell in the store. She will also buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks and biscuits to sell in the store.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 60 años, convive con Macedonio D. 54 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito D. Pichari. DesD. muy joven Teresa  se dedicó a la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo del cacao, pero cuando formalizó su familia, ella y su esposo adquirieron un pequeño terreno en donD. sembraron cacao y café, ambos frutos que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado. Durante estos años han sido para Teresa  tiempos D. mucho sacrificio y privaciones, pero hoy nos comenta muy orgullosa que sino fuera por ello nunca hibiera logrado comprar su casa, ni tampoco hubieran ayudado a ssu hijos culminar la universidad. Solo espera en adelante tener una tienda para vender prendas D. vestir, pues el trabajo del campo para ella ya es muy agotador. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que ella nuevamente se compromete a ser puntual en el pago D. sus cuotas. Con los 2,000  soles que solicita, comprará una moto sierra para que pueda podar sus plantas D. cacao.
texts.en:
Teresa is 60, and lives with Macedonio who is 54. They have 3 children, and live in their own house in the district of Pichari. Teresa has farmed since she was very young; specifically, growing cacao.  But when she started her family, she and her husband acquired a small plot of land where they grew cacao and coffee, two products for which there is a lot of market demand.  

For Teresa, these have been years of much sacrifice and hardship. But today, she says that she is very proud; that if it weren't for their crops, they would never have managed to buy their house, nor would they have been able to help their children finish university. In future, she just hopes to have a clothing store, since the work in the fields is now very tiring for her.

This is her second loan with MFP, so she is again committed to making her payments promptly. With the 2,000 soles she is applying for, she will buy a chain saw, so that she can prune her cacao plants.

loans.use: To buy a chain saw.

loans.name: John John

texts.en:
John John is 35 years old and married.  He lives in the Philippines. John John has a shop that sells coconut charcoal sacks. He has had this business for five years. He is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy coconut shells for making coco charcoal.

John John is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, John John hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts shells for making coco charcoal.

loans.name: Muoki

texts.en:
Muoki is 41 years old and single. He runs a malimali in Kibera, Nairobi, Kenya, supplying his products to the residents of Kibera. He has been doing this business for the last year and makes an income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

Muoki was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a friend who is also a client of KADET. Muoki has got a good credit history with KADET and he is applying for his second loan of 15,000 KES from KADET Ltd., which he plans to use to add more stock of malimali – that is plastic items like basins, jugs, buckets and thermos. He will use the extra profit to open another malimali. Muoki hopes to have a big shop of malimali. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: to add more stock of malimali (that is assorted goods) for sale.

loans.name: Duhuzubumwe / Kzh Group

texts.fr:
Isaac fait partie du groupe Duhuzubumwe KZH. Le nom du groupe signifie « unir les forces ». Isaac est né au Rwanda. Il est célibataire avec 4 personnes en charge. Son niveau d’éducation est l’école primaire. 

Isaac est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de cultiver des races améliorées de riz dans un espace minimum et récolter une grande quantité. Dans les prochaines années, Isaac voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit de satisfaire ses besoins.
texts.en:
Isaac is a member of Duhuzubumwe KZH Group, which means "uniting forces". He was born in Rwanda. He is single with four people in his care. He attended elementary school.

Isaac is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor to work in his rice field.

His growth strategy consists in growing improved rice varieties, cultivating a small acreage and yielding a good harvest. In the years to come Isaac would like to become one of the best rice farmers in his valley. He will use his profit to meet his basic needs.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor to work in his rice field.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Reynaldo es propietario de un taxi el brinda sus servicios desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche, el siempre esta brindándole el mejor servicio a sus clientes. El motivo del crédito que realiza es para la compra de llantas, herramientas, focos, espejos entre otros. De esta manera el obtiene ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia, en esta ocasión requiere de nuestra ayuda para comprar realizarle ciertas mejoras a su unidad.
texts.en: Reynaldo is the owner of a taxi and he provides service from 7 in the morning until nine at night. She always provides his clients with the best service. The reason he requests a loan is to purchase tires, tools, headlights, mirrors and other products. This way he will acquire an income to move his family forward.
