At this time he requires our help to carry out some improvements to his car.

loans.use: to purchase new tires, tools, headlights, and mirrors.

loans.name: Pet

texts.en: Pet, 42 years old, is a farmer who earns $1 per day. She is a single mother with three children. One of her children is studying and the other two are working in the factory, earning $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $27 on food, $5 on electricity, $7 on school fees, $10 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $250 to buy pigs to feed and sell. This loan would help her to have enough money to buy pigs to feed so she can earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs to feed and sell.

loans.name: Li-An

texts.en:
Li-an is a loving and hard-working mother of two. Her children are in elementary school. Li-an's priority in life is to give the opportunity to her children to study and achieve their dreams. She has no other treasure to give but education. 

Li-an manages her two hectares of field planting rice. She has been in this type of business for three years. According to her, she will not get tired of doing field activities because she loves her work. She said that it is the main source of income of the family.

Li-an needs additional working capital for her field. Her income from previous crops was not enough to buy all the farm inputs needed in rice farming. Now, Li-an wants to acquire a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, hybrid seeds of rice, insecticides, and herbicides. She will use the loan wisely and manage her farm well. She hopes to become a successful farmer and entrepreneur, as well as borrower.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, hybrid seeds of rice, insecticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Juana Nabora

texts.es:
La señora Juana y su esposo el señor Pedro tiene tres hijos que están estudiando dos estudian la primaria y uno esta en la secundaria. 
Solicitan un préstamo ya que tiene que pagar la colegiatura y no cuenta con el dinero para liquidar la deuda y que sus hijos sigan estudiando este ciclo escolar. 
Doña Juana trabaja en una fabrica con el sueldo que recibe pagara el crédito, ya que Don Pedro se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de elaboración y venta de figuras de yeso.
Desean que sus hijos tengan el estudio necesario para que tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Señora Juana and her husband Señor Pedro have 3 children who all study, 2 at primary and 1 at secondary. 

They are asking for a loan as they have to pay the tuition fees and do not have the money necessary to pay off the debt so that their children can continue to study this school year. 

Doña Juana works in a factory and with the money she makes she will pay off the loan as Don Pedro will take of the family and school expenses with earnings his business makes manufacturing and selling plaster statues. 

They want their children to have the necessary education to have a better future.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben has been selling GNLD detergent products for the last five years in Eastleigh Nairobi City. He is 51 years old and is married to Eunice. They have been blessed with three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be his first loan. He intends to use the loan to buy GNLD detergent products for sale.
 
In the future, Ben hopes to expand his business and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy GNLD detergent products for sale.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel tiene 28 años de edad y vive en una aldea de Tela, Atlántida. Lleva 4 años de casado con su esposa Keyla, la cual es ama de casa y colabora en el negocio junto con él. La pareja tiene una niño de 1 año de edad. 

El negocio de don Miguel consiste en la venta de hotdogs, frutas, jugos naturales y mercadería. Empezó el negocio hace 2 años y le dedica 10 horas diarias. Antes, trabajaba en una ferretería en San Pedro Sula, pero quiso poner su propio negocio para poder atender mejor a su familia y tener tiempo de asistir a la iglesia. Sacó un crédito para empezar el negocio y a pesar de la delincuencia y la competencia, ha podido salir adelante y surtir el negocio. 

Solicitó este crédito de L18,000 para surtir su inventario. Va invertir en la compra de uvas, manzanas y ropa para la temporada navideña. Miguel espera poder brindarle a su hijo una buena educación y lograr fortalecer su negocio para poder brindar a sus clientes lo que ellos pidan y así mantener la clientela contenta.
texts.en:
Miguel, 28, lives in a village in Tela, Atlántida.  He has been married to Kayla for four years.  She’s a housewife and helps him out with the business.  The couple has a one-year old son.

Miguel’s business consists in selling hot-dogs, fruit, fruit juice and merchandise.  He started the business two years ago and he puts in 10-hour work days.  He used to work in a hardware store in San Pedro Sula but he wanted to open his own business to better take care of his family and have time to attend church.  He took out a loan to start the business and despite delinquency and competition has been able to get ahead and stock the business.

He requested this L18,000 loan to stock inventory.  He will buy grapes, apples and clothes for the Christmas season.  Miguel hopes to be able to provide his son with a good education and manage to strengthen the business to provide his customers with what they request so that he can keep the clientele happy.

loans.use: to buy grapes, apples and winter clothes.

loans.name: Anick Zinhoue

texts.fr: Anick, femme dynamique, est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente de sous vêtements, chemises, produits cosmétiques, tapettes  sise au marché Vèdoko, activité qu'elle maîtrise au vue de son expérience. Elle s'approvisionne au Togo aussi bien qu'au Bénin en gros pour revendre en détail. Compte tenu de son emplacement dans le marché et en vue de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un micro-crédit à Finadev afin d'accroître son stock de marchandises et de maximiser son profit pour le bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en: Anick, who is a dynamic woman, is married and mother to two children. She specialises in the sale of underwear, shirts, cosmetics and flip-flops in the Védoko market, and given her experience, masters this business well. She gets her supplies wholesale in Togo as well as in Benin and resells them on a retail basis. In view of her location in the market and in order to satisfy her customers' needs, she is requesting a micro-loan from Finadev in order to build up her stock of goods and maximise her profits for her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy 20 shirts, 20 pairs of flip-flops, 30 cosmetic products, and with the remainder of the money, other clothing.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Susana; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de maíz en el mercado de de Urubamba y también la socia vende frutilla en forma ambulatoria, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de maíz y venta de frutilla. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y frutilla al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Susana, a member of “SAYHUA 3”, a communal bank located in the Urubamba district, in the Urubamba province and in the Cusco department.

Susana is 41 years old, she is married and she has 3 children. She alternates her daily chores with her retailing activity: she buys and sells maize in the Urubamba market, and she also sells strawberries in an itinerant manner. She works form 8 am to 6 pm, and thanks to this activity she can provide for her children. Her dream is to improve her maize and strawberries selling activities. She is requesting a loan to buy maize and strawberries at wholesale price.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy maize and strawberries at wholesale price.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Hawa.  She is married to a mechanic and has 2 children, aged 7 and 16 years. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her. She came to live with Hawa to attend school in the city and also help with domestic work.  

In 2001, Hawa established her secondhand electrical equipment/appliances, carpet etc. business. She began her business because her parents could not afford to pay her school fees. Since she could not further her studies, she joined her mother in business, and when her mother died she had to partner with her elder brother in the business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,508,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Hawa has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase 10 small pieces of secondhand carpet @ Le150,000 each, 10 DVD players @ Le125,000 each, 10 rolls of electrical cable @ Le100,000 each, 10 boxes of plugs @ Le80,000 each and 450 packets of light bulbs @ Le1,000 each. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 976,000. In the future, Hawa plans to build a house.  

She feels good that her business is growing.  She is planning to expand and give her children a better life.  She is excited about the future because in acquiring this loan she will be able to buy more stock to add to her existing business. Her major challenge is the high rate of taxation.  Competition is low as she is the only retailer in that area.  She serves people around the town and customers from interior villages.  She serves about 12 people per day as she offers quality products at affordable prices to suit her customers.  She buys her goods in Freetown three times a month through public transport.  She uses his profit to buy more stock for her business.  

Hawa is planning to expand by acquiring more loans and making better profits so that she will be able to achieve her plans.  She is hardworking and honest.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand carpet, DVD players, electrical cables, plugs and light bulbs.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with ten children. 

Patricia has a retail shop that sells vegetables like gabi or root crops, spring onions and eggplants. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of vegetables to sell.

Patricia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Patricia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lilian Estela

texts.es:
Lilian, vive con su hijo de 13 años de edad en casa propia, ella se dedica a vender comida desayunos, almuerzos  y cenas todos los días de 5:00 pm a 6:00 pm, desde hace diez años, por iniciativa propia  de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar los ingredientes como: pollo, carnes, arroz, frijoles, repollo, tomates y de esa manera lograra mejorar su inventario y obtendrá mejores ganancias el cual le ayudara para siempre mantener su negocio estable.
La aspiración de Lilian es establecer otro negocio, ayudar a su hijo a estudiar y siempre ayudar con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Lilian lives with her 13-year-old son in her own house.  She has been working selling food for ten years, breakfast, lunch, and dinner every day from 5:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. on her own from Monday through Sunday.

She will use the loan to buy ingredients such as chicken, meat, rice, beans, cabbage, and tomatoes.  In this way she will manage to improve her inventory and will obtain better profits, which will help her to always keep her business stable.

Lilian's goals are to set up another business, help her son to study, and always help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, rice, beans, cabbage, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is thirty-four years old.  She is married to James and is a mother of six children.  She is a farmer in Kimende on the outskirts of Limuru town. She does vegetable farming and has been doing so for ten years now.  She sells her farm produce in bulk.

This will be Priscilla's third loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, etc.  In future she wants to be a successful business lady in Limuru.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer, chemicals for her farm

loans.name: Flavien's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. Le représentant du groupe, nommé Flavien (Celui qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgé de 51 ans. Flavien est marié a une revendeuse du nom de Pauline. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et a leur charge. Flavien vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Flavien comptable de formation vend également des PURE WATER (eau en sachet) dans sa région depuis dix ans. Flavien s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Flavien ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite pour la cinquième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter un tricycle.

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: Fati est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un certain Ibouraïma. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge.   Fati vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Fati assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Fati  n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins, Fati vend depuis seize ans du riz, du maïs, de l'huile végétale et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Fati s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. En vue de renforcer davantage son activité par l’augmentation du stock de ses produits, afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Fati sollicite pour une quatrième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits consentis antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du riz, du maïs, de l'huile végétale et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 60 years old, married and has four children.

Corazon is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Corazon requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Corazon has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Corazon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.en: Iâ€™ve been selling medicines itinerantly in neighbouring communities for the past year.   This business generates earnings that I use to provide for my family. I also sell low quality wood that I buy from sawmills. This wood is used as a substitute for electricity by the people the in my residence.

loans.use: Sale of various popular pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Alida Sulay

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Alida Sulay, and I hope to start a home bakery. The revenue generated will cover familial costs and other obligations. I have devoted myself to this type of business for several years, and with its success I can provide my children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Alida Sulay, cuento con un negocio de reposteria ( productos de Consumo Humano) ubicado en mi casa de habitación el que me genera ingreso para cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de negocio, gracias a el he podido dar educación a mis hijos.

loans.use: To purchase eggs, flour, margarine, sugar, miscellaneous paper products, yeast, vanilla, olive oil, and butter.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience A. is married with five (5) children. She is 50 years old andn has been a LAPO client for the past 4 years. She is delighted in engaging in sales of provision and drinks. She is optimistic that her business will improve if she is loaned the sum of $250.

loans.use: To buy more provisions

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is 23 and has not decided whether she will have children yet. Together with her husband, she sells artesan crafts in the market "Santo Domingo," located in the town of San Cristobal de Las Casas ( 30 minutes from her house). She makes bracelets and belts in various colors of silk thread. They also purchase cloth and make blouses, pants and skirts, so that they can then be embroidered with different colored flowers. After they have a good quantity of articles, they sell them to wholesalers. Rosa is a member of the solidarity group "Betania 2." With the loan, she hopes to purchase more fabric to make clothing, as well as embroidery thread, through which she hopes to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

ROSA TIENE 23 AÑOS, HASTA EL MOMENTO NO HAN DECIDIDO TENER HIJOS, JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO VENDEN ARTESANIAS EN EL MERCADO DE “SANTO DOMINGO” UBICADO EN LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS (30 MINUTOS DE SU CASA). ELLA HACE PULSERAS Y CINTURONES DE HILO DE SEDA DE DISTINTOS COLORES, TAMBIEN COMPRAN MANTA Y CONFECCIONAN BLUSAS, PANTALONES, FALDAS PARA QUE POSTERIORMENTE SEAN BORDADOS CON FLORES DE DIVERSOS COLORES, Y DESPUES DE TENER CIERTA CANTIDAD LOS VENDEN CON LOS MAYORISTAS. ELLA FORMA PARTE DE UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO BETANIA 2.CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE COMPRAR MAS TELA PARA CONFECCIONAR LA ROPA Y TAMBIEN HILO PARA LOS BORDADOS Y ASI AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS .

loans.use: Sale of Artisan Clothing.

loans.name: Bifotima

texts.ru:
Bifotima is 30 years old. She is divorced and has 2 children. Bifotima has a secondary school education, both of her sons go to school. After her divorce, Bifotima started selling children’s clothing because she was responsible for supporting her family. In the evenings, after trading she works in a candy factory.

Bifotima has been a MicroInvest client since 2003. Back then her assets were worth $100. Gradually after step by step borrowing she increased her inventory by $450 and improved the quality of her family’s life. She plans on using her next loan to purchase a store.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хайдаровой Бифотиме 30лет. Разведенная, имеет двух детей. Образование среднее. Оба сына ходят в школу. После того как развелась с мужем, начала продавать детскую одежду, поскольку вся забота о семье свалилось на ее плечи. После торговли она вечером работает в кондитерском цехе. Кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» начала 2003году, тогда её активы составляли 100$. Постепенно после шагового кредитования она увеличила товарооборот на 450$, улучшила уровень семейной жизни. В дальнейшем после получения большой суммы займа хочет приобрести магазин.

loans.use: to open a store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her cereals business

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu S. is 38 years and married with 6 children. She has been running her bakery business for 17 years on a very small scale. She was renting the bakery from other bakers but after her third loan, S. built a small bakery within her home. She does her housework in addition to the business, and it is really hard. With no one to assist her, she could not increase production. She would like to expand her business and hire 2 workers to assist her in the production. Kadiatu is therefore requesting a $375 loan.

loans.use: She would like to hire to employees to help her in the production of her bread.

loans.name: Nanano's Group

texts.en:
Nanano S. sells pharmaceutical drugs and wishes to have a loan to increase her stock. She also intends to purchase a boda-boda motorcycle taxi to rent out to generate more income.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Ufaya

texts.en: Ufaya is a 40-year-old local resident of the town of Saatli. She is widowed and lives with her four children. She breeds cattle in her yard. She has been in this business for 20 years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. She also sells milk and other diary products. Cattle breeding is traditional in this region. This is their only source of income, and it can be a good income. Ufaya wants to buy two more calves to add to her livestock. She has applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a loan in amount of $500.

loans.use: To increase her number of cows

loans.name: Magamaga East B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Irene B.. She is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to increase inventory. Irene is 35 years old and is a widow. Each week, Irene makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest more in her business. Irene has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to buy more charcoal and the loan was paid back on time.

Irene is joined in her small group by Bety L., Erina G., Jalia M., and Mary N.. Bety L. has a business running a restaurant and wants to add to her business. Erina G. is currently operating a business in farming and wants a loan to purchase more seeds, watering cans and manure. Jalia M. operates a business running a restaurant and wants to buy more food and furniture. Mary N. is currently in the business of operating a grocery store and is requesting a loan to increase stock in the store.

loans.use: To expand charcoal business and make more profits

loans.name: Stela

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Stela K.. She is 44 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 12 and 23 years old. In addition, she has one dependent who lives with her because her parents live in a remote area. Stela owns a traditional African clothing business. She works extremely hard to earn about $240 each month from this business. She is assisted by her one employee. Stela seeks a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of African cloth. In the future, Stela plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services.

Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional African cloth.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca belongs to “La Familia” Communal Bank, located at Av. Yarina 2381 in Yarinacocha, a town in the Ucayali province of Peru. She is 30 years old and the mother of three children.

Blanca’s income wasn’t enough to support her family so she decided to invest the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos in a business buying and selling clothing. She now has her own store where she sells items including clothing and shoes. She gets up at 6:00 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her children and then works attending to her customers until 8:00 p.m.

With this loan of $650, which she plans to repay in four months, she will buy women’s, men’s and children’s clothing, women’s shoes, wallets, toys, backpacks, jewelry and perfumes.

Blanca is very happy and content. She realized that only with hard work and perseverance could she accomplish more than she thought possible at the beginning. She can now afford to pay her household expenses and support her children in their studies and is very grateful for all of the support given to her by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Blanca pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en la Av. Yarina 2381, del Distrito D. Yarinacocha del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 30 años y es madre D. 3 hijos, pero los ingresos económicos con que cuenta no le alcanzan para los gastos familiares, es así que Blanca con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio D. compra y venta D. ropas. En la actualidad ella cuenta una tienda D. venta D. ropas, zapatos, etc, para lo cual se levanta a las 6 am, para preparar el desayuno D. sus hijos, luego se dedica a la atención D. sus clientes hasta las 8 pm. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: ropas para damas caballeros y niños, zapatos D. mujer, carteras, juguetes, mochilas, joyas, perfumes, etc. Blanca esta muy feliz y contenta, se dio cuenta que solo con esfuerzo y perseverancia pudo lograr lo que no pensó al comienzo, ahora pueD. solventar los gastos D. su hogar y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios esta muy agradecida por todo el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Sozandji

texts.fr:
Sozandji L. is a good and honest farmer in his area. In addition to agriculture, he raises pigs to stabilize his income better. The care he gives his pigs has made him a famous livestock farmer, renown locally for the size of his pigs. To do better and to have the greatest number of pigs, he would like financing to buy more piglets. Thus, he will be able to provide for his eleven children despite being 57 years of age.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Sozandji L. est un brave cultivateur de sa localité. En plus de l’agriculture, il élève aussi des porcs pour mieux stabiliser son revenu. Le soin qu’il apporte à ses porcs a fait de lui un éleveur célèbre et très reconnu dans sa localité de part la grosseur de ses porcs. Pour mieux faire et avoir un nombre maximum de porcs il voulait avoir un financement qui servira à acheter d’autres petits porcs. Ainsi donc il pourra subvenir aux besoins des onze (11) enfants malgré qu’il soit dans sa cinquante septième année d’âge

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Ni Komang Suarniti

texts.id:
In the first phase of the loan Ni Komang Suarniti used it to buy 4 piglets for fattening, and also additional food. From this pig farming, Ni Komang Suarniti could help her husband in paying for daily expenses, and even from the profit Ni Komang Suarniti also repaired her pig stalls that initially was from bamboo wall to a batako wall. From this second phase of the loan Ni Komang Suarniti used it to buy 5 piglets for fattening for Rp 1,250,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp8,000-9,500.00). During the time her pigs got sick, and although it was medically treatedm they died. Ni Komang Suarniti did not give up, and together with her husband, she wants to again buy piglets for fattening, and continue her business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan modal pinjaman tahap pertama Ni Komang Suarniti menggunakan untuk membeli bibit babi penggemukan sebanyak 4 ekor dan juga mempergunakan untuk membeli pakan tambahan. Dengan usaha beternak tersebut Ni Komang Suarniti bisa membantu suaminya untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup sehari- hari bahkan dari keuntungannya Ni Komang Suarniti juga memperbaiki kandang babinya yang semula dari dinding bambu dengan dinding batako. Pada pinjaman tahap kedua ini Ni Komang Suarniti menggunakan untuk membeli bibit babi penggemukan 5 ekor dengan total harga Rp. 1.250.000,-. Pada masa pemeliharaan babinya terkena penyakit dan walaupun sudah ditangani secara medis, namun babinya mati. Ni Komang Suarniti tidak patah semangat bersama suaminya dia mau membeli lagi bibit babi penggemukan untuk melanjutkan usahanya.

loans.use: To buy piglets (Membeli anak babi)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Bimize

texts.en:
Bimize is 35 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 14, 12, 10 and 3 years old. She owns and runs a small butcher shop, and she has been a shoe seller since 2003. Every day, she works at her businesses and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Bimize now hopes for a loan to buy more shoes and meat for her businesses.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and meat for her businesses

loans.name: Nuevo Corazon Group

texts.es: 18 mujeres conforman  la asociación “Nuevo Corazón” que trabaja en el centro focal de Germán Buch ubicada en la zona de Huayna Potosí de la ciudad de El Alto. Ellas tienen diversas actividades, venden refrescos, elaboran almuerzos, pero una actividad común entre ellas es la confección de ropa ligera (blusas, camisas, vestido) luego de su confección la venden en puestos fijos que tienen el la Ceja de El alto. Necesitan capital para la compra de maquinaria especial, para poder aumentar su producción, están seguras que con esta inversión, generaran mayores ingresos, con lo que podrán responder  a sus créditos y mantener equilibrio económico en sus hogares.
texts.en:
Eighteen women make up the group “Nuevo Corazon.” They work in the German Buch focal center located in the Huayna Potosi zone in the city of El Alto. They have diverse businesses such as selling soft drinks and making lunches but a common business for all is making clothing (shirts, blouses, dresses). After the clothing is made, they sell it in stalls they have in the “Ceja” of El Alto. They need capital to purchase special machinery to increase their production. They are certain that with this investment they will generate greater income with which they will be able to repay their loans and maintain the economic equilibrium of their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of special machinery for making clothing.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
This is a group loan and there are three members. Mrs. Saret is the group leader. Mrs. Tha S. is 47 years old and sells fish in the market. Normally, she buys fish from fishermen and sells them to the market for profit. Her husband, Mr. Sat Mann, is 46 years old and is a motorcycle taxi driver in Battambang Town. Tha and her husband earn around 10US$ per day in total. She has seven children, five of whom are married; she cares for the remaining two children, both of whom attend school, in the family's home. In order to expand her fish selling business, Tha is requesting a loan of US$250 to purchase more fish inventory to sell.

Ms. Ralin Soeun is a fish seller; she requested a loan of US$300 to purchase more fish to sell.

Mrs. Mit Sman requested a loan of US$300 to purchase more fish inventory to sell.

They all live in Norea Commune, Battambang Province.

loans.use: Purchasing more fish

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es madre soltera, tiene 39 años de edad y dos hijos, siendo uno de ellos ya independiente, quedando a su cargo su pequeña de 9 años. Se dedica a brindar servicios de bufete (comida para eventos), trabaja por horas y hace concesiones con algunas instituciones, este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 9 años. Lo que le gusta es que se relaciona con mucha gente, quienes degustan de sus distintos platos. Le es muy rentable, ya que tiene una clientela selecta a quienes les gusta mucho su comida y recomiendan sus bocadillos. Le va excelente. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más utensilios de cocina, como ollas a presión y platos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 39-year-old single mother of two children. As one is already self-reliant, the youngest, the nine year old, is left in her care. Maria provides a catering service for events, which she has done for nine years. She works part time and has made agreements with some institutions. She enjoys getting to know many people, and having them taste her different dishes. Her business is very profitable as she has a select group of clientele who really appreciate her food and recommend her sandwiches. Things are going extremely well. This is the first time she has asked for a loan from MFP. With the money she receives, she will buy more cookware, such as pressure cookers and dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cookware to improve her business

loans.name: Betilú

texts.en:
Betilú is a member of the Azucenas (“White Lilies”) Village Bank. She is 31 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two daughters. 

Betilú sells dishes and pots and pans in a rented store in Ayacucho. Her husband buys the dishes and cookware in Lima (a nine-hour bus ride from Ayacucho) and brings them back to Ayacucho for Betilú to sell in their store. Her husband also works as an ambulatory vendor on the streets of Ayacucho; he sells a wide range of products that vary according to what his customers request.

Betilú is requesting a loan of 3500 soles to buy pitchers, glasses, pots, frying pans and tea kettles. Her goal for the future is to expand her business and own her own store.

loans.use: Buy wholesale kitchen wares

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: La Sra. Silvia tiene 55 años de edad, habita en el  barrio Laureles Norte, en la capital de Managua madre soltera, tiene cuatros hijos todos mayores por gracias de Dios logro sacar a delante a sus hijos y poner su propio negocio en su casa de habitacion, sus planes para su familia es brindarle un patrimonio sólido.La Sra. P. posee su pequeño negocio de casa de huésped, también vende cosmético al detalle y  al crédito desde hace diez años alquila un cuarto  para obtener otros ingresos y ayudarse económicamente. Sus objetivos en el ámbito laboral es ampliar y comprar nuevas líneas de productos. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar productos como: perfumes, pinturas de labios, esmaltes, zapatos y prenda de plata, generándole mayores utilidades y ofreciéndole a los clientes mejores y variados productos.
texts.en:
Silvia is 55 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of the capital, Managua. She is a single mother with four grown children. Thanks be to God, she has been able to help her children to prosper and has started her own business, a guest house. Silvia hopes to leave her family something worth inheriting. In addition to the guest house, she also sells cosmetics retail and on credit. For the past ten years she has rented a room to bring in more income and to help herself financially. Her goals are to expand and buy new product lines. Thanks to loans from Afodenic she has been able to buy products such as perfume, lipstick, nail polish, shoes and silver jewelry, generating higher profits and offering her clients better and a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics, perfume and silver jewelry

loans.name: Mrs. Malen Phoung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan, which consists of twenty-four members, is located in Preak Traeng village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Malen P. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Song Sun, are vegetable farmers who own a hectar to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this farming, they face a problem because they do not have enough vegetable seeds to grow, so Mrs. Malen P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetable seeds for cultivation. She hopes to increase her revenue and support the family well. Mrs. Malen P. is 29 years old and the mother of two children, who are at home because they are too young to work or study. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more vegetable seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en:
Chhuon S., 32, resides with her husband in Siem Reap, Cambodia, where she maintains the house and cooks for her family. Her husband has a dirt-selling business whereby he transports dirt to sell at construction sites. He also operates a battery-charging business from his home, on average earning a total daily profit of $3.  This couple has two young children. Chhuon is now requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a better generator for the battery-charging service. 

Mrs. Chhuon is pictured with her husband and two children.

loans.use: To purchase a generator.

loans.name: Oiniso

texts.en:
K. Oiniso is 45 years old. She and her husband, an engineer, have two children of school age. Oiniso has the specialty of kindergarten teacher. However, for several years already, she has been selling clothing for kids and socks for women and kids.

The income from the business is spent for educating her children, as she and her husband are dreaming that their children will have higher education. Oiniso has been provided with loans by IMON already for 3 years. For the entire period, she has shown herself to be an accurate client. Today she is requesting 675 US for purchasing new goods for sale. Oiniso promises to repay the loan in 9 months and thanks all supporting her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for sale to broaden her assortment

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en: Andrea C. is a 48-year-old mother of four. She sells fish and sometimes catches bangus fry (milkfish) to support the needs of her family. Her income, together with her husband’s irregular income from driving a tricycle (motorcycle with side car, pictured), is not enough to expand her business. She applied for this loan to buy a motorcycle and to help grow her fish vending business. She would like to get a stall in the market so she can sell higher volumes of fish. With more income, she hopes to save enough money to build another tricycle for her son to drive. She also hopes to send her children to university, and dreams of having a better house.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle and to help grow her fish vending business.

loans.name: Juanita De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Juanita de la Cruz Meave vive con su hija que esta en colegio, gracias a su habilidad la señora esta trabajando varios años como profesora de manualidades, además dedica su tiempo libre a un taller de costura y artesanías que abrió con su amiga la señora Lotty,  ella hace edredones, vestidos ,trajes, almohadones, mandiles  y manteles. Los manteles los realiza a mano poniendo mucho amor y dedicación a su trabajo, la mayor parte de sus clientes son personas extranjeras que aprecian mucho su trabajo.
En un futuro la señora piensa exportar sus productos, y así demostrar que si una mujer desea salir adelante lo puede hacer.
texts.en:
Señora Juanita de la Cruz Meave lives with her daughter who is still in school. Thanks to her skills she has worked for several years as an instructor of handicrafts. She also spends her time in a workshop for clothing and artisan crafts that she opened with her friend, Señora Lotty. She makes comforters, clothing, suits, cushions, aprons and tablecloths. The tablecloths are made by hand, with great love and dedicated work. Most of her customers are tourists who really appreciate her work. In the future she is thinking about exporting her products, and demonstrating that if a woman wants to get ahead, she can do it.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for her crafts.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline A. is a 43-year-old widow with four children. She retails groceries and is requesting the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Salifou

texts.fr:
D. Salifou est né le 01 AOUT 1985. Salifou est marié et père de deux (2) enfants tous scolarisés. Salifou a abandonné très tôt l’école pour se lancer dans le commerce des appareils électroniques. C’est au NIGERIA, État frontalier au Bénin que Salifou achète ses articles. Salifou a besoin de moyens financiers pour mieux répondre à la demande de  sa clientèle. C’est la raison pour laquelle Salifou s’est rapproché de ALIDé pour faire un prêt. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
D. Salifou was born on August 1, 1985. Salifou is married and the father of 2 children, both in school. Salifou left school at a young age to begin selling electronic devices. He buys his merchandise in Nigeria, a country bordering Benin. He needs more working capital so as to be able to meet the needs of his clientele. That is the reason why Salifou has come to ALIDé to take out a loan.

The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor." Bénin is a small country in West Africa next door to Nigeria. Its per capita annual income stands at US$ 1,500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 10 electronic devices, DVDs, and other electronic equipment

loans.name: Sardaran Muhammad Iqbal Group

texts.en:
"My name is Sardaran. I have been living in a city of shrines named Borewala, Pakistan, for the past 10 years. My husband's name is M. I.. He runs a scrap business. I am a very sensitive and hardworking lady. I operate my own business embroidering clothes to lead an independent life and to pay off the utilities. I am applying for  a loan to buy scrap for my husband’s scrap business."

Salma parveen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local, three-wheeled motor vehicle). Mansha baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business. A. rakhi baji wants a loan to buy another motorbike for her bike-rental business. Zahida parveen baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy scrap for the scrap business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda T. is raising pigs to sell. She is just starting this business. Hilda is 39 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the town of Northern Poblacion, Calamba Misamis Occidental.

In 2009, Hilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Hilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Hilda is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue as savings to reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mach

texts.en: Mrs. Mach P. lives in Prey Chhoeur Tel village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who grows rice on a piece of land she owns. She also owns a small grocery store at home. Her husband, Mr. Nut Noeun, is employed by the state. Mrs. Mach P. is asking for a loan to purchase a pig and pig food. She would also like use the rest of the money to hire laborers to work on her field. She is 36 years old and the mother of three children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented with her in the photo.

loans.use: A pig, pig food, and laborers to work on her land.

loans.name: Abigirl

texts.en:
Abigirl sells foodstuffs. She has been in her business for the past eight years. Abigirl lives in Lagos. She is 35 years old and married with two children. She is very happy with the financial support of LAPO-KIVA. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

Lagos July 2009

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Bayardo Arsenio

texts.es: El señor Bayardo B. de 61 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, casado y con ocho hijos que su esposa procreo, todos mayores de edad, el es pensionado y formo su propio y pequeño negocio de venta de cereales que sale a vender ambulante entre los cuales vende pinolillo, cereales, cacao lo cual compra el quintal de maíz, arroz semilla de jicaro,  cacao, avena, leña para poder hacer el cereal que tomamos los Nicaragüenses, con este crédito comprar un molino para bajar el costo de producción y poder captar clientes nuevos. Da las gracias ala institución por lograr sus objetivos y a si poder ayudar a sus hijos en lo que pueda.
texts.en:
Sr. Bayardo B. lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Sur in the capital city of Managua. He is 61 years old, married, and has 8 adult children. Sr. Bayardo is a pensioner who started his own small business selling grain. He travels door-to-door selling products such as corn flour, cacao, rice, jícaro seeds, oats, and firewood (for preparing the cereal dishes consumed by most Nicaraguans).

Sr. Bayardo has requested a loan to purchase a grain mill so that he can lower his production costs and attract new customers. He thanks the Institution for helping him meet his goals so that he can help his children as much as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a grain mill

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their four children. He has been working as a car electrician.

Ali requested a loan of 1,500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

Ali is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he likes his work and he also wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 44 años, comparte su vida a lado de su esposo Elmer, de 49 años, y sus 3 hijas: Estefany de 20, Jessica de 13 y Coraima de 9 años de edad, en su casa propia. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de turrones, especie de queque elaborado con harina, huevo, frutas secas, miel y golosinas, siendo uno de los postres más deliciosos y solicitados en los meses de setiembre y octubre, debido a que es tradicional durante el tiempo de la procesión religiosa de la imagen del “Señor de los milagros”. De esta manera Gladys ofrece durante este tiempo turrones, que a diferencia de otros meses incursiona en otras actividades, como la venta de productos de belleza o la venta de ropa a domicilio. Ella considera que trabajando en diferentes oficios le da la libertad de aprovechar las temporadas y así obtener más ingresos para su familia. 
Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y se compromete a ser puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el préstamo que solicita comprará más turrones, ya que piensa venderlos toda la temporada para que con las ganancias pueda instalar una librería en su casa y con este negocio pueda estar más cómoda y cercad de su familia.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Riel

texts.en:
Mr. Riel S., 41, is a Civil Service officer for the Ministry of Fisheries. He is married to Em Rina, age 41, a local teacher. The couple has six children: four are single and two are married and live separately.

The family cultivates a rice crop. The rice-farming season is coming and Riel S. would like a loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to hire a laborer to plow his farmland and to purchase farming materials such as seed, fertilizer and a pump for irrigation.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow his farmland and to buy items needed on his farm

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
“If you are honest, God will grant your request.” This is the guiding principle of Sabina. She and her family live in the village of Uddiawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. Being responsible parents, she and her husband want their children to have a bright future. Hence, they are doing all they can to earn and support their children’s schooling.

Sabina’s husband works as a janitor at the municipal office of Villaverde while Sabina helps her husband by earning a living selling frozen foods in their village, selling her products through house-to-house delivery. Every week, she can earn a net income of PHP 1,050 which she carefully budgets to provide for their basic needs and to finance the schooling of their children.

After a year of sacrifice, all of their three children graduated from college. Two of them are presently working abroad while the youngest is engaged in her own business.

Sabina wants to continue her business to earn and save for their future. This is the reason why she decided to borrow PHP 8,000 from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo P. is from the village of Sto Nino, Talakag Bukidnon. He is 56 years old. Eduardo is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Eduardo owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to transport passengers within the community. Eduardo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Eduardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eduardo is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Eduardo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Constantita

texts.en:
Constantita C. is from the village of Comon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old, married and has 12 school-aged children. To make a living, Constantita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. The primary source of income for the business comes from selling lechon (roasted pig) in the local community. Constantita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In June 2008, Constantita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI, and is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Constantita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & for working capital

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic A. has been wishing for a business that would help her change the life that her family presently has. Her bad experience being poor and less educated, since her parents had nothing to support her studies at a higher level, flashes back every time she looks at her own children. Therefore, she is very much motivated to grow her business towards sustainability because the profit it generates provides her with the financial means needed to support her two children, four and six years old.

Although Marivic’s business is still small, she is willing to take each step slowly with the financial assistance she can access through ASHI and its partners until it grows big and becomes sustainable. Her loving husband who is a farmer supports her endeavor for the business and for their family.

loans.use: to finance her  cell phone pre-paid loading and softdrink sales business.

loans.name: Mouna

texts.en:
Mouna is a 58-year-old woman who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon with her husband. Mouna has owned a bakery for over ten years. She specializes in saj and mankoucheh. A saj is the metal oven used to make saj bread; it is a traditional Lebanese cooking dome. The saj is used to make several types of bread, including markouk (thinned) bread and doughy confections, or mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza; the most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it any time of the day, but it somehow tastes better in the morning. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials for her bakery. This is the first time that Mouna has requested a loan.

Mouna is special in her work because she is known for her tasty mankoucheh. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had difficulty building her start-up capital. Mouna decided on doing her business because of her experience; she also wanted to improve her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her store.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her bakery

loans.name: Lelis

texts.es:
Lelis, de 44 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Epifanio, de 45 años; y está dispuesta a trabaja muy duro con tal de mejorar su calidad de vida.
Su negocio es la venta de productos andinos, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado más importante del poblado de Cabanillas (Distrito de la ciudad de Juliaca) donde vende papa, quinua, oca, etc. Ella pasa todo el día en espera de que sus clientes le compren los productos que vende, es muy alegre, por lo cual su puesto es siempre muy concurrido.
A su vez, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en el mercado, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto cuidándolo. 
Para más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Lelis con MFP y está dispuesta a separar una parte de las ganancias del día para pagar el crédito sin problemas. En su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que le da alegría a las demás socias. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Lelis, 44, is a cheerful and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, Epifanio, 45. She is prepared to work hard to improve her quality of life. She sells Andean products. Her stall is located in one of the town of Cabanillas's (Juliaca district) most important markets. She sells potatoes, quinoa, oca (a type of yam), etc. She spends all day waiting for her customers to buy her products; she is very cheerful so her stall is always crowded. In addition, what she most enjoys about her work is chatting with her neighbor sellers and finding out everything that goes on in the market. She has been in this line of work for 8 years and considers the most difficult part of it having to stay watching over her stall all day. For later in the future, she hopes her business will grow and produce higher income. This is her first loan with MFP. She is willing to set aside a part of her daily profits to repay the loan comfortably. She is very well-liked in her communal bank because she cheers up the other members. The 800 new soles requested will be used to increase the amount of merchandise she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Vanessa Del Pilar

texts.es:
Vanessa es una madre de familia de 25 años que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en casa de sus suegros ubicada en el sector Miguel Grau de la ciudad de Piura, a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años tiene instalada en casa de sus suegros una pequeña bodega. Ella nos comenta que instaló este negocio con ahorros que había logrado juntar trabajando como vendedora ambulante de pescado en años anteriores. El negocio constituye una fuente estable de ingresos a la familia ya que su esposo trabaja eventualmente como obrero en una ladrillera de la zona.

Vanessa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos con los cuales pueda captar más clientes. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de abarrotes y bebidas.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y muy alegre. Su más grande anhelo es seguir ampliando su negocio para poder juntar el dinero suficiente y construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Vanessa is a 25-year-old mother who lives with her husband and their child in the home of her husband's parents, located in the Miguel Grau sector of the city of Piura, three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

For three years she has had a small shop, located in the house of her husband's parents. She tells us that she opened this business with savings that she had managed to save working as a walking vendor of fish in past years. The business creates a stable source of income for the family, since her husband works intermittently in a brick factory in the area.

Vanessa wants to increase her business with the purchase of more products with which she can attract more customers. For this reason, she is applying for the first time at Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1000 PEN, which she plans to use in the purchase of grocery items and drinks.

She is a hard-working woman, responsible and very happy. Her greatest desire is to continue expanding her business in order to put together enough money to construct their own house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grocery items and beverages to expand her business

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan G. was born in 1979 and lives in Aghavnavank village, in the Ljevan area. He is married and has a daughter. Vardan has a good education and is a teacher. He has worked as a teacher in the Aghavnavanq village school and is alos a secretary in the village municipality. Part time he is engaged in livestock farming with his family. 

Last year Vardan had to leave his job with the village municipality because of the heavy farm work load. Now he works as a teacher and  in stock-breeding. Vardan says that stock-breeding is very hard work but also a very profitably business. With his profit from farming he provides for his family’s needs. 

Vardan has requested a loan of 1.000.000 AMD loan to buy a car to provide an easier life for his family.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita es oriunda del ande peruano, tiene 56 años y es madre de 3 hijos; 2 de ellos viven fuera y con el último vive en su una casa modesta ubicada al sur de la ciudad de Lima.

Desde que llegó a la ciudad se dedicó a infinidad de labores, pero de todas ellas la que más le dio resultado fue la venta de los productos de su zona; como la quinua, habas, maíz y otros granos. Esto lo realiza desde el puesto que tiene en el mercado de su distrito. Con esas ganancias se ha comprado utensilios adecuados para cocinar las menestras que también vende en su puesto. Gracias a esta actividad, Felicita ha podido educar a sus hijos y brindarles lo mejor, dentro de sus posibilidades, ya que no tiene pareja. Hace poco sufrió una fractura del brazo, pero espera recuperase muy pronto para seguir trabajando, mientras tanto su hijo la suple en su puesto.

Este es su 17avo préstamo con MFP y durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente muy responsable en el pago de sus cautas. Asimismo acude a todas las reuniones de su grupo, donde comparte experiencias y con sus compañeras de crédito. El dinero que ahora solicita los piensa utilizar en el incremento de su mercadería; así como algunos pagos médicos por su brazo fracturado.
texts.en:
Felicita is from the Peruvian Andes. She is 56 years old and the mother of 3 children. Two of them live on their own and the youngest lives with her in a modest house located in southern Lima. Since coming to the city, she has had countless jobs. Of all of them the one that had the best results was selling products from her area: quinoa, beans, corn and other grains. She does this in the stall she has in her district's market. With the profits, she has bought the equipment needed to cook the vegetable stews she also sells from her stall. Thanks to this activity, Felicita has been able to educate her children and offer them the best she can, since she doesn't have a husband. A short time ago, she broke her arm, but she expects to recuperate quickly and continue working. In the meantime, her son is taking over the stall. This is her 17th loan with MFP and she has shown that she is a very responsble customer with her payments. She also goes to all of the group meetings where she shares her experiences with the other loan members. She plans on using the money she is asking for now to increase her merchandise and also to pay some medical bills for her broken arm.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Las Juanitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama JUANITAS porque su desembolso fue un 24 de Junio día de San Juan, una de las integrantes vende comida. Esta ubicado en la colonia San José Vista Hermosa, en el Municipio de Puente de Ixtla en el Estado de Morelos. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes.

La señora Angélica Rómula Nájera Vázquez ocupa el puesto de Presidenta  del grupo tiene 29 años de edad, vive en Unión Libre, estudio hasta la secundaria, vende Abarrotes desde hace 4 años,  y tiene un hijo de 8 años.

Todas las señoras de este grupo son muy luchonas, trabajadoras y emprendedoras, en especial la señora Antonia A. Guzmán, Toñita para sus amigos,  es una mujer que ha  salido adelante a pesar de las adversidades, de nacionalidad Mexicana con 58 años de edad es viuda y se dedica a la venta de comida.

La señora Toñita se dedicó al hogar hasta el día en el cual quedó viuda, por lo que para sacar a delante a sus hijos, inició vendiendo tacos en la calle,  no fue fácil, ya que no estaba acostumbrada a trabajar en otra cosa que no fuera el hogar, pero la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia la lleno de fuerzas para seguir de pie, poco a poco va haciendo crecer el negocio, sabe que aun le falta mucho por hacer, sueña con poner una palapa, por ello con los créditos que se van otorgando va comprando material para alcanzar su sueño.

La señora Teresa M. P. es otra de las integrantes de este grupo tiene 56 años sin estudios, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y se dedica a la venta de comida inicio su negocio hace 16 años.

La señora Guadalupe Sánchez R. es otra de las integrantes de este grupo tiene 25 años estudio hasta la secundaria, vive en Unión Libre, tiene dos hijos y se dedica a la venta de refresco y dulces, inicio su negocio hace 2 años.

La señora Eusebia Sánchez M. es otra de las integrantes de este grupo tiene 56  años estudió hasta la secundaria, es viuda, tiene tres hijos y se dedica a la venta de colchas y repostería, inició su negocio hace 20 años.

La señora Herlinda C. V. es otra de las integrantes de este grupo tiene 57 años estudió hasta la primaria, vive en Unión Libre, tiene un hijo y se dedica a la venta de comida, inició su negocio hace 5 años.

La señora María del Carmen S. García es otra de las integrantes de este grupo tiene 48 años estudió hasta la primaria, esta casada, tiene tres hijo y se dedica a la venta de sabanas y colchas, inicio su negocio hace 8 años.

La señora Socorro S. V. es otra de las integrantes de este grupo tiene 31 años sin estudios, vive en unión libre, tiene dos hijos y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, inició su negocio hace 6 años.

La señora Socorro M. A. es otra de las integrantes de este grupo tiene 59 años estudió hasta la primaria,  esta casada, tiene tres hijos y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, inició su negocio hace 22 años.
texts.en:
This group is called Juanitas because it was established on June 24th, the day of San Juan. One of the group members sells food. The communal bank is located in the San José Vista Hermosa residential area of the municipality of Puente de Ixtla, in the state of Morelos. This group is comprised of 9 members.

Ms. Angélica Rómula Nájera Vázquez is the group president. She is 29 years old and is cohabitating. She has a middle school education and has been selling provisions for 4 years. She has an 8-year-old son.

All the women in this group are very persevering, hardworking and enterprising, especially Antonia A. Guzmán (or Toñita as she is known by her friends). She is a person who has been able to get ahead despite many adversities. She is a 58-year-old Mexican widow who sells food for a living.

Ms. Toñita had been a homemaker until the day that she became a widow. In order to support her children, she started selling tacos on the streets. It was not easy since she was not used to working outside her home; however, her need to help her family get ahead gave her the strength to stay on her feet. Little by little, she has been expanding her business. She knows that she still has a long way to go. She dreams of setting up a palm shelter. With the loan that she will receive, she will start purchasing the materials she needs to reach her goal.

Ms. Teresa M. P. is another group member. She is 56 years old and never received a formal education. She is a married mother of two and sells food for a living. She started this business 16 years ago.

Ms. Guadalupe Sánchez R., another group member, is 25 years old and has a middle school education. She is cohabitating and has 2 children. She has been selling soft drinks and candy for two years.

Ms. Eusebia Sánchez M. is a 56-year-old widow with 3 children. She also has a middle school education. She has been selling bedspreads and pastry for 20 years.

Ms. Herlinda C. V. is 57 years old and has an elementary school education. She is cohabitating and has one son. She has been selling food for 5 years.

Ms. María del Carmen S. García is 48 years old and has an elementary school education. She is a married mother of 3 who has been selling bed sheets and bedspreads for 8 years.

Ms. Socorro S. V. is 31 years old and does not have a formal education. She is cohabitating and has 2 children. She has been selling cosmetics for 6 years.

Ms. Socorro M. A. is 59 years old and has an elementary school education. She is a married mother of 3 who has been selling provisions for 22 years.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material to build a palm shelter

loans.name: Clementa

texts.en: Clementa M. has been married for 27-years. She has four children and she grows rice in Veruela Agusan Del Sur. The income which she gets from growing rice has helped her family a lot to buy food and other basic needs. Now, she has a small problem financing her rice farm so she is applying for a loan of Php 5,000 from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures Inc in order to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is a 49-year-old married man with one child. He has been working as a farmer for the past 20 years. He cultivates all types of fruits and vegetables according to the related season. He has taken a first loan from Kiva and he says that the loan amount was sufficient for his work last year. He has been very reliable with his repayments to Ameen and has actually repaid his loan in full several months early. 

Today, Ziad is asking for a new loan of $1,200 to buy fertilizers and seeds for the new harvesting in order to plow his land and make new cultivations.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Help To Help Group

texts.en:
Moses B. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Help To Help. He is 42 years old, married, and has five children who range in age from 1 to 13 years old. He also cares for a sibling. He is presently a college student.

For 10 years, Moses has been selling provisional goods like sugar, milk, coffee, tea, tissue, etc. at Pipeline Road in Paynesville, Liberia. He sells the goods that his clients demand, which keeps them returning. Moses started by selling for other business people but later decided to do his own business.   
He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more milk, sugar, coffee and other provisions. His goal is to grow his business and to educate his children so as to have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Moses is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more milk, sugar, coffee and other provisions.

loans.name: Yaovi François

texts.fr:
Cet homme âgé de 37 ans est marié et père de 02 enfants. Il est menuisier de formation. Pour maximiser ses revenus, il vend de la quincaillerie. Il fait cette activité depuis 03 ans.
Il s’approvisionne au Ghana et vend ses marchandises à Adidogomé. Actuellement, son stock ne lui permet pas de faire face à la demande de la clientèle. C’est la raison pour laquelle il sollicite ce crédit de WAGES.
Il compte beaucoup sur notre appui financier pour faire décoller ses activités et réaliser de meilleurs rendements.
texts.en:
This 37-year old man is married and father to two children. He trained as a carpenter. In order to maximise his income, he sells hardware. He has been carrying out this activity for three years. He gets his supplies in Ghana and sells his goods in Adidogomé. His current stock does not allow him to meet customer demand and for this reason he is requesting a loan from WAGES. He is counting significantly on our financial support in order to get his activities going and make better profits.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hardware items

loans.name: Maria Aurora

texts.es:
La Sra. María L. pertenece al banco comunal hace 5 años, esta muy  agradecida con su amiga quien la invito a formar parte del grupo, vive en la parroquia de Paccha, esta parroquia se encuentra al noreste del cantón Cuenca, la agricultura y ganadería, son las ocupaciones tradicionales de los habitantes, su atractivo turístico es su iglesia parroquial y el imponente cerro de Guagualzhumi tradicional por 
las ruinas arqueológicas, y su posición le da un dominio sobre buena parte de la planicie del Tomebamba.

Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, y también a su labor tradicional quien aprendió de sus padres como es la agricultura y cría de animales, como chanchos, aves, cuyes, los que vende en su comunidad, también para obtener un poco mas de ingresos se dedica a vender comida típica ecuatoriana (tamales, humitas, tortillas, dulces, etc.), los mismos que vende recorriendo la ciudad.

Nuestra socia tiene 66 años de edad es madre soltera y ha concebido 2 hijos quienes  son  adultos ya que tienen 46 y 39 años de edad, son casados, solo su primer hijo vive con ella en su casa y es quien le ayuda en su economía; cuenta con su casa propia que es herencia de su padre.

Tiene una linda amistad con todas sus compañeras gracias a su carisma y alegría. Con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para la elaboración de sus productos, y  frutas para la elaboración de sus dulces, su meta es de seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. María L. has belonged to the communal bank for 5 years. She is very grateful with her friend who invited her to be a part of the group. She lives in the parish of Paccha. This parish is found in the northeast of the Cuenca canton. Agriculture and cattle are the traditional occupations of the residents. Its tourist attraction is its parish church and the imposing mountain of Guagualzhumi, known for its archeological ruins and its dominance over a large portion of the Tomebamba plain. María is a housewife and also has her traditional work she learned from her parents, such as raising animals such as pigs, birds, and guinea pigs that she sells in her community. She also obatins a little more income selling traditional Ecuadorian food (tamales, humitas, tortillas, sweets, etc.). She sells these throughout the city. Our member is 66 years old and is a single mother of two children who are adults, aged 46 and 39. They are married and only her oldest son lives with her in her house and helps her with her finances. She has her own home which she inherited from her father. She has a nice friendship with all of the other members thanks to her charisma and cheerfulness. She will invest the new loan to buy ingredients to make her products and fruit to make her sweets. Her goal is to keep growing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit, sugar, corn, flour, eggs, butter, salt, etc.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta Alicia Z. C. de 44 años de edad, es una señora muy alegre y trabajadora, la cual se dedica a la venta de calzado para dama, tenis y sandalias, desde hace más de 20 años que realiza este tipo de trabajo, obteniendo gran experiencia y así mismo muchos clientes.
