Ella vive junto a sus tres hijos y una nieta en Chalchuapa, departamento de Santa Ana. Marta trabaja para poder sostener a sus dos hijos menores ya que el mayor se dedica a trabajar para sostenerse el mismo y a su pequeño hijo. Marta posee su negocio en la calle principal del centro de Chalchuapa, un lugar el cual cuenta con mucho comercio y gran afluencia de personas. Ella ofrece muy buenos precios por lo que cuenta con muy buenas ventas diarias y así mismo posee clientes frecuentes. Marta solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de calzado, en variedad de estilos y colores  así mismo en diferentes tallas, de manera que pueda abarcar a mayor cantidad de personas y sus ventas puedan aumentar. Marta desea ampliar su negocio y de esta forma percibir mayores ganancias las cuales mejoren la estabilidad económica de su hogar.
texts.en:
Marta Alicia Z. C. is a happy and hard-working forty-four year old, who makes a living selling woman's shoes (tennis, sandals). She has been working in this field for twenty years gaining experience and earning many customers. She lives in Chalchuapa, in the department of Santa Ana, with her three children and granddaughter. Marta works so she can support her two youngest kids since the eldest works and supports himself and his small son. Marta's business is on Chalchuapa's main street, a busy commercial street with many affluent people. She offers good prices which is why she makes many sales each day and has regular customers. Marta is taking out a loan so she can buy more shoes of various styles, colors, and sizes so she can reach more people and increase her sales. Marta would like to increase her business and in this way earn more which will contribute to economic stability in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of shoes.

loans.name: Rwahi Women's Group- Ntungamo

texts.en: N. Jean, 45 years old, has had her retail shop in Ntungamo Town for 12 years. She started this business out of savings from her salary as a clerk. It goes without saying that hard work and determination have brought her this far. She has also been getting additional profits from her catering business. She is fully able to live within the ways and means of her business. To reach this milestone, she has gone through the many challenges that plague all businesses. In her case, being a widow, she has had to grapple with the operational costs of her business alone. Her strong resolve has seen her through all this. All her children describe her as a loving mother who has seen them through adversity and who has, most importantly, given them an education. In a week, her business generates reliable profits of 200,000 UGX. With this loan, she wants to buy more retail stock such as bars of soap, plastics, bags of sugar and edibles for her shop.

loans.use: buying more retail items such as sugar, soap and plastics

loans.name: Galina's Group

texts.ru:
Члены данной группы являются жителями с. Тюп, что находится на берегу высокогорного, красивейшего оз. Иссык Куль. Здесь также протекает река с одноимённым названием Тюп, которая впадает в озеро. Своеобразный рельеф и природные условия сами собой обозначили характер жизнедеятельности местного населения. Жители в основном заняты животноводством. Галина Джанжалова – лидер группы. Галине сорок один год. К этому возрасту, Галина воспитала четверых детей. В этом году в семье Галины особое событие – старшая дочь, которой уже исполнилось восемнадцать лет, поступает в ВУЗ. Остальные трое сыновей учатся в школе: в десятом, пятом и третьем классах соответственно. Муж Галины занимается крестьянским хозяйством. Дети активно помогают отцу ухаживать за скотом и в повседневных заботах по дому. Галина же нашла свою нишу в продаже молока, яиц и различных молочных продуктах. Она ежедневно сдаёт девять – десять литров молока, яйца и сметану в местный магазин. От продажи всего этого, Галина выручает около двух тысяч сомов ежемесячно. Причина, побудившая Галину обратиться за этим кредитом, заключается в том, что Галине необходимо закупить продукты питания для дома. С теми средствами, что у неё имеются, она не смогла бы купить продукты по оптовой цене. Галина всё подсчитала и надеется сэкономить значительные средства. Она привыкла так поступать, так как знает, что ей нужно заранее копить средства, чтобы обучить остальных троих сыновей в ВУЗах. 
Партнёры Галины по группе:
Джазы Ковшановой пятьдесят шесть. Джазы уже несколько лет вдова. У Джазы двое детей, которые во время летних отпусков помогают маме по хозяйству, а Джазы работает медсестрой. Джазы нужен кредит, чтобы купить пять овец. 

Тумаре Жороевой сорок два года. Она – мать пятерых детей. Вместе с мужем они занимаются сельским хозяйством. У них есть участок земли, а также небольшое поголовье скота. Тумара обратилась за кредитом, так как ей нужно купить сто литров солярки. 

Сандикуль Иманкуловой сорок два. Сандикуль растит семерых детей. Старший сын уже учится в ВУЗе. Чтобы прокормить семью Сандикуль открыла магазин, а её муж занимается домашним хозяйством. Сандикуль надеется получить кредит и купить смородину и сахар для реализации. 

Улгельди Уркумбаевой пятьдесят лет. Она разведена и воспитывает одну дочь. Улгелди работает в библиотеке и помимо этого , у неё имеется кое – какая живность. Улгельди надеется получить кредит и купить пять голов овец. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
The members this group live in Tup, which is located on the shore of the beautiful, high-mountain lake, Issyk-Kul. Here is where the river Tup runs into the lake. The landscape and the environment have shaped the lifestyle of the local population. Inhabitants primarily work in animal husbandry. Galina J. is the leader of the group. Galina is forty-one years old. Galina has raised four children. This year Galina's family is having a special event. Her oldest daughter, who is eighteen, is starting college. The other three sons go to school in the tenth, fifth, and third grades. Galina's husband runs the family farm. The children help their father to look after the cattle and to do daily chores around the house. Galina has found a niche in the sale of milk, eggs, and various dairy products. Daily, she delivers nine or ten liters of milk, along with eggs and sour cream, to a local shop. From these sales, Galina earns about two thousand som every month. Galina has applied for this loan to buy household food supplies. With the money she makes, she is unable to buy goods wholesale. Galina has calculated her potential savings and they are considerable. She is used to doing this, and she knows she needs to start saving now to put her three sons through college. Galina's partners in the group include: Jazy K. is fifty-six years old. Jazy has been a widow for several years. Jazy has two children who, during their summer holidays, help their mother at home. Jazy works as a nurse. Jazy needs a loan to buy five sheep. Tumara J. is forty-two years old. She is the mother of five children. She and her husband work in agriculture. They have land and a small herd of cattle. Tumara has applied for a loan since she needs to buy a hundred liters of diesel. Sandikul I. is forty-two years old. Sandikul is raising seven children. The eldest son is already in college. To support seven children, Sandikul has opened a shop, and her husband works at home. Sandikul hopes to borrow money to buy currants and sugar for making preserves. Ulgeldi U. is fifty years old. She is divorced and is raising one daughter. Ulgeldi works in library and, additionally, owns some animals. Ulgeldi hopes get a loan to buy five head of sheep. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase covenience goods: sugar and crops

loans.name: Efu

texts.en:
M. Efu is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a carpenter. M. has been through senior high education.

M. sells sponges at Takoradi. She has been selling sponges for some time and is responsible for helping her husband provide the basic needs of her family.

M.’s loan will be used to buy sponges in larger quantity to sell. She wishes to use the profits from her business to save to add another trade to her business.

loans.use: To buy sponges in larger quantity to sell

loans.name: Iver Jhonny

texts.es: El Sr. Iver vive en la zona del Plan 3000 en el Barrio de los Pocitos, se dedica a la venta de bebidas y atención de rockola, además que durante el día atienden ahí mismo una pensión familiar, hace como un año que comenzaron con esta actividad y vieron la necesidad de atender con una rockola ya que los clientes solicitaron música para ambientar el lugar. El ayuda a su madre que vive con el, con su negocio colabora con las medicinas que necesita su mamá ya que ella se encuentra enferma de reumatismo, él pese a  tener 19 años, es una persona que presenta mucho interes en superarse ya que aparte de atender su negocio piensa comenzar a estudiar para formarse profesionalmente. Él necesita el credito para terminar de pagar la rockola y además comprar más sillas y mesas que le hacen falta para la pensión.
texts.en:
Sr. Iver lives in the Plan 3000 area of the Pocitos neighborhood. He has a business where his customers can both buy drinks and listen to "rockola" (a karaoke-like entertainment). Along with that, he tends his family's "pension" (room-rental) business during the day. He started the beverages business a year ago and soon saw the need to offer rockola because his customers wanted it. Iver helps his mother, who lives with him, with the medicines she needs to battle rheumatism. Though Iver is only 19 years old, he is strongly driven to get ahead in the world. Apart from his business, he is planning to go to school to study for a paid career. He needs a loan to pay for the rockola, along with tables and chairs that he needs for the pension.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for food business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has been practicing mixed farming for fifteen years in Murang'a town, central Kenya. His main products are milk and coffee which he sells at a local market. He also earns income from his rental houses in the same area.

James has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000KES to expand his poultry farm. He hopes that with this loan, he will be able to buy more chickens to increase his income. In the future, he hopes to acquire at least 1000 chickens to produce over 30 trays of eggs. His biggest challenge has been lack of sufficient funds to sustain the business due to the high cost of feed.

James is 47 years old. He is married with two children ages 8 and 12. Both children attend school.

He comments that farmers will be able to grow through the Juhudi projects which make financing available to small-scale farmers.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Mrs. Vanna N. got married to Mr. Savorn Vat and they live in Kab Nuem village in Takeo province. She was born in 1986. She and her husband are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land where they can grow rice to sell to support their family. She is also a wedding beautician and her husband is a taxi driver. This couple tries to work a lot but they only earn a little money. So, to improve her family living, Mrs. Vanna N. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to start a new business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa M. D. G. D. 61 años D. edad, es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a su hogar. Ella vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos quienes estudian. Rosa posee un comedor y pupusería, el cual esta ubicado en su casa D. habitación la cual esta ubicada en Usulután, en donD. ha trabajado durante 14 años, haciendo desayunos y al almuerzos, los cuales en un principio únicamente vendía con sus vecinos, pero que en la actualidad venD. incluso con motoristas del transporte público, lo cual le ha permitido incrementar sus ventas y así mismo ser más conocida en el lugar, Rosa necesita  poder incrementar su materia prima para poder atender a más clientes, es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. verduras, granos básicos, fruta, jugos, sodas, todo lo necesario para poder atender mejor a sus clientes y así mismo atender a más clientes. Ella desea mucho poder aprovechar al máximo esta situación, debido a que es la única forma en la cual se gana la vida, y la cual le ha permitido poder sostener a sus hijos.
texts.en: Rosa M. D. G., 61, is a very hardworking person who is devoted to her family.  She lives with her husband and 2 children, who are in school.  Rosa has an eatery where pupusas (an El Salvadoran dish maD. of a corn tortilla filled with meats, cheeses or beans) are sold that is located in her home. Her home is located in Usulután, where she has worked over the last 14 years making breakfasts and lunches, which at first she sold only to her neighbors.  But now she also sells to public transportation passengers, which has allowed her to increase her sales and also become more well-known in her area.  Rosa needs more supplies so that she can sell to more customers, and this is the reason that she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL.  Through this loan she will be able to buy a greater quantity of vegetables, staple grains, fruit, juice, sodas, and everything she needs to meet the needs of her customers.  This way she can get more customers.  She wants very much to be able to take advantage of this situation, since this is the only way that she can earn a living and proviD. for her children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, and staple grains, to make food to sell

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
This is Lita Mansojueto, 35, resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Amado, an overseas Filipino worker, and mother of two toddlers. She works hard so as to be able to educate both her children all the way through college. It is a dream for most Filipino parents like Lita as she is a high school graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave their children.

Lita operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from round palm-sized ones, to the much larger doormats, braided quilts, and bed sheets. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, they are one of the most common products that can be bought — sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway!  Lita earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business,  Lita is requesting a Php12,000 loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy more raw materials like fabric, thread

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 46-year old married woman from Binangonan in the province of Rizal, living with her husband and seven children. Two of them are college graduates and five of them are still attending school. In 1998, she opened her own business, selling fried” itik” (small ducks) in the community. Her avid customers come from the surrounding areas and nearby town. 

Virginia is now requesting a loan in order to purchase more “itik” to sell. She believes that having more fried itik will help her retain her current customers as well as attract new clients in the neighborhood. Her previous loan played an important role in developing the business and her increased profits enabled her to invest in her home.

A proud member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) since 2008 (a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines), Virginia has been a dedicated member, with regular attendance at weekly center meetings and a solid record in repayments on previous loans. 

Virginia hopes that, with the help of ASHI and Kiva, she can achieve her main dream in life: sending her five remaining children to school until they find jobs, and to build her own comfortable home to live in. Virginia also extends her helping hand to her niece and nephew to bring them to school, making education their priority. She also dreams of a successful business, and even has plans to have her own booth in the market in the future. 

Additionally, she hopes to continue her business to provide a sustainable livelihood for her family. Now, she says, her dreams are nearly within reach.

loans.use: To purchase more inventories of "itik" (small ducks).

loans.name: Celeste Alfredo

texts.pt:
Celeste Alfredo C. nasceu no Distrito de Manhiça, na Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada mãe de 7 filhos, com idades comprieendidas entre os 19 aos 38 anos de idade, 4 deles já estão empregados e 3 vão a Escola. Vive na casa propria e responsabiliza se pela sua sobrinha que vive com ela em sua casa.

Celeste sai de Manhiça para Vila de Namaacha com seu esposo, este que foi transferido para trabalhar naquele Distrito, ela inicia com o negócio de venda refeições nas barracas da fronteira que depois foram abolidas pelo Governo do Distrito devido a poluição do ambiente. Com ajuda do seu vizinho que também era um grande criador ela constroi uma capoeira na sua residência e inicia com o mesmo negócio e tornou se numa grande criadora ate então, tem criado no maximo 100x5 caixas de pintos gastando 50.000.00mt e vende cada frango a 125.00mt, cria em fases para poder vender alternadamente. Tem vendido a maior parde dos frangos a grosso, pois gastam menos ração e tem tido um lucro de 12.500.00mt e por unidade para consumidores locais o lucro decresce para 10.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes desta Instituição. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt para comprar pintos, ração e vitaminas para aumentar a quantidade de frangos para calhar com a época festiva que se aproxima. Os anteriores emprestimos de (10.000.00, 10.500.00 e 25.000.00) forão também usados para a mesma finalidade.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para adquirir uma carrinha que lhe facilitara nos trabalhos diários.
texts.en:
Celeste Alfredo C. was born in the district of Manhiça, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is married and has 7 children ranging in age from 19 to 38 years old. Four of her children are working and 3 attend school. She lives in her own house and helps support her niece, who lives with her.

Celeste moved from Manhiça to the district of Namaacha with her husband, who was transferred there for work. She started a business selling meals in the barracks on the border with Swaziland; these were later closed by the government due to the pollution in the area. With the help of her neighbor, who did well raising poultry, she built a chicken coop by her house and started raising chickens. She has also become very successful with this venture. She's raised hundreds of chicks and has spent around 50,000 Meticais in doing so, while she can sell each chicken for 125 Meticais. She staggers the age of the chicks so that she always has mature chickens to sell. She sells most of her chickens wholesale, since she saves on feed that way, and she's made a profit of 12,500 Meticais. She also sells directly to local consumers, though her profit doing this is only 10,000 Meticais. She uses this income to cover household expenses and also saves some in her bank account. 

Celeste has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through friends who also work with the institution. This is her 5th loan, for the amount of 20,000 Meticais. She plans to use this money to buy chicks, feed and vitamins in order to increase the number of chickens she can raise, as she want more chickens to sell during the coming holidays. Her earlier loans were for 10,000, 10,500 and 25,000 Meticais and were used for the same purpose.

She is confident that she will be able to repay the loan ahead of schedule and take out new loan to buy a pushcart that will help her in her daily work.

loans.use: Purchase of chicks, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Yina María

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jesús.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora  Yina, ella tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 4 hijos de 10, 8, 6 y 3 años, los tres  mayores están en escuela. Su marido es mecánico.

Tienen un taller de mecánica automotriz en el que realizan muchos trabajos… además también  venden repuestos, llantas y aceites. Trabajan de lunes a sábado desde las 7h30 hasta las 18h00, trabajan con la ayuda de dos operarios, mientras su esposo se encarga de los trabajos de mecánica, ella se encarga de lo que es la contabilidad, compra y venta de los repuestos, nos cuenta que llevan en ese trabajo ya por 9 años y que aunque al principio fue duro con el tiempo han conseguido muchos clientes que los prefieren por su trabajo y responsabilidad.

Este crédito lo va en emplear en comprar aceite, repuestos, filtros. Esta en el Banco Comunal desde los inicios del mismo y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución. Su meta es que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the 'Marianita de Jesús' community bank meet in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez which is known for its beaches, its good food and the warmth of its people.

Here we meet Yina.  Yina is 28 years old, married, and has 4 children aged 10, 8, 6 and 3.  The three oldest children are in elementary school.  Her husband is a mechanic.

Yina and her husband have a garage in which they carry out a lot of work.  They also sell spare parts, tires and oils.  They work from Monday to Saturday, from 7.30am to 6.00pm.  They work with the help of two employees.  Whilst her husband works as a mechanic, Yina takes care of the accounts and buying and selling spare parts.  They tell us that they have been in this business for 9 years and, although it was difficult at first, over time they have attracted many customers who are loyal to their business because of the work they do and their responsibility.

This loan will be used to buy oil, spare parts and filters.  Yina has been a member of her community bank since the beginning and she likes it for the benefits that our institution provides.  Her goal is for her children to be good professionals.

loans.use: To buy spare parts, oils and filters

loans.name: G.s. El Triangulo Group

texts.es: El grupo Solidario Triangulo está conformado por Lucia y Tamara tienen diferentes actividades económicas. Lucia tiene 47 años y su actividad es una pulpería, es madre de 5 hijos, pero todos trabajan de manera independiente es una persona muy activa con su negocio. Tamara es una joven emprendedora con todas las ganas de salir adelante, ella tiene 1 hijo menor de edad y su actividad es la venta de cosméticos. Son personas muy humildes que buscan la forma de salir adelante. El crédito que solicitan es para invertirlos en sus negocios y aprovechar esta temporada festiva.
texts.en:
The Solidario Triangulo group is made up of Lucia and Tamara, who have different businesses.  Lucia is 47 years old and has a general store.  She has five children, who all work independently.  She is very active in her business.  Tamara is a young entrepreneur with a drive to succeed.  She has one young child and she sells cosmetics.  They are both humble people who are looking for a way to succeed.  

They are asking for this loan to invest in their businesses and take advantage of the holiday season.

loans.use: Working capital for a general store and cosmetics business

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Selling dried fish is the main part of 67-year-old Sen N.’ daily routine. Sen N. has been operating this business since 2000, and she earns an income in average $3 per day. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a motor taxi driver. This couple has given birth to two children; both are single, and one of them is employed as a sewing worker at the garment industry.  Recently, Sen N. faces difficulties because her old house needs to be repaired and it is not comfortable for her and her family to live in. Because her saving is not enough to repair the broken house, Sen N. would like to request a loan from Kiva to add to her savings to repair her broken house.

loans.use: To repair her broken house.

loans.name: Sheema

texts.en:
Sheema belongs to a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, called Kasur, which is famous for its tanneries industry. She lives there in a three-room brick house with her family. She shares the financial burden with her husband by operating a small grocery store adjacent to her home. Through this store she sells daily use items like cooking oils, sugar, spices, candies, tea, etc. to her customers. She offers her customers quality products at cheap rates. She has been operating this business for the past five years. Her husband is a driver by profession. He owns a rickshaw which he uses to provide transport services to passengers.
 
Sheema is the mother of three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is also a driver by profession while the second one is an electrician. Her elder daughter is studying in class 5. The others stay at home and don’t do anything.
 
Sheema has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her grocery store business. With the loan, she will buy groceries in bulk that will help her to fulfill the demands of many more customers and to make more sales. She is very confident that her business will enjoy good growth after the loan investment and that she will be able to provide a better life for her family as a result.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Ndeh

texts.en:
Born in 1959, Ndeh P. is married with four children. He has faced a lot of challenges, the worst being the death of his brother and father.

Given the need to carry the burden as a father to educate and feed his children, He became a member of GHAPE and was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. He has been able to manage loans now for nine years which has greatly improved his living standard. Given this loan he plans to buy and fatten chickens and sell them. He also plans to sell three-week-old chicks he produces in the community and use the chicken droppings as manure on his farm.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: chickens and feed for them

loans.name: Irma Irene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHASKA ÑAHUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irma Irene; la socia tiene 39 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; la socia lleva la contabilidad de diferentes empresas que se encuentran en el medio , esta es una actividad que le gusta mucho a la socia a la vez la socia es consultora de belleza de las líneas Avon,Unique y Esika ella vende productos como cremas,colonias,perfumes,entre otros más la socia es una persona bien alegre y optimista y de esta forma la socia saca a su familia adelante y ahora que sus hijos iran al colegio ella solicita el prestamo para comprar lo que son uniformes ,cuadernos entre otros mas.

La socia solicita el préstamo para su uso personal como son los útiles escolares de sus hijos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Chaska Ñahui Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Cusco District, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

Irma Irene is 39 years old, has a live-in partner, and has two children. She handles the accounting for different intermediary companies and she enjoys this work very much. At the same time, she is also a beauty consultant for Avon, Unique, and Esika. She sells products like creams, colognes and perfumes, among other items. She is a very happy and optimistic person and this is how she gets her family ahead in life. Now that her children will go to school, she is requesting the loan to buy uniforms, notebooks, and other items.

She is requesting the loan for personal use to buy school supplies for her children.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: To buy school supplies for her children

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has been farming in Nduyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  She is 42 years old, married to David Kiguru, and they have five children. 
  
She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend.  This will be her fourth loan.  She paid for all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy two dairy cows.

In the future, Margaret hopes to become a leading milk producer in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Phebis

texts.en: Phebis is a thirty-year-old married woman with three children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in textiles for two years starting with a capital of 600,000 shillings and now has 4,000,000 shillings. Her hardship is high rent and her vision is own a boutique and educate her children. Phebis needs the loan to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Khov's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people. Mrs. Khov is the group leader, selected by the other members. She was born in 1955, and she is a widow with seven children: two are employed at a casino club, one is a solider, and the others are students and also help in their mother's business.

Mrs. Khov is a corn middleman who is able to earn a small income to support her family. In order to improve the family's living conditions, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more corn for selling. She also earns her living by renting her house.

loans.use: to buy more corn for resale.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de gallinas y también se dedica a vender pasto y huevo sancochado en forma ambulatoria en el mercado de Andahuaylillas, su esposo trabaja como albañil arreglando y pintando casas, por medio de estos pequeños negocios y trabajos la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar sus negocios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una maquina de mezclar para el trabajo de su esposo como albañil.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Valentina is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Triunfadoras” (The Winners) which is in the District of Andahuaylillas, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Valentina divides her time between her daily activities and her businesses of selling chickens, grasses, and boiled eggs as a traveling merchant at the market in Andahuaylillas. Her husband is a mason who repairs and paints houses. Through her small businesses and various jobs, Valentina is able to help her children get ahead. She wants to expand her businesses. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a cement mixer for her husband’s masonry work.

Valentina is happy with this loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase a cement mixer for her husband's masonry work.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma es una mujer experta en ventas, tiene 61 años pero si siente joven, pues está feliz al vivir en la casa que construyó con tanto esfuerzo con el compañero D. su vida, Antonio D. 62 años, ambos tuvieron 4 hijos que ya tienen su propia familia conformada. Ahora ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío D. Huaylahuichan. El sabor D. la carne D. cuy y sus componentes alimenticios hicieron que Norma, se dedique a la crianza D. este animal desD. hace 43 años. Además siembra maíz, papa, arveja, flores D. gladiolo, asimismo cría gallinas, cerdos y carneros que comercializa en mayores cantidades en las ferias semanales D. las ciudades aledañas D. Tarma, en esta actividad su esposo es quien la ayuda, él normalmente se dedica a tocar instrumentos musicales, que son típicas D. la zona. Ella asegura que sus ganancias desD. un principio le permitieron vivir cómodamente, el como alimentarse a base D. comida natural, también refiere que su familia tiene una adecuada calidad D. vida porque  Dios los bendice. Es feliz con su estilo D. vida, y espera mas adelante aumentar la cantidad D. cuyes que tiene, por considerar como negocio muy rentable, además destino un terreno amplio para sembrar alfalfa que sirve D. forraje para estos animales.  Menciona también que incursionó en la venta D. colchas y frazadas, “que ella misma teje”; a los pobladores D. su localidad, así gana un dinero extra. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva esperanza”, y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donD. está muy agradecida con los integrantes D. su banco comunal, quienes siempre la apoyan desinteresadamente porque se consideran familia. Norma, cosechará como D. costumbre, “maíz del cuzco” (una variedad D. maíz), pues aprovechará la cercanía del río para mantener su sembrío en buenas condiciones. Por ello con el dinero comprará varios sacos D. abono orgánico que le servirá D. refuerzo nutricional.
texts.en:
Norma is a woman skilled in sales.  She is 61 years old, but she feels young.  She is happy to live in the house she built with so much effort with her life partner, Antonio, 62.  They both had 4 children who already have their own formed family. Now they live in their own house, located in the hamlet of Huaylahuichan. 

Norma has been breeding guinea pigs for 43 years and also makes cuy (guinea pig) meat and food components.  Besides growing corn, potatoes, peas, and gladiolus flowers, she also raises chickens, pigs and sheep.  She sells them in great numbers in the weekly markets of the neighboring cities of Tarma with her husband's help.  He is normally dedicated to playing musical instruments, which is typical of the area. She says that her earnings from the start allowed them to live comfortably, and eat natural foods.  She reports that her family also has an adequate quality of life because God blesses them. 

Norma is happy with their lifestyle, and later hopes to increase the number of guinea pigs that she has, as they are considered a very profitable business.  She also hopes to target a broad field for planting alfalfa to serve as fodder for the animals. She also mentions that she began selling quilts and blankets, "which she weaves herself" to the residents of her town to earn extra money. Norma belongs to the communal bank "New Hope", and this is her eighth loan from MFP.  She is very grateful to the members of the communal bank who always unselfishly support her because they are considered family. Norma, will reap as usual, "cuzco corn"(maize variety) to make use of the nearby river to keep their seeding in good condition. She will buy more bags of organic fertilizer with the money that will serve as nutritional support for the land.

loans.use: To buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a 49-year-old single woman who supports her mother and her sisters' children. For four years, she has been selling secondhand clothes, and at the same time she manages rental houses.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET by a friend. She plans to use the entire loan amount to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

In future she plans to grow her business, buy another plot of land to build more rental houses and also to educate the children that she supports.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Señor De Wimpillay Chocco Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Señor De Wimpillay Chocco” y se reúnen  cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de Santiago en el populoso barrio de Winpillay  (Cusco, Perú).  El banco comunal se distingue por estar conformado por gente trabajadora,  profesionales, artesanos y comerciantes. El grupo está conformado por doce integrantes y son varias vez que solicitan un préstamo de la Asociación Arariwa y invertirán el dinero para mejorar sus negocios. 

En esta reunión conocimos a la señora Isabel y nos cuenta que vive en el barrio de Winpillay de la ciudad del Cusco junto con su pareja y sus tres hijos. Desde joven se caracterizo por ser una persona responsable y amable y por ese motivo sus vecinas le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal. Isabel tiene una pequeña tienda de comestibles en su domicilio donde vende sus productos a costos accesibles para sus clientes. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería así poder abastecer su tienda y surtir de diferentes productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo leche en tarros. Ella tiene 43 años, es una persona con muchas ganas de superarse y tener un negocio exitoso día con día, siempre con el deseo de brindarles lo mejor a su familia. El sueño de la socia es ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Señor De Wimpillay Chocco” and it meets every thirty days in Cusco’s Santiago district, in a crowded neighborhood called Wimpillay (Cusco, Perú).  The communal bank stands out for being composed of hard working people, professionals, artisans and merchants.  The group has 12 members and they have asked for several loans from Asociación Arariwa.  They will use the money to improve their businesses.

We met Isabel at the meeting.  She told us that she lives in Cusco’s Wimpillay neighborhood with her spouse and three children.  Since a very young age she distinguished herself by being a very responsible and kind person and because of this her neighbors invited her to participate in the communal bank.

Isabel has a small grocery store at home where she sells items at accessible prices to her customers.  On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy more merchandise to stock her store and have different basic need items on hand, for example, jars of milk.

She is 43 years old and is a person with a strong desire for self improvement and to have a business that succeeds every day always with the intention of providing the best for her family.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, like jugs of milk, for example.

loans.name: Adrian Alejandro

texts.es: Adrian Alejandro es un joven emprendedor y muy trabajador que desde pequeño aprendió el oficio de cortar cabello para hombre en lo que el opto por iniciar su propio negocio, el cual ya tiene 4 años en atención al publico donde ha obtenido variedad de clientes lo buscan por la buena atención y los cortes realizados al gusto. Adrian es chico de edad que ya formo su propia familia por quien quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y para que su negocio siga teniendo fruto el necita comprar mas utensilios de trabajo y acondicionar el negocio para que se vea presentable.
texts.en: Adrian Alejandro is a young entrepreneur who has worked hard since he was a boy.  He learned to cut men’s hair, and decided to establish his own business 4 years ago.  In serving the public, he has attracted a variety of customers, who come to him because of the good service they receive, and customized haircuts.  Adrian is young, and has already formed his own family, to whom he would like to offer a better lifestyle.  So that his business will continue to grow, he needs to purchase more tools of his trade, and make his premises more attractive.

loans.use: invest in his business.

loans.name: Nairesiae

texts.en:
Nairesiae is a very hard-working lady, who practises mixed farming in Olokurto-Narok, Kenya. She has been in this business for over five years and earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. She is 51 years old and married to Weldon, also a farmer, and they have five children.


She is applying for her fourth loan. She plans to use part of the loan amount to buy farm inputs and other items for business use. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees.


She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and other items for business use

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel tiene 30 años, está casada con Percy, de 31 años de edad. Ambos tiene 2 hijos: Ronaldo, de 9 y Jair, de 3 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Está exitosa mujer se dedica a la siembra de papa, arveja y habas, hace 19 años. La agricultura es su principal actividad económica y lo que más le gusta a ella es poder salir al campo desde las primeras horas del día a cuidar de sus cultivos, los cuales ahora está creciendo sin mayores inconvenientes; pues augura que está próxima cosecha obtendrá buenas ganancias en sus ventas en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde lleva a vender su producción constantemente. Además de seguir trabajando en conjunto con su banco comunal, ya que ellos le ayudan a mantener sus cultivos al día e invertir con capital de trabajo. Ahora ella está trabajando duro para poder cosechar su cultivo de flor de gladiolo, y después orientar sus ganancias hacia los estudios de sus hijos que son su prioridad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pioneros de cumutay” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de la colaboración de todos ustedes para continuar con sus planes. Además se compromete en pagar regularmente sus cuotas. Raquel de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja para su próxima cosecha.
texts.en: Raquel is 30 years old and married to Percy, who is 31.  Together they have 2 children, Ronaldo, who is 9 years old, and Jair, who is 3.  The family lives in a rented house located in a place called Cumutay.   Raquel is a successful woman who has worked cultivating potatoes, peas and beans for 19 years.   Agriculture is her main source of income.  She likes that she is able to work in the fields very early in the morning, caring for the crops which right now are growing without any problems.  Hopefully this means the next harvest will generate good income from her sales in the wholesale market in Tarma, where she regularly carries her crops to sell.   In addition to continued work with the communal bank, which helps her maintain her crops and invest capital in her business, Raquel is also working hard now to cultivate and harvest gladiola flowers, the money generated will help pay for educating her children, who are her priority.    Raquel is a member of the communal bank called "Pioneros de cumutay", or Pioneers of Cumutay, and this is her 7th loan with MFP.  She hopes for your support in helping her continue with her plans.   She has committed to make the payments on time.   The loan will be used to purchase a bag of pea seeds for the next harvest.

loans.use: to purchase bags of pea seeds to plant

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana Maria tiene nueve años de dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes. 
Está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en comprar de mercancía que es productos de carnes frías, latíos, verduras y fruta, ya que sus clientes le están solicitando que tenga estos productos a venta.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso para su familia, ya que es madre soltera y tiene un hijo bajo su responsabilidad y desea mejorar la calidad de vida y tener mayor ingreso en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Maria has been running a grocery store for nine years.  She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as cold meats, vegetables and fruit since her customers are asking for these products.

She plans to pay back the loan with part of the earnings from her business since it is the source of income for her family.  She is a single mother and has a son in her care, and wants to improve her lifestyle and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan de 39 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus abuelos, cuenta con sólo servicio de  luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Juan maneja su propia mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace 2 año aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza en la misma zona donde vive, apesar de la competencia, él trata en lo posible salir desde muy temprano movilizar una buena cantidad de pasajeros a sus diferentes destinos, y así tenga mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades personales.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1200 nuevos soles y su destino será para la  compra de carpa y renovación de asientos para su mototaxi, con la finalidad de seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela y mejorar su nivel de vida.  Juan es un hombre trabajador y con esfuerzo desea salir adelante  junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 39 years old, single and living in his grandparents’ house that only has electricity and is located in the rural part of Mórrope District belonging to Lambayeque Department.  Residents of this area are in farming, livestock raising and tourism.

Juan has driven his own mototaxi (means of transport for short distances with a maximum capacity of three passengers).  He carries out this activity in the same area where he lives.  Despite competition, he tries to get out as early as possible to move a good number of passengers to their various destinations and thus earn a larger amount of income to cover his expenses and personal needs.

The 1200 new sol loan he’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for will be used to buy a tent and to renovate his mototaxi’s seats to continue providing good customer service and to improve his standard of living.  Juan is a hardworking man who wants to get ahead with his family through his own efforts.

loans.use: to buy a tent and to renovate his mototaxi's seats.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of buying & selling fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell for her business of buying & selling fish.

Jennifer has been in this business for 5 years. Jennifer earns additional  income from a sari sari store.

Jennifer has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy assorted fish to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 39 years old,  He is married to Rebecca, who is a teacher. They are blessed with three children.  He has been in a quarry business for the past three years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family members.

Robert is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loan. He will use part of this loan to employ labor and the rest as working capital to increase his income.

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children up to university level. His hopes and dreams are to open a butcher shop, which will improve the living standards for his family.

loans.use: To employ labor and use as working capital

loans.name: Ven

texts.en:
Mrs. Ven, 33, is a humble villager who lives in the Kompong Speu province. She has given birth to four children. Two of them are employed as sewing factory workers in Phnom Penh, where they can earn enough salary per month to contribute with Mrs. Ven. The other two are attending public school. 

Currently Mrs. Ven is a pig breeder, earning about $1.66 US per day. Taking time from this business, Mrs. Ven is also selling groceries in front of her house. She has pigs from a few months ago, but they are not growing well, so she has decided with her family to request some funding from HKL and Kiva. She will use this loan to buy some feed to fatten up her pigs. 

Mrs. Ven and her husband are shown in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy some feed to fatten up her pigs.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús tiene 45 años su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Ella es una persona muy responsable y que además se siente muy satisfecha de obtener un medio de ingreso para su familia. El motivo del crédito es para comprar variedad en sus productos como bolsos, perfumes, cremas, prendas, calzado, ropa en general, sabanas entre otros hasta los momentos tiene una gran cantidad de pedidos de parte de sus clientes y quiere cumplirlos.
texts.en: Teresa de Jesús is 43 years old and her business is selling general merchandise.  She is a very responsible person who feels very satisfied at having found a way of making income for her family.  She will use this loan to buy a range of products including bags, perfumes, creams, jewelry, footwear, clothes and sheets.  She has a large number of orders from her customers and she would like to fill them.

loans.use: to buy bags, perfumes, creams, jewelry, footwear, clothes and sheets

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is 53, married and has four adult children. As a responsible father, he works hard and strives harder to support his family. As a fruit of their patience and sacrifices, three of their children have already graduated from college while the youngest is still in college. To earn additional income, Marlon is engaged in cooking and selling food for snacks and meals. He has been operating this business for almost two years now and usually earns a profit of P7,000 a month which they utilize for their food and allowances for their child in college.

Marlon wants to ask for an additional capital of P10,000 to buy meat, fish, vegetables, spices and seasonings to be cooked and sold in the food stall. He mentioned that this loan will help a lot to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish, vegetables, spices and seasonings to be cooked and sold in the food stall.

loans.name: Tsetsegdulam

texts.en:
Tsetsegdulam is 45 years old.   She lives with her family in a rented house which is located in downtown Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  She runs a toy store in the bazaar called Narantuul. She has been doing her business for 5 years and has gained a lot experience in it. 

Already Tsetsegdulam has many customers, such as the parents and their lovely kids who always buy toys from her.  She needs some money to increase her working capital. It is very important for her to expand her business in the future.  

Tsetsegdulam is taking this loan to purchase a large number of toys from her suppliers to increase the inventory of her toy sales business.

loans.use: buy toys

loans.name: Justino Adolfo

texts.es: Justino Adolfo tiene 45 años, se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi desde hace mas de 15 años que tiene este medio de vida, el es un hombre trabajador que disfruta de tener este negocio. El comienza a trabajar desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche el tiene que buscar la manera de proveerle a su familia lo necesario para mejorar cada día. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de llantas, combustible, focos, caja de cambios entre otros. Sueña con obtener otra unidad de taxi para generar mayores ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en: Justino Adolfo is 45 years old, and for fifteen years he has been providing a taxi service. He is an industrious man who enjoys his work. He starts work at 7am and works until 9pm as he has to provide for his family every day. Justino is seeking a loan to buy tires, gas, headlights, gear box etc. His dream is to buy another taxi so he can earn more money for his family.

loans.use: to buy tires, gas, headlights, gear box etc.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man with twelve children. He has six dependents and he lives in his own house in Hoima, Uganda. 
Patrick is a hardworking man who has been operating a bar business for four years. He started it as a small village pub but now he has relocated it to Hoima town. His future goal is to open up another branch in Hoima town. Patrick needs a loan to buy beers, sodas, and other soft drinks for resale.

loans.use: to buy beer, sodas, and other soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Sergio Geronimo

texts.es:
Sergio vive en la ciudad del Ollantaytambo y tiene 26 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre. 

Sergio trabaja en un hospedaje como recepcionista y también tiene un negocio familiar que consiste en la venta de ropa. Ya son siete meses que él y su pareja se dedican a este negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Sergio en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo pantalones y otras cosas más. Su sueño de Sergio es comprar una casa. 

Sergio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sergio lives in the city of Ollantaytambo, he is 26 years old and he has a partner.

Sergio works as a receptionist in a boarding house and he also has a family business which involves selling clothes. He and his wife have been working in this business for seven months and it is going very well for them thanks to the effort they put into their work. On this occasion, Sergio needs the loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, among other items. Sergio's dream is to buy a house.

Sergio is grateful for the opportunity that has been given to him and he therefore promises to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as pants, among other items.

loans.name: Sango Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sango SHG Group in Western Kenya! Loice is the facilitator of the Sango SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Loice takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Loice had a good maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Loice was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Loice  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Loice will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sango SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz, de 67 años, es una mujer buena y amable, esta casada y tiene tres hijos, quienes ya son mayores e independientes, pero vive a lado de su hija en su casa propia desde donde trabaja todos los días y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. EL trabajo de Beatriz consiste en la venta al por menor de bebidas heladas, entre los productos que ofrece son gaseosas de todas las marcas y presentaciones, además de bebidas alcohólicas que solo vende a personas mayores de edad. Lleva realizando este trabajo por cuatro años, lo hace sola  y en su casa. Cuando comenzó con este trabajo vendía solo gaseosas chicas en vidrio, además de algunos helados y hielo, ahora creció de a poco y vende en mayor cantidad y con mejores resultados ya que le esta yendo muy bien y genera buenos ingresos. Cuando no hacia este tipo de negocio en su casa, algunas veces tenía problemas en su economía ya que solo dependía del ingreso que podría traer su esposo, pero con su propio negocio pudo empezar a disponer de sus propios ingresos. Esta muy contenta y desea mantenerse por el momento y mas adelante poner una fuente de soda. Este será el crédito número 12 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un respaldo financiero ya que le dará la garantía de seguir trabajando tranquila. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará bebidas en mayor cantidad y asi poder ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 67, is a good and pleasant woman.  She is married but she has three children who are already grown and independent, but she lives with her daughter in her own house from where she works every day and so is able to improve her quality of life.

Beatriz's job consists of selling cold drinks wholesale.  Among the products she sells are all brands and sizes of soda as well as alcoholic beverages that she sells only to adults.  She has been doing this work for four years.  She does it alone and in her house.  When she began with this work she sold only small sodas in glass bottles as well as some ice cream and ice.  Gradually she grew and now she sells wholesale and with better results, since it is going very well for her and it generates good income.

When she was not doing this kind of work at home, sometimes she had financial problems because she depended only on the income her husband was able to bring home, but with her own business she began to have her own income at her disposal.  She is very happy and wants to get by for the moment and later install a soda fountain.

This will be her twelfth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial help because this will give her the guarantee of continuing to work peacefully.

With the requested loan of 1000 PEN she will buy drinks wholesale to be able to offer more variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of sodas and beer.

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene's group is comprised of 3 hardworking women. Irene is 17 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Irene has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells fish. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fish for resale, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young brothers and sisters. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to buy herself a plot of land. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Irene's future prospects by helping her to learn how to handle her customers.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale,

loans.name: Furimuna

texts.en:
Furimuna lives in Yambio, South Sudan. She sells charcoal and has been in business for 3 years. She is 35 years old and married with two children, both of whom are still in school.

Furimuna heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds (SDG) to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 34 years old and has two children. Emma is married and has one child still in school.

Emma is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Emma has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Alfredo Hernandez

texts.en: I own two car that I use as a taxis to provide tranportation in the city of Danily.  I work from 6:00 am â€“ 7:30 pm therefore I have to give maintenance to both my cars. I need to keep using at least one in order to retian my daily earnings.  I also need to change  the tires in the other.  In my family we are four, two kids, my wife and myself.  I mainly use the income for our everyday life.

loans.use: Maintenance of the taxi

loans.name: Abla

texts.en:
Married and the mother of seven (7) children, Mrs. Abla T. sells corn in her community. She is very dynamic, and stands out through her honesty and courage. Her business allows her to make a very large contribution to the household expenses; her husband, a retired teacher, cannot cover all of these expenses on his retirement pension. Mrs. T., who has a gift for managing her business with exemplary precision, was able to pay back her first credit without any difficulties. Now she is seeking to improve her business by increasing her stock of corn during periods when it is abundant and reselling it when it is in short supply. This new project requires more resources than Mrs. T. currently has. To achieve her goal, she is asking for a credit of $850 that will serve as capital to buy, store, and resell corn. The profit on the sales will help her to better meet the expenses of her household and acheive financial independence.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de sept (7) enfants, Madame T. Abla est une femme commerçante de maïs dans sa localité. Très dynamique, elle s’est fait remarquer par son honnêteté et son courage. A partir de son activité, elle contribue énormément aux charges de son ménage. Son mari, enseignant à la retraite n’arrive pas à couvrir la totalité des besoins avec sa pension de retraite. Douée d’une rigueur exemplaire dans la gestion de ses activités, elle a pu solder son premier crédit sans incident. Aujourd’hui, elle cherche à améliorer son commerce par l’agrandissement du stock de maïs en période d’abondance et le revendre en temps de pénurie. Ce nouveau projet nécessite assez de moyens dont ne dispose pas Madame T. aujourd’hui. Elle sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $850 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat, le stockage et la revente du maïs. Le bénéfice de la vente lui permettra de mieux couvrir les dépenses de son foyer et avoir une autonomie financière.

loans.use: Buying, storing, and reselling corn

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Mr. Benjamin I.. Hails from Edo State, Nigeriaand is married with two (2) children. He sells cooked food to the community and wishes to expand his business with a loan in the above amount.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en:
Vidadi is 51  years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Agdam region, settled in Absheron region. He is married and has 3 children. 
He has been as a private taxi-driver for 15 years. He transports only the members of a family, who hires him.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to to do capital repairs on his car

loans.use: To do capital repairs on his car

loans.name: Glady

texts.en: "People in my community call me 'Mama G' because I am able to meet their need through my provision store," says Mrs. Glady E., who lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with four children and hopes to expand her business with a loan of $800. She has been a leader in the community for 4 years and has 13 years experience in her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es:
Rocio is a hardworking woman who grew up in a family whose business was making furniture such as beds as well as manufacturing mattresses. During her years growing up, Rocio dedicated a lot of time to learning about the sales of furniture and that's why five years ago she decided to start selling the furniture produced in her parents factory on her own. Now, with the experience she has gained, she would like to set up her own furniture shop. Every week she produces pieces to sell, trying to build a better future for her own family. It's hard work, but she produces pieces made with metal which are beautiful and high quality. She would like to grow this business and is requesting a loan to buy the paints and metals needed to produce her furniture. Your help is very important in helping her reach her goals.

Rocío, es una mujer valerosa con gran disposición para el trabajo, ella creció en una familia que se dedica a la fabricación de muebles de metal entre ellas camas y camarotes (camas de dos pisos), también confeccionaban colchones. Durante todos estos años Rocío aprendió y se dedicó durante mucho tiempo a la venta de muebles y es así como hace cinco años se animó a vender lo que producen en la fábrica de su padre de manera independiente.Hoy con el paso de los años y con la experiencia adquirida piensa implementar su propio taller de fabricación de muebles debido a que el conocimiento y buen manejo de recursos le provienen de familia. Por ahora día a día sale todos los domingos a comercializar lo que produjo durante los 6 días anteriores en búsqueda de un futuro mejor para sus dos hijos que la motivan y fortalecen para superar situaciones de escasez económica. A pesar del trabajo duro que requiere la fabricación de muebles asume esta labor sin miramientos y realiza bellos trabajos en metal de excelente calidad y de magnífica presentación. Desea acrecentar su negocio y es por ello que solicita un préstamo para comprar pinturas y algunos fierros que son insumos básicos para la fabricación de los bellos muebles de metal y acude a aquellas personas solidarias que decidan apoyarla. Recuerda tu aporte es muy valioso.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE PAINT AND IRON TO USE IN THE PRODUCTION OF THEIR FINE FURNITURE.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.pt:
Maria Luísa M., born in 1957, lives with her partner and 4 children in the neighborhood of Liberdade, in Maputo, Mozambique where she sells food staples and cleaning supplies from home. She joined the credit program in June of 2006 and is now in her 5th loan cycle. Having paid all previous loans timely, Maria Luísa will be using the current $350 one to increase her business' stock to ensure it will continue to do well. She plans to invest a portion of the profits from her activities into improving her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Luísa M., ´portadora do BI nº110179798T, com 4 filhos vive maritalmente nascida a 29/09/1957, residente no bairro de Liberdade tem o negocio em sua casa vende produtos de primeira necessidade tal com ovos ,Sabão folha de chá bolachas leite papel higiene,etc, com o valor pretende alargar o negocio com os lucros de negocio ela tem comprado bens para a sua casa entrou no programa a 30/06/06 tomando o valor de 5000 mt agora esta no 5º ciclo vai tomar o valor de 8000 mt a pagar em 5 meses.

loans.use: Stock increase

loans.name: Nabweru Iii A 2030(C) Group

texts.en:
Sylvia is 26 years old and married with two children. She has a poultry business. She wants to use the extra profits to construct another poultry house. Edith sells used clothes. Agnes makes and sells snacks. Maregret has a charcoal selling business and wants to use the loan to expand the business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks

loans.name: Khusni

texts.en:
A. Khusni is 48 years old. Khusni is married with 1 child who already studies at the University. 

Khusni sells kids clothing. She has been running the business for 11 years and works hard to keep it successful and generating stable income for her family. Four times a month Khusni travels to the neighboring city of Ura-Tube to buy the new goods to diversify her inventory and meet the needs of her clientele. 

Khusni has been loaned by IMON for several times already. She has proved herself as a reliable client.  Khusni requests $650.00 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. She is planning to purchase the new inventory for the spring season. Khusni promises to pay the loan in time and thanks all for their support.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for kids for the spring season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase capital to invest in rice stock

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Mariama G., age 40, is married and takes care of seven children. She has been a very energetic member of the village bank of Boucotte Nassinkar in Ziguinchor for six years. She wants a loan to buy palm oil to resell and some monkey bread (baobab fruit) and sugar to make ice cream to sell. Her income enables her to support her children and to contribute to her family's well-being. The requested loan will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Mariama G., 40 ans, mariée, 7 enfants en charge est une membre très dynamique du banc villageois de Boucotte Nassinkar à Ziguinchor depuis 6 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter de l’huile de palme à revendre et du pain de singe et du sucre pour faire des crèmes glaces à vendre. Ses revenus lui permettent d’entretenir ses enfants et de contribuer au bien être familial. Le prêt sollicité sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, monkey bread, and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw materials to produce fried dishes

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en: Chhuon S., 55, is married and lives in Kampong Cham province with her husband and their five children. She works in the local market, selling regional specialties like Khmer cakes and desserts, and makes about $2.50 a day. Her husband works in construction, and also makes $2.50 a day, but would like to begin fishing as a source of extra income. The family receives support from some of their older children, who work in Phnom Penh or have their own small businesses. Chhuon S. is seeking a loan of $300 to buy some fishing tools for her husband. This move into the fishing industry will increase the income of the family and allow them to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment.

loans.name: Gulruhon

texts.ru:
Gulruhon D. is a resident of Fayzabad district. She is married and has four children. She is a homemaker and works the land around her home where she grows fruits and raises goats. She would like to get a loan to purchase cattle for milk and to provide her family with dairy products. She will pay back the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva volunteer.

Давлатова Гулрухон жительница района Файзабад. Замужем , имеет четверх детей. Домохозяйка . Занимается домашним хозяйством . где имеет участок земли, фрукты и Коз. Сейчас хочет получить кредит и использовать его на приобретение Крупно-рогатого скота.Это проможет ей получать молоко и обеспечить семью кисло-молочными продуктами. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Mwaka's Salmini Group

texts.en:
Mwaka is 45 years old and married. She takes care of 3 children aged 3 years old. She is a livestock keeper and she has been a firewood seller since 1990. Every day she works from 7 AM to 8 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Mwaka now hopes for a loan to increase her inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with the sale of clothes, perfumes, soft drinks and firewood.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Doña Brígida cumplió 37 años de edad. Es casada y tiene dos hijos  de 19 y 07 años de edad, ella estudió quinto de secundaria, vive en la comunidad de de Machacmarca, Distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia del Collao.

Es socia del Banco Comunal Ciudad Nueva – Machacmarca, hace un año, Brígida se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de vacuno en la ferias de Pilcuyo (Jueves) y en Ilave  (Domingo).

Con este crédito de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, incrementará su capital para comprar 01 toro valor de S/. 1,800.00 Nuevos Soles.

Su sueño es comprar un taxi para que su esposo trabaje y ella  seguir con el negocio aumentando más ganado vacuno para tener mejores ganancias y hacer estudiar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Doña Brígida is 37 years old. She is married and she has two children, one 19 and one 7. She attended school until the fifth year of secondary school, and she lives in the community of Machacmarca, in the District of Pilcuyo, in the Province of Collao. She has been a member of the Community Bank called “Ciudad Nueva Machacamarca” for the past year. Brígida works buying and selling cattle in the markets in Pilcuya (on Thursdays) and in Ilave (on Sundays). With this loan of S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, that she would repay in 4 instalments, she will add to her capital in order to buy 1 bull, valued at S/. 1,800.00 Nuevos Soles. Her dream is to buy a taxi so that her husband could work, and she would continue with the business, increasing her stock of cattle in order to have better earnings so that her children can study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one bull

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana Baji is the wife of M. L. and lives in a small area named Bund Road of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 50 years. Se is the mother of two sons. Both of her sons are job holders. Rehana Baji's husband has a vegetable selling business. He has been in this profession for the last 5 years. Rehana Baji herself has a clothes selling business with 2 years experience. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Nabeela wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Parveen wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell. Samina wants a loan to buy material (beads, sketches and colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business. Parveen Gudu Baji wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Hazel Ivania

texts.es: La señorita Hazel Ivania el barrio Enrique Bermúdez 380, barrió que se ubica en la capital Managua, tiene la edad de 22 años,  se encuentra soltera, actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa y útiles escolares, aparte de tener su negocio trabaja en atención al cliente en la empresa DHL, donde su negocio lo inicio con su novio ambos recogieron para establecerlo, también la señorita Hazel esta estudiando en la universidad y uno de sus planes de vida es poder  finalizar sus estudios y hacer mas grande su negocio, por eso que en estos últimos años ha trabajado con  créditos que Afodenic otorga para invertirlo en su negocio, solicitando actualmente un monto de C$ 9,000.00 aun plazo de 10 meses para comprar mas mercadería para su negocio y poder de esta forma incrementar sus clientes, planes de futuro es poder ir diversificando sus productos y buscar nuevos segmentos de mercado.
texts.en:
Hazel Ivania lives in the town of Enrique Bermúdez 380, located in the capital, Managua. She is 22 and she sells clothing and school supplies.
