Besides running her own business, she also works for DHL as a customer service representative. Ms. Hazel is enrolled in college as well, and one of her goals is to have the required funds to pay for her education and expand her business. Herself and her boyfriend invested together to start the business and, lately, they have worked with Afodenic to obtain credit lines to finance their business. Currently, they seek C$ 9,000.00, to be paid within 10 months, that will be used to diversify their product line and seek new market opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase adults' and children's clothing

loans.name: Judie

texts.es:
La microempresaria Judie J. Malespín tiene 54 años de edad es madre soltera con dos hijos tiene por mas de 20 años un restaurante ubicado en uno de los barrios céntricos de esta ciudad de Bluefields, en donde oferta el servicio de venta de comidas tanto regionales como nacionales y chinas así como   bebidas de diferentes marcas.

La señora J. es bastante conocida principalmente por sectores creoles que la visitan por el tipo de atención y música que tiene en su local. Sin embargo por el alto costo de la vida en esta región con su capital no puede comprar todos los productos que necesita, por lo que solicita se le financie para comprar lo siguiente:


80 libras de carne de res a US$ 1.50 dólares cada libra, 80 libras de carne de cerdo a US$ 1.20 dólares cada libra, 100 libras de pollo a US$ 1.30 dólares cada libra, 1 quintal de arroz americano a US$ 56 dólares cada quintal, 1 bidón de aceite  a US$ 33 dólares cada bidón y 10 cajas de jugos a US$ 6.50 dólares cada caja.
texts.en:
The small-businesswoman Judie J. M. is 54 years old. She is a single mother of two, and for more than 20 years she had had a restaurant located in one of the central neighborhoods of Bluefields. There, she sells both regional foods and ethnic foods, such as Chinese food and the like. She also sells different brands of drinks. Mrs. J. is fairly well known by the creole people who visit her restaurant both for the good service and music. Still, because of the high cost of living in the region and its capital, Mrs. J. can't buy all the products she needs, and because of this, she is asking that you finance her to buy the following: *80 pounds of beef for US$ 1.50/lb *80 pounds of pork for $1.20/lb *100 pounds of chicken for $1.30/lb *1 quintal (46 kg) of American rice for $56/quintal *1 barrel of cooking oil for $33/barrel *10 boxes of juice for $6.50/box

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for the restaurant

loans.name: Yanet

texts.en:
Yanet is a member of the Ayllu (which means “family” in Quechua) Village Bank. She is 30 years old and is married with two children. Yanet has a small store in her home, where she sells sweets in the morning. In the afternoon, she works in a sewing workshop making clothing. She works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. seven days a week. In the summer, Yanet leaves the city of Ayacucho to live and work on her family’s farm in the jungle. 

Yanet is requesting a loan of 1500 soles to put a roof on her home in Ayacucho. Her goal for the future is to buy more sewing machines (she currently has two) so that she can open her own clothing workshop.

loans.use: Build a roof

loans.name: Try

texts.en: Try R., 54, is married with four children and lives in Kampong Cham province. She works grinding and selling rice, making around US$6 each day. Her husband works as a staff member in an organization and is able to generate US$5 each day. Try R. is asking for a loan to purchase rice. She will purchase rice, take off the husks, and resell the rice to turn over a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice and grind for resale.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Sarkhosh

texts.en: Sarkhosh M. is a 60-year-old trader who sells different kinds of food products. He is married and has six children. It is very hard to cover his family's needs with such a big family, but Sarkhosh does his best. He wakes up early in the morning and finishes his job late at night. His dream is to provide to the younger children with a good education. He applied for $1200 in a loan to increase the number of goods he sells. Let's help Sarkhosh and his big family!

loans.use: Purchase food products to resell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth M. is a Tanzanian micro entrepreneur. She runs a business selling water to customers for domestic uses. She owns a well at Mbagala ward in Dar es Salaam. Water is very important and a scarce commodity in many developing countries due to environmental degradation. She plans to drill another well to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to drill a water well.

loans.use: To drill a new well

loans.name: Meach

texts.en: Meach K. is 48 years old and has a business selling chickens and ducks at the market. She earns approximately $7.50 profit per day. She is a widow who lives with three children. She is also supported by one child who works as construction worker. Meach K. requests a loan to purchase chickens and ducks to sell at the market.

loans.use: Purchase chickens and ducks to sell

loans.name: Breny

texts.es: Breny tiene 35 años y es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 2 hijos y tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante. Para su negocio de vender zapatos es una distracción, más que un trabajo, desde muy niña siempre le gustaron los zapatos y ahora que trabaja con ellos se siente muy feliz, es una vendedora muy alegre y conversadora, siempre está viendo la mejor manera de vender su mercadería y agotar su stock. Breny disfruta de aconsejar a sus clientas sobre los zapatos que están de moda o los que mejor combinarán con su ropa. Lleva 18 años en este negocio y espera tener una tienda más grande donde también pueda vender ropa, lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer dentro de su puesto todo el día sin poder salir a la calle para realizar sus actividades. Este es el primer préstamo de Breny con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, puesto que quiere acceder a otros préstamos en el futuro, en su banco comunal es muy alegre. Con el dinero que solicita planea comprar más zapatos para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Breny is 35 years old, and a very happy, hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her two children, and longs to be successful. Her work selling shoes is a hobby as much as it is a job. Ever since she was a little girl she's loved shoes, and now that she's working with them she's very happy. She's a cheerful, talkative saleswoman, and she's always looking for the best way to sell her merchandise and deplete her stock. She enjoys advising her customers on what shoes are in fashion or which go best with their outfits. She's been working in the business 18 years and hopes to have a larger store where she can also sell clothing. What she likes least is having to stay inside all day without being able to go out to take care of other things. This is Breny's first loan with MFP, and she knows she has to make her payments on time and is prepared to do so, since she wants to receive other loans in the future. She's very happy with her community bank. She will use the requested loan to buy more shoes and better stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Mrs. Sen K., 47, has a small store next to her house where she sells produce items. She sells all kinds of vegetables, cooked ingredients, and sweets for kids. She earns an average of $3 per day to feed her family. K.'s husband, working as a military policeman, is the other source for the family's income. The humble couple has four children: two are teenagers and attend school, whilst the others are married and live separately. As K.'s business is the main source of income for the family, she has applied for a loan so that she can increase the size of her workshop. She plans to buy more products to sell so she can earn additional income.

loans.use: To increase size of workshop and to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr: C. Chantal est née le 14 Avril 1971 à Comè, dans le Département du Mono. Chantal est semi-grossiste dans la vente des produits de brasserie. Chantal vend les casiers de boissons de la Société Béninoise de Brasserie (SOBEBRA). Chantal vend aussi les divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.). C’est dans sa boutique construite devant sa maison que Chantal vend ses produits. Chantal a utilisé tous ses revenus pour soigner son mari qui était malade. Cet événement malheureux a beaucoup influencé l’activité de Chantal. Chantal a donc besoin de moyens financiers pour soutenir son activité. C’est pourquoi Chantal sollicite un prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
C. Chantal was born on April 14, 1971 in Comè, in Mono County. She is a semi-wholesaler selling brewery products. She sells cases of beverages from the Société Béninoise de Brasserie (SOBEBRA). Chantal also sell various goods: candy, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardines, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, soaps for the laundry, dishes, and bath, etc. Her shop, set up in front of her house, is where she sells her goods. She has used all of her income to take care of her husband, who is ill. This unhappy event has greatly affected her business. She therefore has need of financing to support her business. This is why she's requesting a loan from ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 30 cases of brewery drinks, a box of canned milk, a box of canned tomatoes, two boxes of laundry and dish soaps, five 5-kg sacks of Gino rice, and two boxes of pasta.

loans.name: Jorgie

texts.en:
Jorgie S. is making a living from raising pigs to sell. She is 28 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Calaran, Calamba Misamis Occidental. Jorgie has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Jorgie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jorgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. Jorgie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Marybeth

texts.en:
Marybeth L. is from the town of Sibutad. She is 38 years old. Marybeth is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marybeth works in a family member's business selling a variety of food products to the local community. Marybeth has been engaged in this work for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marybeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Marybeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan, of 35,000 PHP, to be used for educational and medical purposes. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Marybeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol R. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Carol is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Carol owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The primary--but not only--source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Carol has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos (or about $40 US) a month from these activities.

In June 2009, Carol joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Carol is requesting a loan of 3000 pesos (or about $75) which will be used to purchase livestock and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Carol from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to make improvements on her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 65 años, vive con su esposo de 69 años y su nieta, quien ocasionalmente pasa un tiempo con ellos, ya que su hija es independiente. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de joyas por catálogo, actividad que ha venido realizando gracias a la motivación de su hija quien la introdujo en el mundo el negocio, ya que ella también se dedicaba a este rubro, pero pasado el tiempo encontró un trabajo más estable y dejó de lleno el negocio a su madre. Ahora Rosa se apropió netamente de su trabajo y le va muy bien, ya que cada vez logra mejores ventas por su cordialidad, amabilidad y poder de convencimiento, pues ofrece joyas de calidad y garantía, bañadas en oro de diferentes kilates. A Rosa le gusta mucho su trabajo puesto que le permite mantenerse ocupada y generar un ingreso extra al de su esposo. Ella espera muy pronto incrementar sus ganancias y con ellas dedicarse al alquiler de habitaciones, y ahora mismo ya está arreglando un mini departamento para ponerlo en alquiler. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más joyas para tenerlas de reserva y poder ofrecerlas a sus clientas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 65 years old and lives with her 69-year-old husband. Their granddaughter also lives with them sometimes, since their daughter is independent. For the past two years, Rosa has been selling jewelry by catalog, thanks to her daughter, who introduced her to the business world and encouraged her. Her daughter used to sell catalog jewelry, but as time went by she found more stable work and passed her catalog jewelry business on to her mother. Rosa has fully taken over the business, now, and it is going very well. She is selling more and more merchandise thanks to her cordiality, friendliness, and persuasiveness. The jewelry she sells is of guaranteed high quality and comes bathed in different karats of gold. Rosa really enjoys her work, since it keeps her busy and helps generate some extra income to add to to her husband's earnings. She hopes to increase her income very soon so that she can use the profits to start another business renting out rooms; she's currently fixing up a mini-apartment to rent out. This is her sixth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has always made all of her payments very punctually. With the requested loan, she plans to buy more jewelry to have in stock to offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jewelry

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita.
Victoria es casada, tiene 55 años y 10 hijos, Victoria viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. venD. comida y D. las ferias compra cereales, papa, queso y animales que venD. en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Victoria necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y cereales.
Los sueños D. Victoria son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Sarita Community Bank. She is a 55-year-old married mother of 10 children. She travels to the different markets in the region to sell food and also purchase grains, potatoes, cheese and animals to sell in the city of Ayacucho, Peru. Victoria is requesting a loan of 2000 soles (approximately $700), which she plans to use for the purchase of rice, sugar and grains. Her dreams are for her children to finish their studies and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar and grains

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 27-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa Valley with his wife and their child. Husein has owned shop where he sells spare car parts since 2003. Husein has requested a loan of $2000 USD from Al Majmoua to purchase spare parts for his garage. This is the first time that Husein has requested a loan. 

Husein is special because he knows how to treat his clients and sells good quality products, even thought they are used. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Husein decided to start his business because he likes his work. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare car parts for his garage.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim H., age 62, lives along National Road Number Five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has five children: one son and four daughters. Four of them were married and live outside the family home and the other one is a garment factory worker. 

Sim has been selling meals in front of a garment factory for five years. Besides this business, she also grows rice. Sim doesn’t have enough capital to use for farming so she is applying for her first loan of $1,200 to purchase a water pumping machine, pipe, rice seed and pesticide.

loans.use: To purchase water pumping machine, pipe, rice seed and pesticide for her growing rice business.

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Say T. is 58 years old and resides in Kampong Cham province with her husband and four of her children. She works together with her husband as farmers who are able to make approximately US$4 every day. This couple is also supported by some of the children who raise ducks from home. This business is allows them to make US$12 in revenue each day.

Say T. is asking for a loan of US$ 750 to purchase more ducks to breed. (Say's son is pictured.)

loans.use: Raise ducks.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia L. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old. Eugenia is separated from her spouse and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Eugenia owns & operates a business selling fish in the local market and to local members in the community. Her husband is a fisherman so she sells the fish he catches. Eugenia has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eugenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eugenia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Eugenia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
The smiling-faced person shown in the picture is Mrs. T., who lives with her family members in Siem Reap Province. T., 55, sells various kinds of vegetables at the market and earns approximately US$ 2 profit a day. Besides her current work, she also cultivates rice on her own farmland.

T. was married, but her husband died of senility, and she has seven children. T. runs her business very well because she has skills in communication which she uses with her customers. To meet the needs of her customers, T. is looking for a loan to buy various vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy various vegetables to sell

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara tiene 30 años, vive a lado de su esposo (Juan) que tiene 36 años y sus tres pequeños hijos que son su adoración; Ángela de 10, Pilar de 8 y Betzabe de 5 años.

Ella ayuda a su esposo en las labores de cultivo de la papa en la chacra que tienen en la región sierra del Perú, juntos trabajan sin parar, día a día, bajo el cielo azul de la ciudad de Tarma; es así  como han sacado adelante a sus hijos, trabajando al máximo la tierra que buenamente les provee buenas cosechas. Ellos comercializan la papa después de cada cosecha y obtienen ganancias que les permiten tener una vida digna. A Clara le gusta ayudar a su esposo, porque lo hace de vez en cuando y no descuida la crianza de sus pequeños hijos, ya que su chacra está muy cerca de su casa. 
Para el futuro esta pareja de sacrificados agricultores tienen pensado mejorar la siembra comprando abono y medicamentos para las plantas, asimismo desean sembrar maíz y alverjas.

Este es el tercer préstamo que Clara tiene con MFP y promete cumplir como siempre lo hace con cada uno de sus pagos. Ella tiene pensado comprar abono para ayudar a mejorar la siembra de papa de su esposo y así lograr darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus menores hijos.
texts.en:
Clara is 30, and she lives at the side of her 36 year old husband, Juan, and their three children whom she adores. Ángela is 10, Pilar is 8, and Betzabe is 5. She helps her husband in his work of cultivating potatoes on the farm they have in the mountainous region of Perú. Under the blue sky in the city of Tarma they work together day to day without stopping. That is how they have gotten their children ahead. They work the land to the maximum, and it provides them with good harvests. They sell the potatoes after each harvest, and they get earnings that allow them to have a decent life. Clara likes to help her husband because she does it once in a while, and she does not neglect caring for her small children. Her farm is very close to her house. In the future, this pair of sacrificing farmers plans to improve their planting by purchasing fertilizer and medicines for the plants. They wish to plant corn and peas. This is Clara’s third loan with MFP. She promises, as always, to make all of her payments. She plans to buy fertilizer to help improve her husband’s potato planting. That way they will be able to give their minor children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa sells groceries, drinks and rechargeable phone cards at retail prices. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family. She has been in this business for a long time.

Hawa is a Lift above Poverty Organization (LAPO) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Hawa hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries, and rechargeable phone cards to sell.

Hawa is 40 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 23 years old, single, and currently in the family house. He lives in a small community which is a suburb of Offinso, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. He is a very hard working gentleman who runs a chemical store and sells various kinds of drugs like blood tonic, pain killers, malaria drugs, etc. Many local people patronize his drugs as first aid and cures for when they are sick.

He has been in business for five years now and the shop was opened for him by his father. He is among the few people who run a licensed chemical shop in the community. His chemical shop is registered to operate by Ghana pharmaceutical council. He wants to use the loan to buy an increased supply of drugs to include others that are frequently requested by her customers. He hopes to raise a good income to take care of his family. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of pharmaceutical drugs.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 41 años, 01 hijo que aun estudia y depende de ella.

Rosa, es una mujer trabajadora, que se siente capaz de cumplir sus metas y sueños, hace varios años, que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, siempre contando con el apoyo de su pareja. Y con su primer préstamo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, le brindo; implemento mucho más su negocio, ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado. Hoy en la actualidad ya cuenta con  mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad, es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su tienda a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Rosita, como le dicen de cariño hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Esmeralda Communal Bank, Tarapoto District, San Martín Province, San Martín Department. She has a live-in partner, is 41 years old, and has 1 child who still studies and is dependent on her. Rosa is a hard-working woman who feels capable of reaching her goals and dreams. Several years ago she began to sell groceries, always counting on her partner's support. And with the first loan that the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva's field partner) gave her, she greatly expanded her business, located in her own house, a very well air-conditioned space. She now has a lot of experience with this type of activity and is very well-known and loved by her customers. She has a very loyal customer base. They come daily to shop at her store, where they expect to find everything a housewife needs, and she personally assists them with the charisma that characterizes her. With this loan of 3,000.00 soles, she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packages of noodles, milk and several brands of canned fish, housecleaning tools and personal hygiene products to continue giving better service to her customers. Rosita, as she is affectionately known, feels very fulfilled and desires to go on to make her dreams reality. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business and also for helping many women who want to grow as businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products to supply her business

loans.name: Obedi

texts.en:
A. Obedi is 32 years old and married with two children who are not yet in school because of their young age. 

He is a businessman involved in the buying and selling of charcoal that he gets from the villages and stocks for his customers in his stall. He has been in this kind of business for five years, and since he knows how to handle his customers, he is able to make approximately $77 in weekly profits that are enabling him to grow. 

As a result, he has been able to buy land and animals like cows and goats and so on. Obedi needs a loan to be able to stock more bags of charcoal for resale, since buying in bulk enables him to get goods at a reduced price.

loans.use: Buying more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Yehlen

texts.en:
Yehlen M. is active in one of our ASHI centers. Since joining our organization, she has applied for and received two loans and successfully repaid both of them. Now she is applying for a new loan, from Kiva and its field partner ASHI, to increase the inventory of her variety or sari-sari store, which she was able to open after receiving her first two loans. 

“Sari-sari” is a Filipino term for variety, and a “sari-sari” store is a small business that sells basic goods. Such stores are located in almost every block of a typical Filipino village. It is also the easiest way for people to earn a little profit without leaving their own home. However, to Yehlen, her store means everything. It is the source of food for her two children, aged three and seven, a way to pay for their education, and a way for her to battle against poverty and for justice for her husband, who is presently in jail. With a hope that someday she will earn enough money to hire a lawyer and free him, Yehlen is determined to grow her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell from her store.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim R. is from the village of Artadi, Misamis Oriental.  She is 30 years old, married and has one school-aged children.  To make a living, Kim operates a cab  service in her local community . Kim has been in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Kim joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  Kim has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI to expand her business.  Kim is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to purchase materials needed to provide more services.  This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI.
-----------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to provide more services.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main source of living for Johanna, 34. She supports four children in her family, of whom the eldest is still 17 years old. Her rice field is just big enough to provide their basic needs.

Johanna joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to obtain a loan to finance her business with a low interest rate. She’s requesting 14,000 Php to buy farm necessities and to sustain her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Having ten children in the family requires more courage of Leonila. With her fishing business, she is able to provide for them. She hopes to educate them and to be physically healthy. With her loan through Community Economic Ventures, Inc., she wants to make each payment on time.

Leonila, 48, is currently requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP.  This loan will help her buy an engine for her boat and some crab traps.

loans.use: To buy an engine for her boat and some crab traps

loans.name: Arnelito

texts.en:
Arnelito W. is from the village of Rogondon Iligan City. He is 42 years old. Arnelito is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Arnelito owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Arnelito and his wife has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arnelito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Arnelito is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Arnelito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia K. is 46 years old and married to Haron Kipsomet. They live in Kabarnet and have four children.

Julia makes cakes which she later sells at a profit. She started this business three years ago and every month the business yields a profit of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). Her husband’s salary brings in an additional income of 8,000 KES every month. Her business is in the Kasoyo Women’s Building and her clients are supportive and faithful.

Julia had borrowed another loan from another bank before she joined KADET. She came to know of KADET through one of our clients. She has borrowed a loan of 80,000 KES which she plans to use to buy ingredients for her cake baking business. If this loan boosts her business, she will use the extra profit to add stock and expand her business further.

She has hopes to enlarge the business and open a bakery. She also dreams of owning a car of her own.

Julia describes herself as hardworking, polite, faithful, and God fearing.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for cake production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes"

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La Sra. María C. es socia del banco comunal Poloma hace 3 años, siendo invitada por su mamá a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras, vive en la comunidad de Maluay que pertenece a la parroquia el Valle, esta parroquia se caracteriza por sus verdes campos, llenas de cultivos de maíz, papas, etc., su gente es muy trabajadora, luchadora y siempre están en la búsqueda de un mejor futuro a sus familias.

Nuestra socia tiene 25 años de edad, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa relación ha concebido 3 hijos que se encuentran de 8, 6, 5 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en la escuela, su esposo es maestro en la rama de la construcción, aun no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros.

Doña María se dedica al arreglo de casas hace 3 años, en donde labora de 8 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m., también se dedica a la cría de animales como son pollos y cuyes, los mismos que vende en la ciudad de Cuenca. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento, su meta es de llegar a construir su casa propia para vivir junto a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. María C. has been a member of the Poloma Communal Bank for three years. She was invited by her mother to join this great group of determined and enterprising women. María lives in the community of Maluay, which is part of El Valle Parish. This parish is known for its green fields full of corn, potatoes, and other crops. The local people work hard and struggle to achieve a better future for their families.

María is 25 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 8, 6, and 5) that resulted from that relationship. The two older children are in school. Her husband works as a carpentry teacher. They do not have their own home, so they current live with her in-laws.

Doña María has been cleaning houses for three years and works from 8am until 3pm. She also raises animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs, and sells them in the city of Cuenca. This loan will be used to buy chickens and poultry feed. Her goal is to build a house of her own where she can live with her entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens & poultry feed

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann T. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Mary Ann is single. Mary Ann owns & operates a general store shere she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month..

In 2010, Mary Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Ann from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a father of four sons. He owns a farm in Rafah, a city in the Gaza Strip, where he raises goats and sheep. Mahmoud provides butchers with goats, and since the holy month of Ramadan is around the corner, he wanted to increase the number of goats he sells in order to increase his returns.

A $1,000 loan from FATEN helped Mahmoud to purchase the goats and guarantee a better return this season. Mahmoud is also trying to save money, because his oldest son is 15, and he will need money soon to pay for his children's college education.

In the video, Mahmoud appears on his farm.

loans.use: Purchase goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María F. G. se dedica a la comercialización de toda clase de mercancía especialmente electrodomésticos, ropa y calzado; vive en el Municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 18 a 39 años. María del Carmen es toda una experta en negocios, porque siempre, desde el año 1986, ha tenido uno: el primero fue un restaurante con su esposo, cuando éste se pensionó; luego una peluquería en su propia casa, al que adicionó la venta de prendas de oro y en el 1991 viajaba y traía mercancía para la venta desde Maicao, municipio fronterizo con Venezuela, pero cuando esta forma de negociar no fue rentable y empezó a encontrar en Barranquilla mercancía a buen precio, se dedicó exclusivamente a la venta de esta mercancía variada , mediante el sistema de crédito. María ha recibido 6 créditos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que ha amortizado efectivamente, su credikiva es su séptimo crédito, con él comprará una lavadora, ropa, calzado y una balanza para negocio, todo esto ya encargado. Los financiamientos otorgados a María del Carmen han sido muy valiosos, porque con ellos ha logrado utilidades, convertidas hoy en aportes para su hogar, especialmente en lo que tiene que ver con la alimentación, el vestuario de sus hijos, apoyo a sus nietos y el poder contar siempre un capital efectivo para compras de oportunidad e inversión para su negocio. Aun sigue con el sueño de tener un restaurante bien organizado, porque le apasiona el área de preparación de alimentos. Sus desafíos están relacionados con la oferta de mercancías que hace la competencia, que muchas veces suele ser más económica, pero ella está en la tarea de explicarle a sus clientes, la relación del precio con la durabilidad como elementos de calidad, con la que ella trabaja. María F. es una mujer muy activa participa en la Junta de acción comunal del barrio donde vive, donde hace mucha gestión comunitaria, por eso la conocen en Soledad y además siempre está a la expectativa de captar nuevos clientes reales que le signifiquen ingresos.
texts.en:
María F. G. makes a living selling all types of merchandise, especially household appliances, clothing, and shoes. She lives in the city of Soledad, which is 15 minutes away from Barranquilla, with her husband and four children who range in age from 18 to 39. María del Carmen is an expert at her business because she has always worked in her own venture since 1986. The first business she had was a restaurant she managed with her husband when he became a pensioner. Later she started a beauty salon in her home and eventually began selling gold jewelry in 1991. María also traveled and brought back merchandise to sell from Maicao, a town that lies near the border with Venezuela. Whenever her traveling retail business became less profitable, she began purchasing merchandise in Barranquilla at a better price. Now she devotes herself exclusively to selling different types of merchandise on credit.

María has received six previous loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and has paid them off effectively. This Kiva loan will be her seventh one and she will use it to purchase a washing machine, clothing, shoes, and a scale for her business since she has already received orders for these items. The loans that were provided to María del Carmen have been valuable because they helped her generate income to buy products for her home, especially food and clothing for her children. She also supports her grandchildren, so she would like to have sufficient capital so that she can take advantage of buying opportunities and investments in her business. She continues to dream of having a well-organized restaurant once again because she is passionate about preparing food. Her greatest challenge with her retail business is competition because there have been many instances in which other merchants sell goods that are much cheaper. However, it is her job to explain to her customers the relationship between price and specific elements of quality such as durability.

María is an active board member of the community action committee in her neighborhood, which does a lot of work related to community development. She is well-known in Soledad and is always looking for new customers to help generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a washing machine, clothing, shoes, and a scale

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TESORITO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Mario;  El socio tiene39 años de edad, el socio es soltero y es empleado en el diario del Cusco; asi mismo el socio tiene un taller de mecánica, el socio administra su taller y por horas va a la redacción del periódico. El socio necesita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para implementar su taller de mecánica. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en su taller de mecánica. 
      
El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Little Treasure” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Mario he is 39 years old, he is single and works for the Cusco newspaper, he also has a mechanics’ shop, he manages his business and for some hours he goes to write for the newspaper. The member needs the loan to buy spare parts to set up his mechanic’s shop.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to him through this medium and is equally committed to meet with the payments of his quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy spare parts for his mechanic’s shop.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: For the last two years, Ricardo D. of Sto. Niño has made a living raising hogs. He is married and has five children, and he and his wife work hard to support their family. Together, they earn about 3,000 PHP a month. Ricardo also tills a small parcel of land where he plants and harvests rice. He would like to expand his businesses but is hampered by a lack of funds. He recently learned about our lending program, and is applying for his first loan to buy items he needs for his farm, such as additional livestock and feed, medicine and vitamins for his hogs. He hopes this loan will allow him to increase his income, better care for his family and expand his small livestock and farming businesses.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming and livestock businesses

loans.name: Hanifaan Nazar Ali's Group

texts.en:
Hanifaan lives in a small city called Borewala which is famous in Pakistan for its shrines. She owns a small house of two rooms in an area named Habib colony and lives in it with her family. She is a caring lady and prefers to spend her time at home managing the household chores and taking care of her family.

Her husband's name is N. A. and he is a private entrepreneur who deals in a leather-selling business. He supplies the leather to the factories to make a living for his family. He is very responsible by nature. By being the only breadwinner, he works hard for his family so they never face any difficulty with the basic necessities of life. 

Through serving his customers for 10 years, he is given respect by them and they appreciate him for his hard work. By the grace of God, he has obtained larger orders from his customers and for timely fulfillment of these orders he needs to take out a loan. Therefore, Hanifaan has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah. With the loan amount, her husband will buy leather to fill his orders on time.

Hanifaan is confident that by using the loan amount her husband will be able to fill the larger orders on time thus enabling him to earn a good income for his family.

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Hanifaan.

loans.use: To buy leather to fill larger orders on time

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is a small market entrepreneur from Berdyansk. She sells shoes, sandals, slippers, flip-flops, etc. in one of the local marketplaces in her home town. Mariya launched the enterprise 10 years ago and currently has 20,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her income amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Mariya is requesting a 1,000 Grivnya loan to re-stock her merchandise with seasonal inventory. She has gained a good reputation among her fellow entrepreneurs and customers. She is hard-working, enterprising, and full of energy. She is ready to invest in further development of her business.  

Note: this is a short-term express loan that will be repaid in four weeks.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. Ricardo is married and has six children. His younger children still go to school and he wants them to finish college and have bright futures. To make a living, Ricardo owns & operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Ricardo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ricardo has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ricardo is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Majeeda's Group

texts.en:
Majeeda has 2 sons and a daughter. All of them are illiterate and could not get an education due to financial reasons.   She herself is a seamstress and stitches clothes for her neighboring clients to contribute to her family financially. 

Her husband is a scrap dealer. He supplies scrap to different factories and also to different scrap shops for profit. He has been doing this business for many years and has good experience in this field. 

Majeeda has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in purchasing scraps in bulk quantity.  That will not only cut his cost but also help him to fulfill the orders on time. 

She is hopeful that an investment will help her husband make his business better and provide better a financial life to the family. She has a plan to send her children to school after husband's business condition improved. 
 
Majeeda lives in a small city named Borewala with her husband and family. Her home is located in the area named Majid colony which is a small residential area of the city.  

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Francisca Benita

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Las Increíbles.

Aquí conversamos con las señora Francisca, ella tiene 61 años de edad, hace unos  años se separo de su marido y fruto de aquella relación tuvo 7 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, en la actualidad en su casa vive un nieto que es como su hijo el cual tiene 15 años y estudia en colegio.

Además de ser una buena ama de casa también se dedica a realizar trabajos y manualidades hechas con fomix, ella realiza sus obras en su casa y luego las lleva a Guayaquil a un bazar que es de su sobrina a la que ella le entrega todos sus trabajos para que allá los comercialice, realiza trabajos como  abecedarios y en la actualidad está haciendo muchos adornos navideños,  nos cuenta que su trabajo es muy solicitado en temporada de clases, tiene pedidos de miles de unidades. Trabaja desde las 9am hasta las 16 h00, de lunes a viernes.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar fomix, pegamento, pinturas, crayones y otros materiales para sus trabajos. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gustan las reuniones. Su sueño es ver que su nieto termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
The members of the Las Increíbles (The Incredible Ones) communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Bahía de Caraquez, known for its beaches, rich gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

We chatted with Francisca here.  He is 61 years old and was separated from her husband a few years ago.  She had 7 children with him all of whom are now adults.  Her grandson who is 15 years old and like a son to her lives with her and goes to school.

Besides being a good housewife she also makes crafts out of Foamex.  She makes the crafts at home and then takes them to Guayaquil to a store her niece has.  She gives her all her creations to be sold there.  She makes such items as alphabets and currently is making lots of Christmas decorations.  She tells us that her work is quite sought after during school terms; she has pending orders numbering in the thousands of units.  She works from 9am until 4pm, Monday through Friday.

This loan will be used to buy Foamex, glue, paints, crayons and other materials for her work.  This is her third cycle in the communal bank.  She likes the meetings.  Her dream is to see her grandson complete his education.

loans.use: To buy Foamex, glue, paints and crayons.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
María de 34 años, es comerciante informal de ropa y zapatos en las distintas zonas de Paraíso (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas). 

Vive con su esposo y dos hijos en el Paraíso de Guayaquil. María ha sido una mujer trabajadora que siempre le ha gustado tener su propio dinero por eso comenzó con la venta de ropa puerta a puerta. Tiene distintos horarios de trabajo ya que debe atender a sus hijos. Como es tiempo de lluvia se le hace poco dificultoso recorrer las calles. 

Ella quiere seguir trabajando por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y zapatos y así sus clientes tengan más variedad al comprar la mercadería. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old and sells clothing and shoes in different parts of Paraíso (in the peri-urban areas where there are dirt roads and houses in the mountains).

She lives with her husband and two children in Paraíso in Guayaquil.  María is a hard worker who has always enjoyed having her own money.  She began selling clothing through door-to-door sales and now works different shifts so she can attend to her children.  Since it is now the rainy season it is hard for her to get out into the streets.

She would like to continue working and wants to use the loan to buy clothing and shoes in order to provide more variety to her customers.  Her plans for the future include growing her business and making home improvements.

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Phylis Wanjiku

texts.en: Phylis K. is 36 year old, married, and has three children, all of whom attend school.  She has been farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers and this is her first loan.  She plans to use the loan to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer.  In the future, Phylis hopes to also practice dairy farming to diversify her sources of income.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda, 36 years old, is from the town of Panglao. She is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the transportation sector, providing "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) services. Glenda has been engaged in this business for four years now.

Glenda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glenda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Glenda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Joseph Mwangi

texts.en:
Joseph has operated his retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last nine years.  He is 45 years old, married to Hannah Ngendo, and they have four children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of the field officers and this will be his third loan.  He has repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy flour, sugar and cooking fat in bulk.

In future, Joseph hopes to grow his retail shop and stock different kinds of products.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and cooking fat in bulk

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is single. She lives in Berdichev. Irina runs a clothing sales business in the central marketplace of her home town. She sells headgear, hose and other clothing items. Moreover, she sells pre-packed seeds, too. Irina is very friendly with customers and is always ready to offer the clients what they are looking for. Presently, she has 45,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her income is over 9,000 Grivnyas a month.    

Irina is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to open a new vending facility and stock it with clothing merchandise. She always tries to attract potential customers with quality merchandise so that they will trust her and come back for more shopping. This business is the main source of income for Irina. She is hoping to continue growing her business, opening additional vending locations in the future.

loans.use: To open a new vending facility and stock it with merchandise

loans.name: Serah Njeri

texts.en:
Serah has practised farming in Ndunyu, Njeru town the last 20 years.  She is 62 years old and a widow. Her husband died and she's taking care of their children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Serah hopes to buy more land and practise large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El Sr. Alfredo T. R. está casado con Maria Colina de profesión modista, quien también es cliente recurrente de la  Fundación Paraguaya.
El es carpintero y actualmente posee dos operaciones activas.
El cliente tiene una carpintería en su casa propia, ubicada en San Isidro de la ciudad de Encarnación, con más de 10 años de antigüedad en su profesión.
El comenta que gracias a los créditos recibidos de la institución ha podido ir creciendo en su actividad comprando materiales, y gracias a esta actividad el puede solventar cualquier gasto imprevisto que se le pudiera presentar.
Por ello solicita nuevamente otro préstamo de Kiva, con el que pueda comprar una cierra eléctrica para poder agilizar sus trabajos y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Alfredo T. R. is married to Maria Colina who is a dressmaker.  She is also a long-standing client of Fundación Paraguaya.

Alfredo is a carpenter and he currently has two active operations.  He has a carpenter's workshop which is located in his own home, in San Isidro, in the town of Encarnación.  He has been in this trade for more than 10 years.

Alfredo tells us that, thanks to the loans he has received from the institution, he has been able to grow in his business, buying materials and, thanks to his business, he can cover any unforeseen expense that could present itself.

Alfredo is requesting a new Kiva loan which he will use to buy an electric saw to make his jobs run more smoothly and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy an electric saw

loans.name: Dugersuren

texts.en:
Dugersuren is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three children, one son and two daughters, in their own house in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife is a salesperson in a private retail trading store. His twins, a boy and a girl, attend secondary school while the youngest child, age 3, goes to kindergarten. He operates a public transportation service between Zavhan and Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He started his business in 2002. 

Since then he deposited and saved his earnings in order to buy a small plot of land where he built a house for their family. Before that he used to live in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in someone else's backyard. Also he managed to renew his car twice with profits he earned. 

Now he wants to finish the construction work on his house that has been left to be fixed in the future. He is a hard-working and honest man who says, "I am doing my best to better my family's living conditions." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials for his house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justina; ella tiene 78 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio  de venta de leña, piedras, ella tiene un cantera que es un lugar donde venden piedras, también la socia se dedica a vender chicha, gallinas y cuyes, el negocio de venta de animales lo realiza en forma ambulatoria y por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar en sus diferentes negocios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimento para los animales.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to Las Triunfadoras communal bank which is located in the Andahuaylillas district of  Quispicanchis province in Cusco department.

She is Justina, 78, widowed, and she has 5 children.  Justina mixes her daily activities with her business of selling firewood and stones. She has a quarry where she sells the stones.   Justina also sells chicha (Peruvian alcoholic drink), chickens, and guinea pigs.   The animal sales are done as a street vendor and with these small businesses, she helps her children get ahead.  She would like to improve her various businesses and she is requesting a loan to buy animal feed.

This member is happy for the financing and promises to make the payments in the established time period.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 62 años, es una mujer perseverante y muy correcta en sus acciones, ella hace muchos años se separó de su pareja,  con el que tiene un hijo, que ya conformó su propio hogar, por ello vive sola en su domicilio propio, ubicado en el caserío de Huaylahuichan. A pesar de la edad y de vivir sola, aún tiene metas que alcanzar porque el motor de su vida es su hijo y porque ama las tierras que la vieron nacer y crecer, “aquí yo crecí comiendo choclo, papa sancochada, cancha, en otro lugar no me acostumbro, porque me molesta el ruido de la ciudad y acá siempre tienes que comer” cuenta Juana, quien se dedica a cultivo de maíz, papa y arveja, en los terrenos que le heredaron sus padres. Ella trabaja sola, lo que más le gusta es sembrar alfalfa porque después de cortarlos, retoña hasta cuatro veces y puede durar 3 años con buena producción, “tienes que regarlos cada 8 días”, comenta. A la vez  cría 150 cuyes  en su vivienda, que vende al por mayor para consumo (carne) y producción (cría). Según cuenta está vez vendió un buena cantidad de ellos por lo que pudo pagar sus cuentas. Como sus actividades son bastante rentables, está pensando vivir con su nieto Marco de 15 años, por ello piensa dedicarse al negocio de venta de alfalfa y de cuy pues quiere apoyarlo con los gastos de sus estudios. Ahora ella se está recuperando de la pérdida que tuvo en la cosecha de arveja, que vendió a bajo precio, pues se malograron por las variaciones climáticas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva esperanza”, y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde manifiesta “yo no confió en otra entidad, porque nos ofrecen beneficios y al final no cumplen, además no se preocupan por ti como en está institución, donde estoy feliz trabajando en mi banco comunal”. Juana, preparará la tierra para su próxima siembra de alfalfa, pues se malogró la raíz de su cultivo por lo que no retoña en el tamaño adecuado. Motivo por lo que comprará semilla de las mismas, como también fertilizantes naturales para que crezcan adecuadamente. Y si el dinero le alcanza comprará cuyes medianos entre hembras y machos, para asegurar su reproducción.
texts.en: Juana is 62 years old. She is a persevering woman and very polite. She separated from her partner many years ago, with whom she has a son that already has his own home. That is why she lives alone in her own home, located on a farmhouse of Huaylahuichan. Despite her age and living alone, she still has goals to achieve, because the driving force of her life is her son and because she loves the land that saw her be born and grow up. "I grew up here eating corn, boiled potatoes, and dirt. I can't get accustomed to another place, because the noise of the city bothers me and you always have to eat there," says Juana, who cultivates corn, potatoes, and peas on the land that she inherited from her parents. She works alone. What she likes the most is to plant alfalfa because after cutting it down, it sprouts up to four times and can last three years with a good output. "You have to water them once a week," she comments. At the same time, she raises 150 guinea pigs in her dwelling. She sells them mostly to be consumed (meat) and to be produced (raised). According to her, she says that this time she sold a good quantity of them so that she could pay her bills. Since her activities are fairly profitable, she is thinking about living with her grandson Marco, who is 15 years old. That is why she plans to focus on the business of selling alfalfa and guinea pigs--she wants to support him with the costs of his studies. Now she is recuperating from the loss that she had in the pea harvest. She sold them below price because they were ruined by changes in the climate. She belongs to the communal bank "Nueva esperanza" ["New Hope"]. This is the 7th loan with MFP where she expresses, "I didn't trust another entity, because they offer us benefits and in the end don't follow through. Besides, they don't worry about you like this institution, where I am happy working in my communal bank." Juana will prepare the land for the next planting of alfalfa. The roots of her crop were ruined, therefore, they didn't sprout in the adequate size. She will buy seeds of the same kind, as well as natural fertilizers so that they grow adequately. And if money remains, she will buy medium-sized female and male guinea pigs, to ensure their reproduction.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa seeds, fertilizers and guinea pigs.
